name: Runes Way
description:
Runes Way is a deck of 31 hexagonal cards that are designed primarily for playing games in the live action role-playing (LARP) world of Empire which is run by Profound Decisions. Players do not need to know anything about LARP, The Empire or runes to enjoy the games.

Runes Way comes with rules for three quick and simple real-time mini-games designed by The Guild of Good Games called The Way of The Runes, The Runes of The Way and Runic Skein'. There is a further turn-based solo or cooperative game challenge called Paragon's Path. The cards can also be combined together into The Runes Way Labyrinth puzzle that forms an elaborate structure with hidden meanings for those who seek its secrets. Finally, the cards may also be used for divination purposes using the Wheel of Meaning method of Rune-Reading.

The Runes Way cards each feature six runes from the world of Empire. One of the runes on each card will match exactly one other rune on any other card - this is a similar feature to that used in the game of Dobble where one symbol on every card matches a symbol on any other card. The Runes Way cards may be placed adjacent to each other to connect matching runes along adjoining edges, enabling cards to be connected into a line - this has similarities to how pieces connect in dominoes. Since the shapes of many of the runes are very similar, it can be challenging to quickly spot which runes match correctly.

There are 2 similar but slightly different standard editions of the Runes Way deck (the Blood Red Runes Edition and the Empress Lisabetta Memorial Edition). These may be combined together to increase the number of players who can play the different games, and to add variety and additional challenge to the gameplay.
categories: Card Game, Game System, Maze, Real-time
mechanics: Connections, Matching, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Tile Placement

name: Dart Bros vs Zombos
description:
Dart Bros vs Zombos is a 1-4 player, cooperative darts game that puts you in the hero role. Be a Dart Bro (or Sis) and help save fleeing people from the Tinkerbrians and their horde of terrifying Zombos.

Each player chooses their own darts skill level (novice, expert, or pro).

The horde is created out of the Zombo deck.
The cards will tell you where your targets are
Fire 3 darts each turn to eliminate the incoming Zombos
Each round more Zombos appear and move closer towards you
If bitten, lose a dart. Lose 3 darts, you are eliminated
Use special item cards strategically to help ensure victory


To win, use your skill and strategy to make it past the Tinkerbrains and their Zombos while saving as many people as you can. Add up your points to see how well you did and who is the best Zombo slayer on your team!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Zombies
mechanics: Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Finale Ending, Player Elimination, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Flee the Dungeon!
description:
Three brave heroes have been kidnapped by a wicked sorcerer and imprisoned inside a dungeon! To escape, they must recover their lost items, locate the dungeon key, and reach the exit—all while avoiding the dangers that lurk within the dungeon corridors. But beware the Sorcerer, whose arsenal of ferocious monsters, deadly traps, and powerful spells threaten to halt the heroes’ escape and entomb them in the dungeon forever...

Flee the Dungeon! is a fast-paced 3-on-1 tile placement game that’s easy to learn and highly replayable. Assuming the roles of the captured heroes, three players take turns placing dungeon tiles in hopes of locating their lost items and making their escape. The fourth player assumes the role of the Sorcerer, who wields an array of monsters and magical spells that can be used to stop the heroes from reaching safety. The gameplay makes use of resource management and light "press your luck" mechanics, giving players a wealth of strategies to explore with each playthrough. Each game plays in 60 minutes or less.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Miniatures Set 2
description:
This expansion for Car Wars Sixth Edition adds new miniatures and cards giving you new weapons and equipment customization options for your vehicle builds.

This expansion includes::

Five miniatures: Spark, Pure Energy, Redline, Sledge, and Apollo! (Miniatures are pre-assembled and unpainted.)
148 cards (weapons, accessories, upgrades, structures) and rules
Four colored bases (red, yellow, blue, and green)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Impulse Movement, Race, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Baltic Empires: The Northern Wars of 1558-1721
description:
"Baltic Empires" is an approachable 2-5 player strategic level wargame about conflicts between the states of the Baltic region during the early modern era, a transformative period of religious conflict, large scale warfare, and constant struggles for power. Players will have to develop their economy, strengthen their administration, secure trade hubs, and finally build armies to become the dominant power of the Baltics. Denmark-Norway, Sweden, Russia, Poland-Lithuania, and Prussia will fight for hegemony, using variable victory conditions that reflect their respective historical objectives. Gameplay involves collecting resources, building new infrastructure and units, recruiting historical figures to your court, and finally going to war to expand your empire and fulfil your national ambition.

Highlights:

Five asymmetric factions with unique abilities and objectives
A highly thematic deck of historical Dramatis Personae to constitute your royal court
A simple yet deep economic system that forces players to make tough decisions regarding their finances and wage war for key resources
A streamlined battle system based on custom dice per unit type
Variable player counts, from 2 to 5 players, and variable game lengths, with scenarios ranging from a tight duel to a diplomatic heavy conflict with alliances and betrayals


—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Negotiation, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Bribery, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Loans

name: BattleTech: Reinforcements – Clan Invasion
description:
From the back cover:

Calvary Incoming!
In the heat and terror of battle, as enemy troops force you back and defeat seems at hand, nothing brings a smile like the sight of reinforcements!

Catalyst Game Labs offers a full line of high-quality, fully assembled plastic miniatures for BattleTech. But when you're looking for a quick and easy opposing force to face on your gaming table, Reinforcements: Clan Invasion provides the bevy of additional units you need.

This box includes nearly 200 full-color, high-quality stand-ups, covering all of the redesigned 'Mechs and Elementals from the hugely successful BattleTech: Clan Invasion crowdfunding campaign. Also included are 248 record sheets covering each 'Mech's primary variants and configurations. A double-sized map features the first-ever depictions of the Plain of Curtains and the Great Gash on the world of Twycross, two of the key battlefields of the Clan Invasion. Finally, a die-cut sheet of Support Units and Diabolis storm tokens - with corresponding rules - bring Twycross to life on your tables.

The Reinforcements: Clan Invasion box is a supplement to the A Game of Armored Combat and Clan Invasion boxes, as well as Total Warfare which are required to use this set.

Contents:
• 9 punchboards of nearly 200 additional 'Mech standees.
• 248 Record Sheets contained in 3 Booklets.
• One double-sided 36″ x 22″ game-map
- Plain of Curtains
- Great Gash
• Punchboard of Support Units and Diabolis storm tokens.
• 3 page rule booklet for the maps / tokens.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Star Wars: Legion – NR-N99 Persuader-class Tank Droid Unit Expansion
description:
Lead the assault with the NR-N99 Persuader-class Tank Droid Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! This fast, heavily armed tank droid is surprisingly well suited to even the most difficult terrain thanks to its massive central tread. Its wide side sponsons can accommodate a full unit of battle droids and transport them directly to the front lines.

This expansion contains everything you need to add a NR-N99 Persuader-class Tank Droid to your Separatist armies as a heavy unit. The beautifully detailed, unpainted miniature features two option B1 battle droids that it can ferry into battle and a unit card outlines all of its weapons and systems. Finally, nine upgrade cards invite you to outfit your NR-N99 Persuaderclass Tank Droid with additional shells, comms, and programming.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: The Warp: Arok Undertakers
description:
The Arok Undertakers were selected by the Kickstarter backers as an exclusive alien for the campaign.

They can be used in 3 different ways:

Player alien
Exiled forces
Warp Guardian


Their power will grant you an additional troop in your supply if you terrashift an area down to the lowest level.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Negotiation, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Grimspire, Intrafin Games, Jumping Turtle Games

name: Great Boy The Game
description:
Great Boy the Game is a 1-3 player narrative puzzle that gives the players a chance to work out a mysterious miracle story about Elijah from the bible.
Players will have to:


Explore locations
Find items including clues, spiritual weapons, non-playable characters, tradeable goods, and scriptures key to solving the puzzles
maintain their strength and confidence stats
make really difficult choices that alter the course of the game
fight spiritual battles
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: Curse of Castle Ravenstein
description:
This is a quick dungeon in card format co-produced by PocketLands and Ganesha Games.

Each deck is a standalone thematic dungeon to explore including its own quest, unique monsters and magic treasures. Fully compatible with “Four Against Darkness” game.

It is an official product for Four Against Darkness, and the core Four Against Darkness rulebook is required to play.

The deck contains:

17 tarot-size, full color cards
Instructions are included on the cards
2 unique monster cards
2 unique magic item cards
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Godtear: Skullbreaker, The Dragon Slayer
description:
Skullbreaker. The one they call the Dragon Slayer. An orc so strong he wields the jawbone of a slain dragon as a weapon. His followers are dubbed the Tooth Bearers: acolytes deemed worthy of a single tooth from his dragon jaw blade, a trophy of Skullbreaker’s many hunts.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Glory Days College Football
description:
Accurate and easy to play, Glory days College Football brings the big time Saturday afternoon excitement to your table top. GDCF employs a unique system, Trench Control, to help determine how well each team will perform on any given play. Just like real life, penalties, turnovers and big plays can add an element of excitement to your game. Choose from all-time great teams or from season sets.

There are three ways to play the game. You can play the game entirely in Play-By-Play mode which takes about 90 minutes. You can play Simulated Drive mode where you simulate the gist of every drive for an abbreviated version which lasts about 30 minutes. Or you can play a hybrid mode where you can speed through the first half of each drive and grind it in from there.

This game is available in pdf format at this time. You get the rulebook, charts, and 30 all time great college football teams from which to choose. All you will need is the ability to print the materials, two d10, 2d6 and a d20. More team sets will become available in the future so be on the lookout for that.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Monster Mouth
description:
They are already here! And they are sooooo hungry.
These thug monsters eat everything, and valuable objects get stuck between their teeth.
Prove to be the fastest following the instructions of your team but...
blindfolded!

Form two teams.
Deal each one a monster card and a monster mask.

Turn over a face card.

Each team will have to place the item tokens on their monster card in the correct place.
The first team to do so will have to roar like a monster and will have earned a victory point.

The first team to get 10 points wins the game.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Speed Matching, Team-Based Game

name: Crayne: Mercenaries of Mindassa
description:
We established our strength in a time of great strife. Whilst the rest of Crayne was celebrating the reconnection of the world with the Magic Realm and the subsequent defeat of the Titans, Mindassa came under threat from an an entirely new but ancient enemy. One that had been buried in the sands of the desert and fogotten for over 4000 years.

The Tide of Dust had unsealed their time-worn tombs and released their ancient curses, but without the flow of magic in the world the dead lay dormant. That is until the day Archmage Tymirus completed the Re-weaving and magic was allowed to flow into Crayne once more. Magical energy surged into world and the curse of the Ancients was fueled.

The archaic dead rose from the cracks in their tombs and shambled across the desert in search for the living. As if one invasion wasn't enough another unknown enemy appeared: a swarm of deadly giant citinous insectoids began destroying small villages before any resistance could be mustered.

Were these two new enemies working together? Were The Hive and The Ancients under the guidance of the same mastermind? Was their even a mastermind at all? Or did the sudden world changes awaken both factions, disturbing their rest and rousing their hunger?

Only one thing is certain. The Mindassan lords must muster their forces and fight. Lest they too become just another casualty of history for future scholars to uncover.

Mercenaries of Mindassa expands the Crayne universe by introducing two new factions, both with a unique playstyle, and by adding a new game variant called the Mercenary Market.

The two new factions increases Crayne's replay ability and the Mercenary Market adds a new dimension to the strategy.

There will also be more solo play mission content: Defend the Spires and Expansion of the Hive

The Mercenary Market and both new factions can be played with all variants of Crayne, including solo-play, multiplayer and team play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Market, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Set-up

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Targa Seeker Drones Enemy Pack
description:
Hovering through the frozen halls and silent chambers of the Targa Plateau, the Seeker Drones are deployed by the ancient computers when intruders are detected. As a rapid response defense system, once activated, these small robotic gunships are tenacious in hunting down and exterminating unwanted visitors that have strayed into sensitive areas of the city. They have even been known to follow their targets back through open gateways, unrelenting in their mission to seek and destroy!

This Enemy Pack contains everything you need to encounter the deadly Targa Seeker Drones. Included are 6 Seeker Drone models, the large Enemy Record Sheet for them, and all of the Threat Cards needed to add these relentless robot Enemies to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

Models are Thermal Plastic Miniatures manufactured in the USA and include 6 Seeker Drones, 6 Scenic Targa 30 mm Bases, and 6 flight stems. Models are supplied unassembled and unpainted.
categories: Adventure, American West, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Global War 1936-1945 (Fourth Edition)
description:
Global War 1936-1945v4


After more than 1000 hours of development over the last 4 years, Historical Board Gaming is proud to present Global War 1936 version 4.
Listing the changes is an impossible task. Every component in the game and every sentence in the rules has been scrutinized. In many ways, version 4 is a totally new game compared to version 3.
We have done a lot of streamlining to make the game faster to play, and easier for new players to pick up. This includes removing things that did not work well or were unnecessarily complicated.
A tremendous amount has been added to the game: an all-new map, revised diplomacy, more balanced units, and enhanced technologies. Everything is now much more integrated. One of the biggest new additions are the “in port” rules, which will transform the game in many ways.
In any 3-alliance system, the rules open up possibilities to gaming the system. Although a lot has been done to reduce/eliminate this in version 4, Global War has been designed to be played like gentlemen. As such, it is our hope that players aspire to this, and “play the game”, instead of “playing the rules”. The former is a lot more fun!
Printed on new 13oz vinyl.
Improved Jungle and Tundra terrain.
Sea Floor Topography.
Play aids such as Monroe Doctrine, kamikaze, Objectives, etc printed on the map.
Sea Zones numbering (Atlantic A1. A2, A3..., Pacific P1, P2..., Indian Ocean and the Mediterranean.)


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Night's Watch Heroes 3
description:
Even further north than the lands of House Stark lays The Wall. This imposing edifice protects the relatively calm, rich, and fertile lands from the much wilder civilizations that live beyond it. Manning The Wall are the Night’s Watch. Though they may come from a myriad of origins, they are no rag-tag group, training relentlessly. These troops are willing to lay down their lives to protect everyone south of them.

Night’s Watch Heroes Box 3 gives Night’s Watch players in the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game a host of new figures they can use to personalize their army. Leaders like Cotter Pyke and Ser Denys Mallister train new recruits like Satin into a cohesive fighting force. Meanwhile, more veteran Brothers like Eddison Tollett and Benjen Stark will gladly do whatever is asked of them in the protection of Westeros.

Approximate Height
Denys Mallister: 38mm
Cotter Pyke: 38mm
Satin: 34mm
Eddison Tollett: 37mm
Yoren: 37mm
Benjen Stark: 54mm

Contents:
6 Miniatures
  ‣ Denys Mallister
  ‣ Cotter Pyke
  ‣ Satin
  ‣ Eddison Tollett
  ‣ Yoren
  ‣ Benjen Stark
8 Attachment Cards
2 NCU Cards
18 Tactics Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Ayuda a Joe
description:
Lateral thinking game that invites us to create solutions to different problems using our ingenuity and imagination.

Joe has many problems, and we can help him solve them with different tools and our creativity.

Ayuda a Joe (Help Joe) is guaranteed fun for adults and children.

Each player in their turn chooses a situation to solve. They must use the most tools that have been given to them, in addition to all their imagination and creativity!

The other players will judge if the situation was correctly solved (using the right tools and no more tools than needed).

Game ends when there are no more situations to solve, no more tools available, or the ones available can't help to solve the situations.

Then, each solved situation is worth 2 points, and each used tool is worth 1 point. The player with most points win.
mechanics: Player Judge

name: Meek Heroes: Victory
description:
Meek Heroes: Victory is a Biblically inspired, 2-4 player competitive strength deck-building game. Each player moves their hero throughout the city to collect resources, purchase upgrades, and charge their mech. When the player feels they are ready for battle (which can happen at any time), they start battling bosses at the henchmen level and work their way up through the agents and finally to the principalities.

To battle a boss, a player uses their deck to play cards adding up strength points, similar to a game of war against a target number. A player wins a battle if the strength points are equal to or greater than the boss's strength and have not played an auto-loss card that they could not negate.

Players may call upon allies for support and continue to upgrade as they press through battles. Enemies will grow stronger. The first player to redeem 3 henchmen, redeem 2 agents, and banish 2 principalities is the winner.

It is a race, so go, fight, win!

-description by Joe of Meek Heroes Gaming'
mechanics: Deck Construction, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Out of the Void Investigator Pack
description:
Out of the Void features the Arkham Horror: The Card Game investigator cards that first appeared in these acclaimed Arkham Horror novellas:


Norman Withers featured in the Ire of the Void
Silas Marsh, featured in The Deep Gate
Carolyn Fern, featured in To Fight The Black Wind
Dexter Drake, featured in Blood of Baalshandor
Gloria Goldberg, featured in Dark Revelations


Also included are an alternate art version of Jenny Barnes and her two optional new signature cards from the Hour of the Huntress novella, as well as an alternate art version of Roland Banks, and his signature cards from the novella The Dirge of Reason.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Events, Hand Management, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers

name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – On the Road Again: Parallel Investigator
description: On the Road Again is a print and play rules set for Arkham Horror: The Card Game that provides an alternate version of “Ashcan” Pete, previously released in The Dunwich Legacy: Investigator Expansion. In order to play this investigator, a copy of the Arkham Horror: The Card Game core set is required.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Extrodivertido
description:
Play with friends, receive cards, send cards, complete challenges and become the most extrovert player.

Send and impose extroverted challenges to prevent other players from running out of cards; and thus, be the first player who manages to start his turn without cards in hand, to win the game.

In most cases, the cards in your hand are not for you. They are for sending to someone else!

Choose a card from your hand and send it to the player you choose, that player must do what the card says! If he or she wants to win.

Start your turn with no cards in your hand to win the game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Turn Order: Progressive

name: Verdun
description:
Verdun is a 1v1 and 2v2 partnership card game revisiting the German and French armies fighting in the World War I battlefields of Verdun. As their hands dwindle, players will also have to play cards that help the other side, timing it strategically to minimize their own casualties. The teams alternate being the Attacker, mirroring the back-and-forth nature of the Verdun battles, bringing costly decision-making to the table. Every card played has consequences, and every round is a tension-filled challenge.

OVERVIEW

A game of Verdun consists of 1 to 3 Rounds. Before the first Round, each team secretly organizes one of their Assets behind each or their five Fortifications. Then each player receives a hand of 12 cards, which they then play in a series of 12 tricks. In each trick, each team tries to minimize Casualties on their side while protecting their Assets and Fortifications. A team scores points for Overrunning the opponent’s fortifications and capturing their Assets and for protecting their own Fortifications and Assets. And each team loses points for their Casualties. After three Rounds, the team with the most points (or whose score is the least negative) wins.
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Ready Five
description:
A solo/cooperative dexterity game played on a standard Crokinole board.

Protect your base from enemy fighters. Don’t let a single enemy fighter disc reach the centre hole, or you lose. If you survive all of the Sweep cards, and clear the board of all remaining enemy fighter discs, you win!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Rolling Dead
description:
The world is infested with zombies, knocking humans down a notch on the food ladder. In this merciless dice game, you'll have to fight to survive or to feed yourself if by some misfortune you find yourself infected.

Rolling Dead is a game of dice combinations, speed and self-control. At the start of the game, everyone chooses their colour and starts as a human with the associated dice. A virus die is rolled and determines who will be the first infected in the game. If you become infected, you turn into a zombie and swap your dice.

When the first person is infected, the dice combinations determine who attacks and who defends. The attacking zombie or human must quickly touch (or slap) the hand of the target. If a human is hit, they become a zombie. If a zombie is hit, they are eliminated. But there's no room for error; if a player removes their hand for no reason, hit the wrong target or attack when not supposed to, they go from human to zombie and from zombie to permanent death.

The last human standing is declared the winner. Zombies can also win by being the last ones standing, in which case they decide whether they share the victory or go hungry again and become cannibals to the last survivor.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Player Elimination

name: Gnome Village
description:
These gnomes are sweet, hardworking and sometimes very naughty!

Gnome village is a strategic game with a touch of luck. Your gnomes are going to work in your village. So that with these products your village can expand.

Each player creates his own village. You start with 2 houses and 5 roads. You can place this however you want, if only 1 road tile is adjacent to the buildings. You have a gnome that starts at the house with the lights on. The player who starts may take a forest card, from which you can receive products, money or an action. Then you check whether your gnome is on a company, you get money for this. Then you use the products and coins you make to buy things. At the end you can move the gnomes and put them to work in workshops. You turn the tile over so that you can clearly see that the workshop is active. At the companies you can perform different actions and even fly to fellow players from another village!

Once someone has moved in all their gnomes, each other player may complete this round until the starting player. After that, the player with the most points wins!
Do you delve into the gnome life?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Kick Off Deluxe
description:
Challenge your friends to Kick Off, the football card game that simulates the actions of a real match. Just like in football, based on actions built to get to the shot, Kick Off will allow you to score goals through combination of cards. The mixing of these two mechanisms, choosing the right cards to play with unpredictable reactions makes for a tense and engaging game. The Deluxe edition provides a multitude of new options, cards, and variant, which provide players with new paths to victory.

Match the cards to shoot, score a goal and get the famous Poker, that is, 4 goals. Each player will be able to choose the best cards to get to the shot, trying not to let the action be intercepted by the opponent. The player who starts the action is the Attacker, while the other is the Defender. The playable offensive cards are Action Cards and Special Cards, and each of them increases the opportunity to play the Shot Card and score a goal. Each offensive card corresponds to one or more defense cards which allow the defender to recover the ball and become the new attacker, as if a counterattack were triggered. To get to the Shot, the Attacker must play 3 cards consecutively without being intercepted by the Defender. To avoid the goal, the Defender can play the Block Card and start the action again as the new Attacker. Kick Off also allows you to combine Action Cards and Special Cards to create lethal actions. Each Special Card allows the Attacker to get to the shot more easily and, in some cases, to bypass the opponent’s ability to intercept cards.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching

name: ATS: White Beach One – The Marine Landing on Peleliu 1944
description:
From the CH webpage:

WHITE BEACH ONE: Peleliu 1944 is just for you if you are ready to smash your way ashore at the infamous island, as one of the soldiers of the 1st Marine Regiment under Marine nonpariel Chesty Puller. It's for you if you are ready for a colorful map, new die-cut counters depicting weapons like the T20 shoulder-fired mortar. If you want historical leader counters, a battlfield unlike any other in the annals of historical modules. Taut scenarios, easily digest special rules in two column format.

"Ten hut!" It's time to get in the boats... then back out of the boats and ashore. You'll be wading in all the way as the water is shallow and inside the reef at Peleliu's White Beach One. And once you go ashore we're planning one way for you to come back out, and that' with a captured enemy battle flag clutched in your fist, the job done and done well.

Now for the real deal. WHITE BEACH ONE: Peleliu 1944 is a new historical module that provides 8 scenarios, all playable on the new map and ranging from fast-play to monster. It includes a sheet of new color die-cut counters and special rules pages in two column format. If you've been following the HBO miniseries 'The Pacific" or perhaps read "With the Old Breed" a few times (we know you have) then you're already equipped with the intel that these here are Chesty Puller's Marines and you are ready for this experience NOW!


THIS IS NOT A COMPLETE GAME. STATUS MARKERS, RULEBOOK, AND PLAY AIDS ARE NEEDED FROM ANY COMPLETE GAME.

All Japanese and Marine unit counters are included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Halberstadt D.III
description:
From the publisher:

The Halberstadt D.III was a biplane fighter aircraft of the Luftstreitkräfte (Imperial German Army Air Service). Initially assigned to escort duties, the Halberstadt D.III was a maneuverable aircraft widely used on the Western Front in late 1916, early 1917. After Albatros fighters began arriving at the front, the Halberstadts were withdrawn from combat and used as trainers for the rookie pilots.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW1 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any otherWW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Survivors: Boston Companions
description:
Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Survivors Boston Companions provides an expansion to your game with new cards for player vs player and AI game modes.

Models: 1x X6-88 Courser, 1x Piper, 1x Cait, 3x Scenic bases

Cards: 6x Large cards: Unit, AI and 10+ Small cards from a range of: Item (Weapon, Equipment, Mod, Chem), Boost, Quest, Perk, Leader
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simulation

name: An Impossible War: The First Carlist War in the North, 1834-1838
description:
'An Impossible War' recreates the First Carlist War in the North of Spain (1834-1838). It is a wargame with blocks that also includes counters and cards.

There is a main map (or Northern map), that shows Navarre, the Basque Provinces and part of Cantabria, Burgos and La Rioja, and a secondary map that reflects the regions of the rest of the country, where Carlist uprising break out and the expeditions sent from the North may operate.

There is a scenario that covers the Full War (1834-1838) and another two shorter ones: Zumalacarregui's War (1834-1836) and Espartero's War (1836-1838).


'Una Guerra Imposible' recrea la Primera Guerra Carlista en el Norte de España (1834-1838). Es un juego de guerra de bloques que también incluye fichas y cartas.

Hay un mapa principal (o mapa del Norte), donde aparecen Navarra, las Provincias Vascongadas y parte de Cantabria, Burgos y La Rioja, y otro mapa secundario que refleja las regiones del resto del país, donde estallan las sublevaciones carlistas y pueden operar las expediciones enviadas desde el Norte.

Hay un escenario que cubre la Guerra Completa (1834-1838) y otros dos más breves: La Guerra de Zumalacárregui (1834-1836) y La Guerra de Espartero (1836-1838).
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Point to Point Movement

name: Shards of Alkemae
description:
Shards of Alkemae may be played at three different levels, Novice, Apprentice, and Master. Game play remains essentially the same, but rules change from level to level. Regardless of level, players take turns laying down tiles to form the game board and move their game pieces about the board, trying to lay claim to regions worth the most points.
The tiles (based on Penrose tiles) are of two types, kites and darts, which fit together to form a quasi-symmetric tessellation. A gold kite serves as the centerpiece and entryway for game pieces to move onto the playing area. Sixty kites and thirty-six darts are placed into separate bags, from which players draw blindly to begin their turns. Represented on each tile face is one of the following elements: earth, air, fire, or water. Additionally, there are twelve “wild-card” kites, which can serve as any of the four elements.

Each player begins the game by drawing a tile from each bag and setting them in front of the player, one face up, one face down. On a turn, a player draws a tile from either bag and sets it down adjacent to the tiles already placed. A player may place the tile drawn, either tile in front of that player, or any “face-up” tile from another player. Judicious tile placement usually results in the formation of one of seven geometric patterns, called “shards”, which are named: ace, deuce, jack, queen, king, star, or sun. Any player completing one of these shards receives a token representing the shard formed. After placing a tile to form a shard, the player then advances one of four playing pieces (in the shapes of chemical glassware) onto the game board.

As players place more tiles, the game board grows, and like-colored regions of each of the elements form. Players accumulate shards which may be turned in for gold “transmuting stones”, which are then used by a player to lay claim to a region (any contiguous grouping of like-colored tiles). Players try to move their game pieces into regions and lay claim to one region of each element before the other players.

The game ends when one player claims one region of each element, or all the tiles have been placed on the board. Two key components of a winning strategy are prediction (determining where wealthy regions will form) and risk/benefit analysis (choosing whether to claim smaller regions early or wait until they grow into more prosperous ones as the board grows).
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Gnomistic
description:
Gnomistic is a competitive game of tactics, strategy, hand management, set collection and other various mechanisms for 1 to 6 players.

SHORT OVERVIEW:
Imagine that you and your friends are on an excursion in a forest in Ireland, when suddenly, someone yells “I have seen a gnome!”. Now, a magical wave of greed controls your mind and the only thing that matters is getting the gnome's pot of gold at any cost, so you must guide yourself from the correct signs on the way to get it.

Play different signal cards on the correct path when the time is right and if it pairs with another matching card, you get them all. This will cause you to have a lot of cards in your play area (a lot, and it feels strange and satisfying!), but you will need even more to be able to complete the positive sets and avoid the negative ones, and then save those cards in the only safe place where no one can take them away: your chest. But be careful, you should also be aware of the right time to save them, because bad things can happen if you save too soon, if you miss the perfect opportunity or if you accidentally complete negative sets, if you run out of coins or if someone uses magic cards against you ... And if the latter happens, don't worry ... maybe you can get revenge sooner than you think and with twice the strength.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Matching, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Rally Round the Flag: Division Command
description:
Rally Round the Flag – Division Command is an operational game pitting the Union and Confederate Armies against each other during the three days of the Battle of Gettysburg. Each side is represented by each of the Army, Corps and Division Commanders at the Battle of Gettysburg and the Brigades under their command. Take control of the Confederate Army and use their consolidated command structure to try and wrest control of Gettysburg from the Union.

Or, take control of the Union Army and work to delay the Confederates long enough for reinforcements to arrive. Can the Union survive the confusion of command before Meade can arrive with the Army artillery reserves? Can Lee push forward far enough on the first day to sustain his position for the second and third days? Can you win the Battle of Gettysburg and decide the fate of the American Civil War?

The Division Command level is designed with the ability to take and hold ground. This is represented by controlling the critical road network surrounding the town of Gettysburg. This is accomplished by taking control of specific points along the roads called “March Circles,” and thus scoring Victory Points.

A standard Division Command level game covering all three days of the Battle of Gettysburg can be played in about 8-12 hours. Victory occurs either when you force your opponent’s army to retreat, or you have the majority of the 43 Victory Points by the end of the game. You force your opponent to retreat by having double their amount of Victory Points at the end of a day of battle, thus earning a decisive victory.

Rally Round the Flag – Division Command can also be played as a Campaign Manager within the Rally Round the Flag – Brigade Command game. This allows the Division Command game to act as a “campaign battle generator,” creating tactical battles that can be played in 2 to 3 hours, skipping past unnecessary actions and combats in the Brigade Command system and shaving a 40 to 60 hour long game down to 25 hours or less.

While Rally Round the Flag was painstakingly designed with historical accuracy at its heart, the outcome of the game is not predetermined. The design reflects the tactical, organizational, and operational limits of both Union and Confederate armies and their generals, but how you manage them is up to you. In this battle, your decisions make the difference.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Movement Points

name: Age of Monarchs
description:
Age of Monarchs is a multiplayer card-driven grand strategy game simulating the three centuries of the Modern Age, from Columbus' discovery of America in 1492 to the fall of the Bastille in 1789. Players represent the highest rungs of European monarchy, assuming the leadership of a major European Power, and struggling to achieve global supremacy over the world in the Age of Absolutism. Being an absolute monarch, each player must manage every kind of question: economic, political, diplomacy, trade, world wide exploration, colonization, religion and warfare.

Age of Monarchs is designed to offer an accurate and detailed historical context, supported by more than 160 strategy cards that simulate the most outstanding historical events and force players to face constantly the toughest challenges that occurred during the three centuries covered by the game timeline.

The game offers a wide set of short scenarios and a Grand Campaign 1492-1789, spanning 20 turns, that put the most powerful European nations into a never-ending struggle for world domination.

The complete list of Scenarios:

• 1492-1559 Age of Exploration
• 1560-1618 Wars of Religion
• 1619-1667 Thirty Years War
• 1668-1730 Age of Absolutism
• 1698-1789 Wars of Supremacy

In Age of Monarchs players take the role of the absolute monarch of a Major Power. Monarchs are represented by Strategy Cards that reproduce historical characters (plus some generic ones), each with special abilities that affect game rules. The game manages also the aging of monarchs, and their replacement by new monarchs, crowned after their predecessor is dead, thus allowing players to handle a line of succession in the monarchy of their Powers.

Strategy Cards are the core of the game. They provide Command Points that allow players to perform all Game Actions, but they also introduce the most outstanding historical events of the Modern Age, such as the Protestant Reformation, the Wars of Religion, the birth of Holland (United Provinces), the Eighty Years war with Spain, the rise and decline of the Portuguese and Spanish colonial empires, the Thirty Years War, the rush of the Russian Empire to Siberia, the Great Northern Wars, the growth of the Ottoman Empire, the wars with Christianity, the Wars of Succession, the birth of the USA, and many more.

Game Actions allow players to perform activities in all spheres. To summarize a few:

Warfare: the game has a light military system. Players can rapidly move or redeploy forces, engage land battles, resolve sieges and naval combats. Supply mechanics are very simple. Leaders play a fundamental role in game-play, either as Generals, Admirals or Conquistadors.
Diplomacy: many Minor Nations are present in the game. All players can influence these Minors to get Alliances and Vassals, benefiting from their military support during conflicts.
Exploration, Colonization and Trade: the game recreates the race of the Powers to build Colonial Empires all over the world. New colonies bring income from the exploitation of exotic resources and gold. The game allows players to affect the prices of exotic goods in order to speculate on price fluctuations as well. Gold can have a strong impact on the European economy due to Inflation!
Economy: players must pay attention to the budget of their Powers. At the end of each turn, players perform some short and rapid calculations to determine the budget balance of their Monarchies, based on revenues (taxes, colonial incomes, trade) and costs (maintenance of forces). The game has also the concept of Prosperity, measuring the richness of each Power, strongly affected by the length and outcome of wars.

Game overview:

• Complexity: 6 / 10
• Game length: 5+ hours
• Number of players: 3-6
• Time scale: about 10 years per turn
• Solitaire suitability: low
categories: Age of Reason, Civilization, Exploration, Negotiation, Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: 48STORM
description:
Skirmish game set now during Second World War, with a very specific 1/48 scale collection of miniatures, fast and fluid game mechanics and excellent tactical level.

Rules, condensed in only two pages, allow to start playing with only three miniatures per side in a very limited battle table.

In the Battleboxes (Starter Set) there are three metal miniatures of a faction to be painted, cardboard tokens and three scenic elements to be cut out, a 5 inch ruler to be able to measure during the game, and finally cards to manage characters.

In addition, there are already new characters with their own specific card available in order to expand the factions of the battleboxes.

It’s a game that combines both wargame as well as boardgame elements and that can be appreciated by a wide audience thanks to its simple dynamics but demanding skills.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Set Collection, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: How to Save a World
description:
As one of the leading scientific researchers in the galaxy, you're in high demand. You've spent the last two years on Alarria, a small terrestrial planet several light-years from Earth. You've been studying the diverse indigenous fauna, and your field research has already yielded some incredible results. However, your days as a simple scientific researcher are about to end.

An asteroid roughly the size of a small country has been picked up on radar hurtling towards Alarria — a planet killer. If something isn't done soon, the planet itself might cease to exist. Three distinct plans have been set into motion, each with a razor thin chance of succeeding:


A powerful laser is tracking the asteroid's approach and will fire as soon as it comes within range in hopes of reducing it to a mere pebble.
An energy shield might be just enough to deflect the approaching asteroid, altering its course and saving Alarria.
In a final desperate attempt to preserve some of the unique species of the planet, an evacuation plan has been ordered. The nearby forest moon, Fortuna, has been tested and can support life, and thankfully it's out of the blast zone. You just need to move as many of the species as possible before impact.


Your research work has been put on hold as the greatest minds on the planet have been recruited to develop the three plans. Time is running out as each second brings the asteroid closer to Alarria. Where will you focus your efforts? Which plan has the best chance to succeed? There's no time to waste...

How to Save a World is a worker-placement game with hand-building and resource management. Each turn, you assign workers to perform critical tasks or spend action cards to help advance your goals. At the end of each round, the projects will be assessed and the asteroid will move ever closer. Can you make the right decisions to avert disaster in this competitive science-fiction thrill ride for 2-4 players?

—description from publisher
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: BattleTech: The Star League
description:
From the back of the book:

"The Star League was the greatest achievement of mankind, a golden age of prosperity and advancement the likes of which had never been seen. Led by the noble Cameron family, the League united all of humanity under one banner for the first time.

But the League also had its dark side. Not everyone wanted to be a part of such an undertaking. The rulers of the League were forced to use their military might to bring the nations of the Periphery into the fold. Many resented the League for this action and it would eventually lead to the League's downfall.

For wicked men plot the League's demise. Stefan Amaris, cursed forever after as one of the greatest villains in history, wants the destroy the League from within and has corrupted the young First Lord. He is opposed by Aleksandr Kerensky, General of the Star League's armies, who is willing to do whatever it takes to defeat the Usurper.

In this sourcebook, ComStar presents the history and the tragedy of the Star League."

User comment:

This sourcebook contains more detail on the Star League than any other BattleTech publication, and hasn't been reprinted. Although rules for Star League equipment and 'Mechs were detailed in the Technical Readout: 2750, this book provides a wealth of background detail on the Star League, and is one of a very small number of publications to include an atlas and map of the Star League and the Terran Hegemony. Some of the detail from this book relating to the Star League Defence Force was later reprinted in the German edition of the Technical Readout: 2750.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: La Bataille de Schoengrabern 1805
description:
La Bataille de Schöngrabern 1805 , which was made famous in Leo Tolstoy’s War and Peace, recreates the fight between French Imperial Prince Joachim Murat’s advance guard, having just taken Vienna from the Austrians, and the Russian rear guard led by General Peter Bagration, Bagration was desperately trying to buy enough time for Prince Mikhail Kutuzov to unite two separated parts of his large Russian-Austrian army in the maneuvering before the Battle of Austerlitz.


Murat has dallied for a few days after his capture of Vienna, trying to accomplish victory through diplomacy and trickery rather than force of arms, and the Russians used Murat’s vanity to keep the formerly hard-pressing French from catching the spread-out Russian forces in detail. The result is a small but sharp battle on November 16, 1805 which allowed the Russians enough time to unite their armies.

La Bataille de Schöngrabern 1805 includes more than 100 counters, representing both the French Imperial forces and such leaders as Oudinot and Suchet; and the Russian rearguard represented by counters for Bagration; assorted Russian Cossacks, Austrian Hussars and Russian Jaegers. There are two 11 X17 maps, with much of the territory taken up by the extensive vineyards.
The Schöngrabern Special Rules feature a "La Bataille" first combat in the vineyards, which makes this game very different from any other La Bataille game. There is also a commemorative essay about Marshal Murat’s efforts and the battle itself.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Opticall
description:
Opticall is a strategic bluffing card game.
Players take turns playing six different colors on a central pile until someone is caught bluffing by another player. The final player left in the game becomes the winner.

Like Bull Sh*t/Cheat with intricate strategy.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Constrained Bidding, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Phase Order

name: Death Ride Normandy: Omaha Beach
description:
This game is the first of all the beach areas involved in the great adventure to liberate France. DRN-Omaha Beach is a spectacular game, at platoon and company level, of the landings by the 1st and 29th US Infantry Divisions and their supporting elements.

This game details getting the troops ashore like no other game with landing craft and naval gunfire support.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Villain Pack #4: A Dark Turn
description:
"When we're finished, there will be no good left in the universe! No love. No happiness. Only chaos." -Astronema

Mesogog and Astronema, two of the most devious and powerful enemies the Power Rangers have ever faced, have arrived with destruction in their wake! Before they became terrifying masterminds at the head of their own armies, both of these villains were once close allies of the Power Rangers.

Astronema leads a vicious assault on Earth, accompanied by her merciless lieutenant Ecliptor, while Mesogog the dinosaur-human hybrid commands his own deadly majordomo Elsa, as well as Tommy Oliver's cyborg nemesis Zeltrax.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth – Hyde vs. Linne
description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 2 fighters and everything you need to play:

Hyde - Hyde is a mobile, high-power fighter who can telegraph his attacks for huge power bonuses.
Linne - Linne's non-stop rushdown style seamlessly fuses boosts and attacks together to create custom strikes.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Armello: The Board Game
description:
Armello: The Board Game brings the same colorful world and compelling characters from the Armello video game to life on the tabletop.

The King of Armello has fallen ill to a dark and mysterious force called the Rot. The disease slowly consumes his body and soul, twisting him into madness. Banes, corrupted monsters of the Rot, roam unchecked. In response, the Great Clans have called on their Heroes to claim the throne. The Heroes will need to undertake Quests across the land to gain Experience, collect Treasures, and recruit Followers if they hope to slay the King. Or, if their exploits can earn them sufficient Prestige in the eyes of the Armellians, they may win the crown outright!

In Armello: The Board Game, players take on the roles of Heroes to quest, battle, and employ a bit of trickery to gain Prestige and become the new ruler of Armello!

Armello is in part a deck builder, meaning each Hero starts with their own deck of cards and adds to it over the course of the game.

It is also an area control game, as Heroes travel across the map to stake their claim on Settlements and complete Quests.

In addition to building a deck and exploring the map, Heroes will take part in battles by rolling dice. Gaining additional dice to roll and card effects that manipulate them will help you overcome your opponents in battle.

Your success in Armello is determined by Prestige. Prestige can be earned by completing Quests and winning battles. There are 2 paths to victory: Regicide Victory (reach 30 Prestige, then enter the Palace and slay the King) and Proclamation Victory (Win immediately when you reach 70 Prestige).

If you’re already familiar with the Armello video game, that’s great! You’ve got a head start with many of the board game’s mechanics.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers
publishers: King of the Castle Games Company

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Earth's Mightiest Core Set
description:
Marvel: Crisis Protocol is a tabletop hobby miniatures game set in the Marvel Universe. Players assemble, paint, and collect an ever-expanding line of highly detailed plastic miniatures representing iconic Marvel characters. Players choose characters from their collections to form their own Marvel-inspired dream team, then pit their chosen forces against each other on an interactive tabletop where the very terrain itself can be thrown, crashed into, and destroyed during the super powered showdown.

Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Earth's Mightiest Core Set serves as a starting point for new players, a revision of the 2019 Core Set that features updated characters, more dice mitigation in those character powers, four character affiliations instead of two, and other changes.

All previous Marvel: Crisis Protocol expansions are playable with Earth's Mightiest Core Set.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Great War at Sea: High Seas Fleet
description:
Description from the publisher:

During the brief period between 1906 and 1914, so the story goes, Britain and Germany engaged in a furious naval arms race sparked by the launch of the Royal Navy’s revolutionary battleship Dreadnought. This rivalry, egged on in Germany by Grand Admiral Alfred von Tirpitz, then helped ignite the First World War.

As usual, reality is a little more complicated than popular history. Tirpitz’s enemy lay not across the North Sea but rather in the War Ministry offices just on the other side of the Brandenburger Tor. Army and Navy battled furiously for funding, inventing, respectively, the (possibly mythical) Schlieffen Plan and the Risk Theory (less mythical, but just as detached from reality) to justify ever-higher levels of spending. In the event, neither got what they wanted: the Navy did not build a new class of dreadnoughts every fiscal year, nor did the Army get to muster two dozen new divisions to “reinforce the right.”

But what if Tirpitz had won his real battle? Germany had the financial and industrial resources to build a fleet to challenge the British. What might this fleet have looked like, and how would it have stood up to the Grand Fleet in battle?

High Seas Fleet is a supplement for the Great War at Sea series that studies this question with background essays, over two dozen new scenarios, and 70 new scorchless, sootless laser-cut playing pieces. It is not playable by itself; you’ll need our Jutland game (and only our Jutland game) to play the scenarios. You can, of course, just read the essays and fondle the pieces without owning Jutland. We won’t tell.

New pieces include German battleships designed but never built: the 1904 semi-dreadnought, the 1905 dreadnought, the 1912 dreadnought with 13.8-inch main guns, and the repeat Baden class super-dreadnoughts. There are additional cruisers and battleships to fill out the classes of the German program, and the full Blücher class of six armored cruisers.

This is a powerful fleet that can stand toe-to-toe with the British Grand Fleet – the fleet the propagandists boasted of but Tirpitz feared to actually build. Now you can lead it into battle.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Temple of Madness
description:
For weeks the soldiers of Alladore have lost nearly every battle and skirmish they have fought, and it is clear that some dark sorcery is at work. With the fate of the kingdom at stake, the Rangers are sent into the Shadow Deep to try and locate the source of this magic and end the threat. To accomplish this task, however, they must face the horrors of the Temple of Madness…

Rangers of Shadow Deep: Temple of Madness is a four-scenario mission designed for Level 5 – 15 Rangers. Also included in the book are new rules for magic, including a greatly expanded spell list, spellcasting Heroic Abilities, magical equipment, and several new companions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombicide: 2nd Edition – The Boys: Pack 1 – The Seven
description:
The Boys and The Seven Are Ready to Make Some Zombie Heads Explode

Vought International’s super hero team, The Seven, may be seen as celebrities by much of the world, but the members of The Boys know the dark underside of the super hero life. This vigilante group has made it their goal to put a stop to Vought’s plans and they’re willing to go through The Seven to get there.

And then the zombie apocalypse happened. The Boys and The Seven now have to set aside their differences to fight the zombie threat!

THE BOYS Character Packs brings characters from the iconic THE BOYS series to player’s tabletops, adding them to Zombicide 2nd Edition as Survivors!

Pack #1 includes: Homelander, Queen Maeve, The Deep, Black Noir, Starlight, A-Train, and Soldier Boy Survivors, plus 7 ID Cards, 7 Ultimate Skill Reference Cards, and Rules Leaflet.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Martian Marines
description:
This expansion is composed of:

1 Martian Marine Commander, 1 Martian Marine with missile launcher, 3 Martian Marines with disintegrating rifles
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Martian Saucer Squadron
description:
This expansion contains:
3 Martian UFO's, with a selection of weapons: deadly heat rays or terrifying freezing rays! 6 heat rays, 6 freezing rays, 3 pilot options on command, 3 enhanced communications options, 3 transparent plastic domes, 3 plastic bases.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Cthulhu: XOTHIC WARS
description:
Cthulhu: XOTHIC WARS is the master rules set for a new 28mm Monster Skirmish Game. It is based around the Aliens of the HP Lovecraft mythos, and will cover all main 7 species.

The premise is the wars fought on Earth before the rise of mankind. Each core box in the wave will be complimented by a separate campaign book. It is flexible enough to include use for play in eras with man where the Aliens were also present.

The miniatures will start with the Starspawn of Cthulhu, as they engage the Elder Things for domination of the newly formed planet. We want these miniatures for ourselves, so will be sculpting and printing all of the races regardless. So the Mi-Go and the rest are in the pipeline.

Miniatures will include resin masters for collectors, and are done in 28mm for most popular ranges. Additionally they scale nicely for 15mm and 6mm gamers.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Last Loyalists: The Fall of Ming Dynasty
description:
孤臣儒子：明朝的覆滅 (Last Loyalists: The Fall of Ming Dynasty) is a strategic wargame to simulate the Southern Ming dynasty in 17 century in China. It is a fast-paced and card-driven wargame for 2-3 players in 2 to 3 hours. Players commands the Army of Qing Dynasty, Ming Dynasty, and Great Xi and use Strategy cards to maneuver tactics, and build infantry, cavalry, or navy units to conquer areas and win the victory.

Every player takes a turn by selecting one major action and one roundel action. Roundel action includes politics, march, assembly, and new year actions. Major actions includes events, farming, strategy, operations, and award actions. Cards and units also represents your resource and you need to use award action to control the loyalty of your neutral generals. Player wins the game by getting 10 points in any round.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Rondel
publishers: Formosa Force Games, Kuro Neko Design Workshop

name: EscapeBox: Virus
description:
EscapeBox is a board game that provides you with an exciting escape room experience. You can think with your friends, family or co-workers, put together clues, find a way out of the predicament you are in, and complete your mission. You do not have a simple task ahead! You have to be focused and precise. Even things that seem very trivial may help you. Be aware of time! You do not have much time to complete this mission.

Virus is the name of your first mission. The world needs your help to prevent a human catastrophe. To succeed in this mission, you have to overcome many challenges and obstacles. You and your teammates must be able to decipher many locks by solving various puzzles. You only have 75 minutes to save humanity.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Real-Time, Storytelling

name: A New Hope Limited Expansion Set: Star Wars Customizable Card Game
description:
The A New Hope Limited set was the first full expansion set of the Star Wars Customizable Card Game. It consisted of 162 cards dividing into 81 Dark Side and 81 Light Side, and was introduced in July of 1996. This set consisted of 54 rare, 54 uncommon, and 54 common cards. This set introduced many of the classic characters from Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope, that were not included in the original base set, Premiere Limited. This set also introduced the first epic event cards, such as Commence Primary Ignition and Attack Run, to the game.

Important debuts in this set included Chewbacca and R2-D2. Also of note were the introduction of the Death Star as a system card, the introduction of creatures, and a new mechanic that allowed for the destruction of entire planets.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: 21 Hand Games
description:
21 Hand Games is a collection of 21 folded cards, each card giving instructions for a game that can be played without any other components - all you need is your hands.

Some games are for 2 players, others are for up to 10. Each of them can be played in no more than 10 minutes.

The English edition of 21 Hand Games was published in book form.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Borderhaime: Chronicles
description:
Borderhaime: Chronicles is a tactical board game of co-operative card-driven tactical turn-based combat with 40 hours of story campaign gameplay.

In this hardcore adventure, you are tasked with completing ten levels of a hellish dungeon. Under your control is a character with nine types of stats that have a huge impact on your gameplay and walkthrough style. It doesn't matter which character class you choose as you will always have an option to re-spec your hero. For example, you can start off playing as a mage, but spec it into a tank, or vice versa.

By defeating enemies, you receive experience and loot that allows you to level up and create your unique hero. You can also increase your stats by equipping armor, accessories, and weapons. In order for the hero to be able to use an item, their stats need to pass the use requirement threshold. New items are available for purchase in town or can be looted from monsters.

The main goal of the story mode is to reach to final level of the dungeon. Each level hold a quest mission, new items, and tougher enemies. All enemies in the game are automated, with their behavior, tactics, and stats described on monster cards. Enemy actions are to be done by the player that has drawn the monster card.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Set Collection

name: Sáltame Si Puedes
description:
It is the game in which the frog with the best memory will be the winner. Jump your opponents and steal their flies to be the winner!

It won't be easy work! Since you will have to remember where the figures are under the cards in order to advance.

It's a fun game for the whole family, where even your older brother could win!

Preparation: We place all the chips face down in the center. And around in a shape of a circle all the tiles. All players place their frog at one end of the circle.

How to play: In your turn you must turn a chip of the center to see if it is the same insect than the next insect on your way, if so; you advance to that square, and you try again by turning another chip to see if it is the same insect than the next insect on your way.

If you reach to a space where there is another frog from another player, you will eat that frog and that player will be out for the rest of the game.

When the insect on the card does not coincide with the next inscet on your way, you must turn over all the visible insect cards and it will be the next player's turn.

The player who eats all the other frogs wins the game.

Contents: 1 template with 24 circular aquatic leaf cards, 12 octagonal cards to peel off, 1 template with 8 adhesive labels of frogs to stick, 4 player tokens, 4 cards (Flies) and 1 rulebook.
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Movement, Player Elimination

name: Doctor Who: Solitaire Story Game (Third Edition)
description:
A FREE print and play solitaire paragraph-booklet adventure game where the player assumes the role of the intrepid Time Lord himself - the Doctor!

This web-published game is played using four booklets: Rules, Adventures, Enemies, and TARDIS Manual. Two six-sided dice are also required. All the Booklets, plus all support materials are in the Files section below. Players may either play as a Doctor from the TV show (with 9-12 included in the Core Set) or create their own incarnation.

DWSSG3e is a storytelling game with plenty of events and situations, so each game will be a new, fresh experience.
An Adventure begins when the TARDIS lands at a location, be it modern-day London, the wilds of Sherwood Forest, or the distant planet of the Ood Sphere. An Adventure is played out as a series of Turns where you choose Actions, such as Exploring or Investigating.

After each Action, you may encounter an Enemy and consult the Enemy Booklet. In an Adventure, you need to Defeat an Enemy that begins as unknown but by taking Actions and gaining Knowledge to find out what has been happening, you will reveal the Enemy. However, the Enemy is never idle and always getting closer to completing their plans. You will have to track the current Danger in the Adventure and you will lose an Adventure if the Danger total is ever 20 or more.

Defeating an Enemy will gain you Victory Points, which is the way you can win the game. Once you finish an Adventure, you return to the TARDIS Manual and journey onwards into Time and Space.

—description from the designer
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Objective: Schmidt
description:
Objective Schmidt depicts the hard fought battles that occurred in early November, 1944 in the Hurtgen Forest by the U.S. 28th Infantry Division for the small towns of Schmidt/Kommerscheidt and Vossenack.

Objective: Schmidt includes the following:
·17 action packed scenarios in full-color print, including a campaign game (CG) covering the battle for Kommerscheidt over 7 CG dates
·576 full color, die cut 1/2" counters
·88 full color, die cut 5/8" counters
·Two 22"x 34" HASL map sheets which combine to represent the historical situation of the town of Vossenack
·Four 22"x 34" HASL map sheets with 1" hexgrids which combine to represent the historical situation of the towns of Schmidt and Kommerscheidt
·An article covering "Slopes in ASL"
·Rules pages describing Vehicles/Ordnance notes, Historical Battle Rules (HBR), map terrain and campaign game rules
·A divider card for quick reference of HBRs during scenario and CG play

Ownership of the following Hasbro/MMP ASL products are required to play all of the included scenarios: Beyond Valor©, Yanks©
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board

name: Woven in Myth
description:
Enter a map enchanted by Unicorns, Phoenixes, Fairies and tormented by Dragons, Minotaurs, and Cthulhu!
Woven in Myth is a quick and easy game to play with plenty of tactics and strategy. The map, a 6x6 grid of cards, is full of adventure where no two games are alike. Face creatures that allow for special moves, and exit the map before your opponent does. As you move your Avatar through the corridors, you may flip and rotate cards to change the map. A draw pile allows you to replace or resurrect cards when your corridors have vanished.
Be the first to move your Avatar across a map of mythical creatures while flipping and rotating cards to victory!
mechanics: Area Movement, Memory, Modular Board

name: Super Dark
description:
Everyone knows money can buy political influence, but did you know that some groups can spend millions to shape our elections without revealing where their funds came from? This is a game about how elections can be shaped by money.

Players are secretly assigned to one of two teams — Citizen or Super PAC — and compete to elect candidates through strategic donations. Super PAC players know each other and can corrupt politicians with their donations, so it’s up to Citizens to figure out who the Super PAC players are and work around them to elect honest politicians and keep democracy healthy.

Every round, all players draw 2 money cards from the bank and publicly donate a money card to one of the candidates. All money donated by Super PAC players secretly counts as dark money. When a candidate receives enough money to be funded, players learn whether the candidate was "resisted" (a point for the Citizens) or "corrupted" (i.e. enough dark money was donated to corrupt the candidate - a point for the Super PACs).

Super PACs win if they corrupt half the candidates. Citizens win if they can stop the Super PACs!
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Negotiation, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Obsession: Characters Expansion
description:
A strange Dowager lives outside of Derby in a sprawling manor distastefully done up like a Scottish castle. More distasteful yet is that her estate is simply crawling with odd characters, refugees from around Europe and eccentric, if pedigreed, characters from closer to home. Respectable people shun the great lady for her appalling taste in acquaintances, but one must confess that her rabble is spectacularly interesting...

The Characters expansion for Obsession brings thematic new personalities to Derbyshire who provide unique actions for managing your country estate: Constable Bucket, a fair hand at running off all manner of unsavoury guests; a Mr. Higbee who can find domestic help in a pinch (“References? I am sure they are here somewhere…”); the wise Reverend Grantly, a dispenser of sage advice; and an Eccentric Dowager Marchioness, who will connect you with a Prussian major, Swedish noble, and a Russian count as quick as a wink.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Solomon Sea
description:
(From the Simulation Workshop site)
Designed by Markus Stumptner, Solomon Sea simulates the World War II carrier battles for control of the sea lanes around the Solomon Islands, from May to November 1942. One player commands the Allied (US and Australian) forces and the other the Japanese. Victory is obtained by destroying the opposing fleets, landing invasion forces, or bringing supplies to beleaguered beachheads.
Solomon Sea is a double blind 2-player game, which means each player moves his task forces, air strikes, and search planes on his own map, and tells the other player about the hexes he searches. Combat is resolved by a series of dice rolls. Each hex represents a diameter of 100 nautical miles, with 3 hours per turn. Each counter represents 6 to 10 planes, individual carries, or groups of smaller ships. Four scenarios are included: Coral Sea, Eastern Solomons, Santa Cruz, and Guadalcanal.
Solomon Sea won the 2000 Charles S. Roberts award for Best DTP-Produced Boardgame.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kruzno
description:
Kruzno is an abstract strategy game usually played with two players on a hexagonally tiled board. Though the rules are extremely simple (three minutes to learn for most players), the number of possible moves and interactions are comparable to chess.

Kruzno uses standard chess pieces (bishops, knights and rooks) but is more closely related to hexagonal checkers and R.C. Bell's Jungle Game. Like the Jungle Game, capturing is non-transitive: bishops capture knights; knights capture rooks; rooks capture bishops. This split between offense and defense means that most standard strategies of move and capture have to be scrapped or reworked.

Game variants include versions with reduced number of pieces for faster play and expansion sets for three players.

Home Page: http://www.kruzno.com/
mechanics: Point to Point Movement

name: To Save the Union
description: A strategic level block game depicting the American Civil War from the spring of 1862 until the autumn of 1864.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Movement Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: From the Cellar: Pack 4
description: "Rising Star, Falling Cross: The Russian Civil War in Manchuria, Siberia, and Outer Mongolia." Twenty Advanced Squad Leader scenarios (FT116 to FT135), some short new rules, and a small set of counters to allow the ASL fanatic refight the battles of the Russian Revolution writ large in North and East Asia, from April 1908 to July 1921. Includes White Russian, Red Russian, Imperial Chinese, Chinese warlord, Mongolian, Japanese, American, and Hungarian troops.
categories: Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Nuts! Second Edition: Eastern Front 1941-45 – Clash of Titans
description:
Clash of Titans covers the war between Germany and the Soviet Union from 1941-1945. The Eastern Front, as it was known, spanned over one thousand miles and was the largest theater of war ever seen in human history...

Clash of Titans is the Eastern Front source book which allows you to portray the sharp end of a wide range of actions -- from the close combat of partisan raids to long range tank actions upon the wide open steppes.

The book includes unit and equipment lists for the Soviets, Germans, Italians (8th Army), Romanians, Hungarians and Finns -- all the major combatants on the Eastern Front from 1941 to 1945, plus rules for cavalry and bicycle troops, parachute landings, amphibious operations, Stuka attacks, city fights, and much more. Clash of Titans allows you to play one-off battles or entire campaigns that can be based around any of the main combatants and campaigns on the Eastern Front.
