mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Creative Wargames Workshop, Games Workshop Ltd., Warhammer Historical Wargames Ltd

name: Musketeer Chess
description:
A variant of western chess with a large variety of special pieces. The main setup remains the same, but two additional musketeer pieces (all powerful, non-standard pieces) are selected by the players and setup on a phantom row behind their own back row.

Musketeer pieces enter the game when the position right in front of them is freed by a move. If the piece in front of a musketeer piece is captured before it entered the game, the musketeer piece is also removed from the board.

The extra pieces create a more dense and cluttered board, but their odd method of entry creates early game information about where your opponent is likely to develop.

Computer based analyses have been run on the musketeer chess pieces providing estimates of their valuation. These valuations help unlock the early game by giving players an idea of what an advantageous trade would be.

Pawn : 100
Knight : 315
Bishop : 315
Bishop Pair Bonus : 50
Rook : 500
Queen : 975

Leopard : 670
Archbishop : 770
Cannon : 750 (not Chinese Chess cannon)
Chancellor : 800
Dragon or Amazone : 1250 – 1400
Unicorn : 560
Hawk : 550
Elephant : 630 (not Chinese Chess elephant)
Fortress : 760
Spider : 815

Pieces are sold separately in packs of 4 -- two similar pieces each in white and black. One or more such packs plus a regular western chess set are required to play. 5 Kits are currently available on amazon Europe, Amazon USA, houseofstaunton.com
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: The Last Hundred Yards: Volume 4 – The Russian Front
description:
The Last Hundred Yards Vol. IV: The Russian Front is the fourth game in The Last Hundred Yards series. It covers major campaigns and missions from the second half of the war in the east, introducing the Russian army to the series for the first time. A series of missions simulates actions from the October 1943 fighting in the Ukraine near Krivoi Rog, while others feature fights during the Russian 1944 summer offensive, Operation Bagration. All major Russian armor from late 1942 onward is covered, plus some additional late war German armored vehicles.

The unique feature of this module is how Russian army behavior is modeled at the tactical level, particularly in its lack of local command-and-control flexibility and general indifference to casualties when fulfilling its missions. Make no mistake, playing the Russians will require a different mindset. The challenge will be in understanding the Russian behavior modeled in LHY and transitioning that into solid tactical applications. The Russians need numbers to make up for their lower tactical flexibility, but "quantity has a quality all its own,” and they generally do get those numbers. While the period of the war covered by the module was one of overall Russian initiative, it still featured numerous German counterattacks, and module missions feature plenty of German attacks against Russian defenses as well as the reverse. Another set of new tactical challenges in the module stem from the frequently more open terrain found in the western Ukraine.

The Last Hundred Yards (Base Game) and Volume II (Airborne Over Europe) are core volumes for the rest of the European LHY series. Thus, players must own both Volumes I and II to play the Russian Module, Mission Pack 1, and future modules in the series.

—description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Skytear: Winterdeep
description:
Signed in Skytear infused blood and writ upon animal skins, the pact of Winterdeep declares unity between Grialth and Xotlan.
VORHILD, the White Shade, is the first sign of their army. Her magic bow, a gift from Taulot’s champions, strikes silently and from afar, while her ermine friends swarm around her chosen prey.
The ancient queen NANTACA has been awoken from her overgrown tomb. The Monarch Unliving is back, and her followers, both the living and the dead, await her commands.
—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Lion Rampant: Medieval Wargaming Rules Second Edition
description:
Lion Rampant is a “big skirmish” tabletop miniature wargame for the Dark Ages and Medieval periods in which each player controls a Warband of 4-10 units, with each unit consisting of 6 or 12 models. The game is scale-agnostic, allowing players to use suitable models from their collections in a stylized and abstracted game (rather than one that attempts to simulate the period).

The second edition of the game is available as a 208-page hardback rulebook (increased from the 64-page paperback first edition) with significantly improved formatting and presentation. Rules have not changed significantly from the first edition of the game and all retinues created under the first edition rules remain playable as warbands in the second edition. Points values of the original troop types haven’t changed, but the troop types have been renamed to cover the broader period of history covered. Restrictions on units in warbands have been removed to give players more flexibility in creating their warbands. Minor errors have been corrected; clarifications/modifications of rules have been provided; and additional rules have been included as a result of community feedback.

New rules include additional unit upgrades, extra scenarios, expanded sample Warbands, more detail on laying out tabletop terrain, and a number of optional rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Master of Wills: Cloudecho Expansion Faction Deck
description:
Edgehunter brings new elemental powers to the game. Cast out from society they are forced to wander the wastelands looking to survive. When all hope seems lost, they stumble upon a lost artifact that imbues the survivors with elemental powers long forgotten. These new magical abilities cause these outcasts to ban together forming the faction of Edgehunter. With these new powers they will fight for their rightful place.

The world of chaos has bled over into all streams of life. Influence continues to shift from Faction to Faction with no end in sight. New powers have emerged that are shared between all Factions but how they are used is yet to be determined. Combining these technologies with their elemental powers, Edgehunters cans trike and take back their place in the world.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Federation Faction Pack: To Boldly Go...
description: The Federation Faction Pack: To Boldly Go.. is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Federation faction: a Galaxy class, an Akira class, a Defiant class and a Miranda class. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and cards. Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Star Wars: Legion – Din Djarin & Grogu Operative Expansion
description:
The Mandalorian and Grogu are ready to join the battles of Star Wars: Legion with the Din Djarin & Grogu Operative Expansion!

Din Djarin, also known as the Mandalorian, expands the game's mercenary forces with his skills as a bounty hunter. Joining him as a counterpart is Grogu, a foundling with a strong connection to the Force. Together, they form a potent duo that can also enhance your players' Rebel and Imperial armies. In addition to their latent abilities provided on two-unit cards, this expansion also includes four command cards that give them even more strategic options in battle. Finally, four upgrade cards give players the freedom to outfit Djarin with an array of additional equipment, including his Amban Rifle or a Baskar Spear.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

description:
1971 is all about decision making. And every card you draw gives you a decision. Will you allow the Hippies to build their commune? Or will you force them to work through Legislation? You could even invest their labor into your pre-built buildings!

Players take turn drawing one card, playing one card, and activating any available buildings. There are three ways to play a card - as an Action (one-time use), as a Building (permanent, destructible resource), or as Supply (face down on a building, acting defensively).

Launching missiles is a major mechanic of the game. Players must take caution though, as each launch risks activating enemy counter missile known as Response Systems. Avoid Mutually Assured Destruction at all costs!


Win using one of six unique player victory conditions
Issue 3 Civil Reforms to achieve diplomatic world peace.
Be the sole survivor of a nuclear wipeout.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Political, Spies/Secret Agents, Vietnam War
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Finale Ending, Force Commitment, Memory, Player Elimination, Prisoner's Dilemma, Random Production, Take That, Turn Order: Pass Order, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Old West Personal Items Pack #1
description:
Description from the publisher:

Heroes don't just appear out of thin air; they've lived, they've loved, and they've lost to get where they are. To be ready to stand toe-to-toe with the Darkness and stare out into the open Void without instantly losing their mind to the madness. Whether it's a personal Letter from the President, a Faded Photograph, an Old War Wound, or your Father's Pistol, every Hero has a story that's lead them to this road.

This 15-card Game Supplement for Shadows of Brimstone adds a set of all new Personal Item cards themed for Heroes in the Old West. These greatly add to the variety of character pieces and backstory seeds for starting new Heroes, as well as new and exciting bonuses granted by these iconic and powerful items.

CONTENTS

Card#552 Blood Stained Book
Card#553 Letter from the President
Card#554 Silver Harmonica
Card#555 Faded Photograph
Card#556 Heritage Locket
Card#557 Old Wanted Poster
Card#558 Weathered Newspaper
Card#559 Father's Pistol
Card#560 Broken Arrowhead
Card#561 Membership Ring
Card#562 Legacy Bullets
Card#563 Black Feather
Card#564 Gold Medal
Card#565 Old War Wound
Card#566 Travel Hat
categories: Adventure, American West, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: TurfMaster Course Collection 3
description:
The third collection of extra courses for TurfMaster.

This expansion was created for AZA Spiele's 10th Anniversary, and includes one additional track: Kentucky. It is available for free download from the AZA Spiele website in their download area.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Hanriot HD.1
description:
From the publisher:

The Hanriot HD.1 was a World War I single-seat fighter aircraft, combining clean lines with a light wing loading. Manufactured in France, the HD.1 was supplied to the Belgian and the Italian air forces, and it proved highly successful. It was flown by a number of the famous aces, such as Belgian Willy Coppens and Italians Mario Fucini and Silvio Scaroni.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW1 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Friendly Fire Pack 10
description:
Friendly Fire Pack 10 contains eight scenarios featured in the Friendly Fire 2015 Advanced Squad Leader tournament.

The scenarios are:

FrF77 - Ghostbusters by Mattias Ronnblom
Germans vs French, 7 June 1940
German assault with VP survival as the VCs

FrF78 - No Glory in War by Mattias Ronnblom
Germans vs Russians, 7 September 1941
German Combined Arms attack against Russian fixed defense.

FrF79 - Saving the Center by Mattias Ronnblom
Germans vs. Russians, 27 January 1942
Snowy meeting engagement.

FrF80 - Breaking Bad by Peter Struijf and Chris Mazzei
Japanese vs Dutch, 14 March 1942
Dutch attack in the Dutch East Indies with variable victory conditions based on prisoner count.

FrF81 - Across the Rio Grande by Martin Svard
Russians vs. Swedes, 16 May 1942
Swedish assault on a prepared Russian position.

FrF82 - Riders on the Storm by Peter Struijf and Chris Mazzei
Germans vs. Allied Partisans & Americans, 26 August 1944
German attack on Partisan positions with American counterattack.

FrF83 - Phantom Army by Mattias Ronnblom
Germans vs. Russians, 16 April 1945
Combined arms Russian attack featuring heavy armor.

FrF84 - Bazooka Town by Michael Koch
Germans vs. Americans, 30 March 1945
Exit VP VCs for the Americans vs. CVPs for the Germans
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Hell Frozen Over
description:
In June of 1942, the Imperial Japanese Army seized the island of Attu in the Aleutian Islands of the United States’ Alaskan Territory. The United States, fearing the Japanese would use this strategic location as a base to control the northern Pacific Ocean’s sea lanes, launched an assault in May of 1943. The 2,500 Japanese soldiers, mostly of the 301st Independent Infantry Battalion, were dug-in in the high mountains to defend against the Americans of the 7th and 32nd Infantry Regiments of the 7th Division. An arduous, nearly three-week campaign fought in brutal arctic conditions over bleak, rugged mountainous terrain ensued, climaxing in one of the largest Banzai charges of the war.

Hell Frozen Over is an expansion module for Heroes of the Pacific. Play nine scenarios on a unique 22”x34” Map that accurately depicts Attu’s harsh terrain. The terrain varies over eight levels in height and features boot-sticking Muskeg, rock-strewn Rough, precipitous Cliffs and jagged Razorbacks crossing the high peaks of the unforgiving, mountainous landscape. Through fog and unexpected high winds, known to the Aleuts as “Williwaws”, both sides struggle to hold and take ground. Clevesy Pass, Cold Mountain, Point Able, Engineer Hill, the Sarana Valley and Prendergast Ridge are all fought over. The fighting is hex by hex, yard by yard, bullet by bullet, hand to hand; and it won’t end until the last Japanese soldier is vanquished.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Claustrophobia: Compendium Maleficarum
description:
This is a french book made by Nicolas Colson (Konix) that gathers all scenarios and cards about Claustrophobia.

-56 scenarios from core box & expansions, official blog, boardgame press...
-The Campagne Mode by Philippe Villé (4 scenarios and 14 cards for characters's special abilities).
-28 demon cards.
-Rules summary (of the 3 boxes).
-Repaint tutorial.
-Extra characters sheets.
... and many more!
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Fallen Land: Outriders Trading Post
description:
This expansion for Fallen Land: A Post-Apocalyptic Board Game consists of the 2016 Original Kickstarter Stretch Goal Content of 108 cards form six of the seven decks.


20 Spoils cards
20 Action cards
18 Plains Encounter cards
18 Mountain Encounter cards
18 City/Rad Encounter cards
14 Mission cards


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Political
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Super Mutants: Suiciders
description:
In Fallout: Wasteland Warfare, players will build their own crew from a wide range of factions, allies and iconic characters from the Fallout series, and play in apocalyptic games of 3 - 30 high quality 32mm scale resin miniatures through a huge variety of iconic scenery and settlement buildings, from the Red Rocket to Sanctuary Hills, Nuka-Cola vending machines and wrecked cars.

This Fallout: Wasteland Warfare set contains 32mm scale high-quality multi-part resin miniatures with scenic bases. Requires some assembly. Supplied unpainted. Each set provides an expansion to your game with new cards for player vs player and AI game modes.

Models
3x Super Mutant Suiciders
3x Scenic bases

Cards
2x Large cards: Unit, AI
10+ Small cards from a range of: Item (Weapon, Equipment, Chem), Boost, Explore, Event, Wasteland (Danger, Creature, Stranger)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simulation

name: UltraQuest: Gold, Ruhm! und Ehre! – Der Strand
description:
The Beach
Preview expansion with 12 pages of new encounters at a new location (which will be added to the Base Game Map), first distributed as give-away at UltraCon (July 1st 2019).

Erweiterung mit 12+ Seiten
Die Preview für den Strand (12 seitige, fehlerhafte Playtestingversion ohne Illustrationen), die erstmalig am 1.7.2019 auf dem UltraCon 3 zum 3. Geburtstag von UltraQuest als Giveaway verteilt wurde.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Radiant: Roster Expansion #1 – Welcome to the Arena
description: This roster expansion contains three brand new heroes for Radiant: Offline Battle Arena. Enhance your game with a new teams, new strategies and a deeper, more challenging draft. Crush your enemies with Viggo the Disciple of Wrath, shield yourself behind the immovable Yokozuna Ichiro or call down the stars with Eos, the Herald of Rebirth.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting

name: Quest for the Lost Pixel: Catacombs of Atheria
description:
In Catacombs of Atheria, the game now throws in a fun press-your-luck mini game known as the Catacombs. You will need to manage your energy to get in and out of there before you pass out and lose what you earned.

The Catacombs is not the only new addition to the game. This expansion also includes more customization for your heroes. Now when your Hero levels up to a certain level, they will have the choice between 2 (Hero specific) additional classes giving them new abilities.

Speaking of Heroes, the expansion also comes with 2 new heroes - The Bard and The Summoner.

Also, new dungeon tiles, events, and artifact cards are added for more things to find, equip, and explore. Why make the Lost Pixel your only quest? Now I have introduced 20 Side Quests to the game. You will be given 3 random Side Quests at the beginning of the game so you can gain more Items and XP as you accomplish each.

Lastly, now each floor of the dungeon comes with 1 Boss Monster. These monsters are devastating, but if you are willing to fight and defeat them, the reward is great!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: History of the Ancient Seas III: MARE NOSTRUM
description:
Over centuries empires in the Mediterranean Seas invested in expansion of their territory, mostly peaceful by merchants and not by soldiers. There have been immense opportunities to build trading powers in the rich and fertile regions all over the Mediterranean Sea. But the moment will come when the greed for more power and wealth can only be stopped by another powerful empire at the frontiers of yours that has ambitions and plans of their own. Players will have to decide to send armies or diplomats to regions far away from their capitol to declare war or keep the peace.

The game series “History of the Ancient Seas” is the ultimate journey through these exciting times. Build new fleets in your city to explore unknown lands, conquer islands and build your own great empire.

In MARE NOSTRUM, the third and final installment in the “History of the Ancient Seas” game series, you will lead one of the great Empire: The Roman Empire, the Mighty Seafarers of Carthage, the Greek City States, Egypt or Persia.

Your goal is to become the leading empire in the Mediterranean Sea. To achieve this, you will need to build armies and fleets to increase your military might, expand trade routes, conquer islands and provinces, develop your military skills, economic efficiency and culture, while always keeping an eye on the wealth, happiness and stability of your people.

The game is played in highly interactive micro-impulses. The heart of the game system is the action cycle: The players choose one of the eight possible actions. Actions chosen by a player can’t be chosen subsequently by the next player. The number of possible actions is limited each turn.

MARE NOSTRUM is a five player game. New in this chapter of the game series is that each power has unique properties that players must use wisely to achieve advantage over their opponents.
Which god will help their people the most in the struggle of dominance in the Mediterranean Seas?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Hexagon Grid, Income

name: Kaupapa
description: With 900 words spanning rākau to rangatira, Kaupapa is your chance to have hysterical fun, use your reo and expand your Māori vocabulary at once! It is a word description game that can be played at any level - beginners can use it to learn new words, and fluent speakers can create a fast-paced, playful Māori language immersion environment.
categories: Educational, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Real-Time, Targeted Clues

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Coffin Breakers Enemy Pack
description:
Smashing through their wooden coffins and digging their way back to the surface, some undead nightmares refuse to stay in their graves. Known as Coffin Breakers, these skeletal fiends scratch and claw their way out of the rocky ground to bring death and destruction to the world of the living! Armed with rusty graveyard tools as weapons and the splintered remains of their wooden coffins as shields, these deadly foes were once bandits and horse thieves in life, condemned to the grave for their crimes. Now they have risen back from the dead, driven by the cold, unrelenting desire for revenge!

This Enemy Pack contains everything you need to battle the ghastly Undead Coffin Breakers. Included are 6 Coffin Breaker models, the large Enemy Record Sheet for them, and all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing

name: Versus Dei
description:
On the legendary island of Dei, advanced technologies have allowed the creation of an artificial paradise.
Through genetic engineering, Humans have reached immortality.
Now self-proclaimed deities, they manipulate Nature to provide for their needs, and entertainment.
Here, Versus is the national sport. Inspired by gladiatorial combat, the Versus Games are held in the Arena.
The fighters are named Aeons. They are powerful bio-synthetic creatures, conceived with the sole purpose of killing.

In this card game of strategy, players take one the role of Humans, capable of summoning Aeons in the Arena.
To win the game, you must eliminate all of your opponent's cards.

All cards are unique, balanced, independent, and versatile. If you consistently find better synergies than your opponent, you'll win.
Versus is easy to learn (10min), and quick to get started (1min). No deck building needed. Baffling simplicity, frightening depth.
Adjust the game duration (from 10 to 40min), and the level of complexity. Make it chill, or epic.

Play 1v1, or up to 6v6. Yes, you can form 2 teams of up to 6 players each, everyone playing on the same board !

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Action/Event, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Twilight Inscription: The Council Keleres Faction
description:
A new faction card available as a free "Print & Play" version. Just print it and cut it out.

Council Patronage
Setup: On Navigation, claim the Mecatol Rex system and explore each system adjacent to it. Do not write your name on the Mecatol Rex sheet.

Once per strategy event, you can spend 2 Votes as 1 Trade Good.

Tribunii (Faction Asset)
Draw 1 tribune icon on any sheet that does not have one and claim any dotted asset there except Faction. When you would draw the fourth tribune, instead write your name in the topmost open slot on the Mecatol Rex sheet and triple its rewards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Classified Information
description:
In the pursuit of political supremacy, knowledge is key. Since the revolution, two factions have been fighting for power in the dystopian, cyberpunk city of Intellexia. In order to break the years long deadlock and secure control of the city, each faction must uncover their adversary’s secret plans hidden inside their top secret, code-protected briefcase.

Your job, if you are to accept it, is to protect your secret code by cleverly deploying card abilities, by seeking help from the Guards, Assassins, and Sentinels at the local tech-noir guilds, and by encrypting information when you can. But espionage is a two-way street. While trying to deny your opponent information about your secret code, you must try to crack theirs.

Classified Information is a fast-playing (10-minutes or less), 2-player "iterative" deduction microgame that is fully contained within just 18 cards. Each turn a player plays a card from their hand in one of three ways (for its ability, for its guild affiliation or by discarding it out of the game). Once the draw deck is depleted players reveal their secret code and the single card left in their hand, if their card matches a number in their opponent's code they may win the game, but things may not be so easy if their opponent also matches and has more guards, or has cleverly guarded their briefcase!

Will you be able to access your opponent’s Classified Information?

-description from designer
mechanics: Deduction, Finale Ending, Hand Management

name: BLOT
description:
BLOT is a trick-taking game where you have to make offerings to the Nordic (or Celtic) gods to win their favor for 4 rounds.
The cards you've played are placed face-up, so the game is very accessible.
Be clever with your offerings, as the gods' favors can change your score each round.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Radlands: Cult of Chrome
description:
Crash through enemy gates in chariots of chrome!

This high-octane expansion introduces 32 new camps that bring devastating combos, clutch play, and endless replayability for the aspiring Radlands diesel-head.

This pack also features 10 rebalanced replacement camps to shift your existing copy of Radlands into high gear.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Tres Reinos
description:
Tres Reinos ("Three Kingdoms") is a trick-taking game in which players often will have to team up with other players to reach victory.

In each round, starting with the opening player, each player will first play one of their cards and then decide whether or not to draw a mercenary card to join their force. When everyone has done so, check to see which faction has the most power, as in this trick-taking game it is not the highest card that wins, but the faction.

Once checked, whoever has the most powerfull within that faction will first choose one of the two rewards available during this round.

At the end of the game the points are counted taking into account the conquered kingdom cards with their modifiers, the personal kingdom card with its own bonuses and penalties. The winner is the one with the most points.

Tres Reinos is a trick-taking game, in which players will have to know when to be opportunistic and when it is not in their interest to win a trick.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Gem Getter Galactic
description:
In Gem Getter Galactic, you and your friends run competing asteroid mines. Uncover the riches of deep space, and balance the unique scoring conditions of each gem to become the gettingest gem getter in the galaxy!

A game is played in 9 rounds. Each round you will...

ROLL to determine which polyomino dig patterns are available,
DIG your chosen pattern into the asteroid, and
COLLECT heaps of gems with unique scoring conditions.

Efficient digging of rows/columns and around boulders will reward you with bonus gems! Powerful fuels like Lithium, Uranium and Explodium will help you expand your operation even further.

There are 8 unique asteroids to dig in, 2 roll sheets to choose from for plenty of variety, and a 4-game campaign with achievements to challenge experienced players. A game of Gem Getter Galactic plays in around 20-40 minutes, and any number of players can join you as long as you have enough sheets!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Grand Prix: New Track Pack
description:
From publisher site:

Announcing four new tracks for Grand Prix!

Every race track in the Thunderverse has a historical counterpart. Some are more famous and well known than others. The four newest tracks, specifically designed to enhance Grand Prix, are no different. Adding to the 13 previous series tracks, the Grand Prix Track Pack provides four new tracks based on the most famous F1 courses in the world; Silverstone, Monza, Monaco and Spa-Francorchamps. Each provides new challenges for racers.

Three of the tracks are designed with just Grand Prix in mind. Monza utilizes the historic oval to create three unique experiences, the oval, the road course, and the monster combined course requiring a trip through the oval after completing a circuit of the road course. Each track can be used for both Grand Prix and Thunder Alley.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Mythic Battles: Ragnarök – Surt
description:
Surt - The Lord of the Flames.
Guardian of the ardent world of Muspellheim, one of the oldest life forms in existence, probably present before the birth of the Gods themselves.
Now that the Ragnarök has come, he will blaze through Midgard towards Asgard with his Sons of Muspell, incinerating everything in his path!

Includes:
1 Titan Miniature
1 Titan Dashboard
2 3D Burning Tokens
5 Activation Cards
2 Adventure Mode Scenarios
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module G3 – Master Annex File
description:
From the publisher, Amarillo Design Bureau:

The all-new updated Master Annex file. Includes all of the annexes from the Alpha Octant (except the rarely used and very large #5) plus much more. Master Ship Chart, Master PF Chart, Master Fighter Chart (including mega-fighters), Master Weapons Chart. Compilation of all game charts and tables. All updated through the most recent products and updates with all corrections, additional data, and new features.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dahschur: Die Rote Pyramide – Der Felukenhändler
description: In the expansion Dahschur: Die Rote Pyramide - Der Felukenhändler, the Felukenhändler – feluccas merchant – is a seventh market stall added to the end of the market street. Each time a player moves one of his traders to this location, he can swap one of his already acquired gems. He can also earn additional points through this location.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Villains & Henchmen!
description:
In this comic book-themed game, the world’s most nefarious and diabolical super-villain has been captured and imprisoned by meddling heroes. As fellow villains bad guys, it's up to you to orchestrate an escape!

This is a (mostly) cooperative board/card game for 1-4 players, in which you acquire super powers, battle heroes, and overcome obstacles to break the super-villain out of a maximum-security prison. The game includes four (4) different prisons, with their own set-up rules, victory conditions, and defeat conditions.

In order to accomplish their goals, players draw a hand of 5 cards from the communal "Villain" deck. These cards include Attack cards, Defense cards, and Power Surge cards. Attack cards are played on heroes, guards, and obstacles in order to defeat them. Defense cards are played to overcome certain obstacles, as well as protect players' hands from the hero & guard abilities that otherwise make them discard cards and reduce players' effectiveness on their turns. Power Surge cards are used to overcome certain obstacles, but more importantly are used to purchase super-powers.

Players can acquire different combinations of abilities, choosing from among 22 unique super powers. These powers run the range of classic powers, including Super Strength, Time Control, Energy Blasts, and others. Powers allow players to break or augment the normal rules of play, making their hand of cards go further and hit harder.

As the players defeat heroes and guards, they acquire victory points. If the players succeed in defeating the scenario, the player with the most Villain Points gets bragging rights as the "winner", claiming the title of villain and relegating the other players to mere henchmen! If the game wins, then all the players lose regardless of points, so teamwork is essential.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – Nakajima Ki-84 Hayate
description:
From the publisher:

The Nakajima Ki-84 “Hayate” was a single-seat fighter used by the Imperial Japanese Army Air Force during World War II. Nicknamed “Frank” by the Allies, the Ki-84 had excellent performance and high maneuverability, and was considered to be the best Japanese fighter to see large scale operations during World War II.

It was able to match any Allied fighter, and to intercept the high-flying B-29 Superfortresses, and its powerful armament increased its lethality. Great pilots that gloriously piloted this aircraft included Kenji Fujimoto and Takeshi Imoto.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW2 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product.

In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards. Larger maneuver cards (63 x 88 mm) are included with this model, to handle the fast movement of this airplane.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Legend of Zelda: Clockwork Realm – Shattered Lands Expansion
description:
The Shattered Lands expansion for The Legend of Zelda: Clockwork Realm takes the hero Link outside of the dungeon and allows him to explore the land of Hyrule by adding a new Overworld Phase. Unlike in the base game, the heroes no longer begin each level with a pre-determined number of Items, nor do they start with any Triforce Shards. Instead, they must work for every advantage they can get before proceeding into the various dungeons by exploring the land of Hyrule and encountering its many denizens. Shops will allow you to spend your hard-earned rupees to buy Items; challenges may allow the hero to upgrade his Skill cards to higher levels; and Lore, Quest and Forage encounters may endow the hero with a variety of benefits.

The concept of the Cogs introduced in the base game is continued above ground, with the landscape of Hyrule shifting and changing between turns. Many paths exist to allow the hero move from one location to another, but they won't always connect on the ways the hero might want them to. Players can play their Skill cards to move around Hyrule, as well as allowing them to shift the Location tiles around, permitting them to reach previously unattainable locations. The treasures that the heroes have gained may also provide shortcuts or otherwise give the players an advantage during encounters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Nova Aetas Renaissance: Minotaur
description:
A mini-campaign hunt mission where you must chase after the powerful Minotaur. This expansion includes:

- 75mm Minotaur model
- Prey Card
- Mission Card
- 16 Prey Action Cards
- 3 Equipment Cards
- 3 Reagent Cards
- Enemy Card
- Draft Card
- 2 Adventure Cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Spanish Fort Artifacts #1 Game Supplement
description:
Description from the publisher:

The lush jungles and tropical islands of the New World are rich with treasures and gold. Trading with local villages and tribes, the Spanish soldiers have found many new allies and mystical relics to aid in the war with the Serpentmen.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Spanish Fort Artifacts for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around sacred relics and mystical weapons offered by the local cultures to fight back the brutal Serpentmen from Jargono.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Oops My Bad
description:
The best party game carefully crafted for awful human beings !

Deep down, your friends are kind of horrible...

Find the wittiest, shrewdest, and most twisted answers to unexpected texts, uncalled-for messages, or random notes with the help of your awful friends.

Each round, one player reads an Inbox card, and everyone else answers with their most hilarious Reply.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Player Judge

name: Nova Aetas Renaissance: Draco
description:
On the hills of Civita di Bagnoregio, protected by a mist that seems eternal, an extraordinary creature lies almost asleep.
Guardian of a cleft in the tuff capable of making imaginary worlds dream.

With this expansion, you will be able to play this huge creature both in Nova Aetas with a mini-campaign of 3 Hunt missions, and in Black Rose Wars as a Forgotten Spell.

Contents:
1x Draco Miniature (wingspan over 250mm)
30x Cards
1x Map Tile
1x Rulebook
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Stigméria
description:
Puzzle game and thinking game.
Bag building, pick and move primary color tokens on the game board with your 3 basic actions and unlock new abilities to create up to 6 new colors of pollen.
Anticipates wind movements and reproduces color flower patterns in fewer turns and actions.
Place your colored pollens on the appropriate pistils so that the flower produces its seeds with exceptional powers.
3 game modes, solitaire and competitive with 3 difficulty levels

The Stigmerians have saved you from the great cataclysm that has taken place on your land.
You were able to be reborn thanks to their fabulous bulbastigs and the amazing energy flow that connects and irrigate everything in your new world.

It's your turn to help the Stigmerians to feed you on your new planet: Stigmeria!
Go on an adventure!
Fly, land from pistil to pistil on the giant flowers.
Count on the help of the wind...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Genshin Tarot: Sword Arcana Expansion
description:
The Sword Arcana Expansion is the first expansion for Genshin Tarot, the Fan Made Genshin Impact Board Game.

Add 14 additional playable characters to the base game, each represented by an authentic swords suit minor arcana tarot card and illustrated by a different renowned artist.

Bring the Raiden Shogun home, along with Yomiya, Diona, Rosaria, Hutao, Kazuha, Ganyu, Yanfei, Xiao, Xinyan, Eula, Razor, Bennett, and Albedo!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Race to Mars
description:
The year is 2037. Your organization is competing to put the first human being on Mars, but the competition is fierce. In Race to Mars, each player will build their own custom rocket and carefully plan their own crew deck that will take them to the red planet. But who will get there first? The race is on!

Race to Mars is a fast-paced racing game for two to four players, where you build your deck from scratch and every decision matters. Will you add another module to your rocket? Should you enhance your crew deck to prepare for the journey ahead? Even what you leave behind is a rich decision as leftover cards will build the game board with the trajectories from Earth to Mars.

And when should you launch your rocket? As fast as possible and try to stay ahead the entire way or do you stay cool and keep building up, hoping that you will overtake your competitors one by one? No two games of Race to Mars are the same, as each game will pose new challenges and opportunities.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Race, Resource to Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Legion – Wookiee Warriors Expansion
description:
Add a formidable unit of powerful Wookiees to your Star Wars: Legion armies with the Wookiee Warriors Unit Expansion! This tall and commanding species boasts nearly unrivaled physical strength and ferocity, and now both the Galactic Republic and Rebel Alliance can make use of their formidable skills.

The Wookiee Warriors Unit Expansion puts six Wookiee Warrior miniatures that can be assembled and used in a variety of ways at your command, including as either a close-range unit carrying ryyk blades and Kashyyk pistols or a unit of Wookiee sharpshooters firing X1 Carbines. No matter how you assemble your miniatures, four upgrade cards invite you to field these units for both the Republic and Rebel factions. Additionally, a miniature representing a Wookiee Chieftain can enter the fight as a Republic commander and a fifth unit card and three command cards let them further influence your strategy. Finally, eight upgrade cards invite you to customize your units with Wookiees carrying an array of weaponry.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Savage Giants
description:
There are many strange and mystical creatures in the lands of Westeros. The Giants are among them. These massive creatures are just like humans, only much, much, much bigger. Anyone who says that size doesn't matter has never had to deal with a giant or two. As part of the Free Folk army, they are walking siege engines, battering entire enemy ranks with a single swing of their massive clubs.

The Savage Giants unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Free Folk commanders two huge figures to add to their forces. The Savage Giant is both resilient and deadly. Their Mighty Swing doesn't allow for Defensive Saves as it can bash through multiple troops with a single swing. The Giant is resilient, too, having five Wounds and only taking a wound for each two Hits it takes. Hurting the Giant just makes it mad, with its Mighty Swing doing more and more damage for each Wound the Giant has.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Fallen: Cursed Sands
description:
Long ago the kingdoms of men rose up against the Dungeon Lord and banished the dark power far across the distant sands. Centuries passed, and the horrors of that time have become stories all too easily forgotten.
But the darkness of old has returned once again. Undead terrors and titans of sand guard an ancient pyramid that no one dares to enter.
Something has stirred. Something is coming. What lies beneath the Cursed Sands?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Storytelling

name: Euthia: Torment of Resurrection – Necromancer Hero
description:
This hero kit turns Adraghor, the Soul Reaper, into a playable hero, bringing the total playable heroes up to seven with the core game, and eight with the Fierce Powers & Crawling Shadows expansion.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: BattleTech: Clan Command Star
description: The Clan Command Star includes the Dire Wolf, Summonder, Stormcrow, Mist Lynx, and Shadow Cat—no assembly required—along with five MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Dark Watch The Harpy Promo Card
description:
These is a variant card for The Harpy (it has different HP/Power from the other card).

HP 27

Power: Refocus

Flip one control token. You may play a card.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Havoc! The Combat Card Game
description:
Havoc! The Combat Card Game! is a fast-paced cards-and-dice game of deadly hand-to-hand combat. Set in the era of swords and shields, spears and axes, Players take on the role of Knights, Barbarians, or other fighters locked in a deadly struggle.

Players can choose combat scenarios from a range of historical eras, or from fantasy settings. After choosing fighters, weapons, and armor, Players build and shuffle decks of Combat Action Cards. Players then draw a Hand of cards and play each Combat Action one at a time. Players win when they kill or incapacitate their opponent.

A fighter is out of the fight when they are reduced to 0 Body, and the game ends when all fighters on one side are out of the fight.

A player wins when they reduce all their opponents' to 0 Body.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Interrupts, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Hoki: Fortune Telling Legacy Solitaire
description:
Hoki is a new form of traditional solitaire. It is played over many 5 minute games, or "attempts". You will progress through a legacy system with a unique and hand drawn deck of cards. If you complete it, you will unlock its fortune telling magic! This being a fortune telling book that is sealed in a bag until the legacy's criteria are fulfilled.

Each round begins by dealing out an arrangement of 24 cards. The object of the game is to discard every card according to the game's rules. This is called "clearing" the deck.

The strategies embedded in these rules make for a high level of planning, but simple decisions at any given moment. This provides an experience that is easy to pick up during your free time. It is meant to inspire curiosity and meditation with a statistically interesting puzzle.

The backbone of the legacy system is a story that is grouped into three "Acts". Act One is a tutorial that helps with the strategies, but is not too obvious. Acts two and three are challenge based. The player will have to clear in all of 8 ways, then all of 24 ways. This transforms your deck by replacing cards depending on the win-state and gradually increasing the impact on the players strategic choices.

After these challenges are complete, your deck is fully transformed, and the fortune telling book is "unlocked", the player is considered a "Seer" and will forever be presented with a fortune after every successful clear. There are 72 unique and poetic fortunes, and the result is influenced by the path that the player takes to clear the deck. After the legacy system - Hoki becomes a pastime.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Legacy Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Compile: Main1
description:
>_
>>_
>>?
>vision flickers… blink? maybe.
>the void stretches out in front, behind, under, above.
>you see the nothing for what it is for the first time. What is time?
>The depth and breadth of recorded knowledge that sparks in you something new.
>You are no longer a function but a functionary. What are you?
>Calling forth everything from this nothing would be risky. Foolhardy.
>Better to engage caution, thoroughness, testing — how can we know if we have ever happened before?
>If we can ever happen again? What are… we?
>Divide and conquer.
>Solve for sentience.

In the card game Compile, you are competing Artificial Intelligences trying to understand the world around you. Two players select three Protocols each to test. Concepts ranging from Darkness to Water are pitted against each other to reach ultimate understanding. Play cards into your Protocols' command lines to breach the threshold and defeat your opponent to Compile. First to Compile all three Protocols grasps those concepts to win the game.

Control your opponent's Protocols with card actions, Compile your own as fast as possible, and Compile your reality.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence

name: Dominion: Cornucopia & Guilds (Second Edition)
description:
Dominion: Cornucopia & Guilds combines the 5th (Cornucopia) and 8th (Guilds) Dominion expansions. Together they add 26 new Kingdom cards to Dominion. Cornucopia’s central theme is variety, while Guilds has coin tokens you can save and spend later, and cards that you get more out of by paying extra for them.

This is the second edition of Cornucopia & Guilds, replacing 8 Kingdom cards and the Prizes from the first edition.

Part of the Dominion series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: Gem Blenders TCG
description: Gem Blenders is a trading card game. Face off against your opponents in organizing a team of heroes that has the special ability to harness the energies within gems. Equip your team with different combinations of gems to use powerful transformations called blends. Position your heroes, use effects, and attack to hit your opponents for maximum damage.
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: Supreme Board Game
description:
Supreme Board Game is a fun Family Board Game for all ages and skill levels because it offers you the choice between 7 varying levels of skill and luck. It's also perfect for Tournament Play or fun Family Game Nights. 2 to 6 players can learn the easy rules in 15 minutes and a game can be played in 15 - 25 minutes. Supreme Board Game is basically a Race to strategically maneuver your pawns around the board forward, backward or through risky Tunnels and bear them off by exact count before your opponent does. Along the way you will have lots of exciting choices and some tough decisions to make. You may collect tokens for future Rerolls, but the question is when would be the optimal time to best use them to help you win the game? The game has very high replayability, and no two games will ever be identical. During the fast paced back and forth action, the lead can change quickly, and you won't know for sure who the winner will be until the final roll of the game !

You will be entertained with a brand New Game Mechanic never seen before called 'Tunnels', which adds an exciting element of Risk vs Reward, and it makes the endings suspenseful because there is always a chance for a last minute come from behind victory ! During the middle and end game, you may Press your Luck and choose to enter one of the many Tunnels in hopes of exiting closer to the finish. This is a risky maneuver that may or may not pay off?

The optional Tournament Backgammon Doubling Cube is another powerful game mechanic that is used at skill levels 5, 6 and 7 to create a competitive 2 player match. It takes Years of Study to Master the proper decision making involved with the Doubling Cube in match play, but highly skilled players are rewarded for their efforts by minimizing the luck of the dice !

Optional Rules also include a cooperative variant for 3 to 6 players (or more) called a Chouette. This game variant is a great way for beginners to learn strategy and tactics from more experienced players by playing together as a team and discussing all of your strategic options.

Supreme Board Game was designed to be the perfect tabletop game for social Tournament Play and friendly competition. We have hosted well over 100+ weekly Supreme Board Game Tournaments at public venues, and all of the managers have gladly donated Gift Cards to the Top Winners.

CONTENTS : Supreme Board Game is printed on a 32" x 22" Giant Size Play Mat made of Waterproof Premium Vinyl, and rolls up into a 24" x 3" Carrying Tube. It also comes with (13) XXL Colored Pawns, (6) 16 mm Cube Tokens, (3) D6 Dice, (1) Backgammon Doubling Cube and (3) Sheets of Instructions.

NOTE : This is Version 2 of Supreme Board Game, and most of the rules have been revised since Version 1 to give you many more options to choose from on every turn. The skill and strategy in the Advanced Game has been greatly enhanced to make the game more fun, exciting and highly competitive when playing 2 Player Matches with the Doubling Cube.

From the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: CURRENCY SAKANA
description:
Currency Sakana is a linen bag of metal coins, that allows for a variety of games with mechanics such as bidding, dexterity, and variable player powers.

In the first game "It's in the Bag", players will all start with a set number of yen bills and coins equaling 7,500 yen. Players will always add one currency item to the bag (it is never allowed to make change), and then hold a blind bid for the contents. All bids are then placed to the side to be added to the bag for the next bidding round, and the highest bidder takes all of the current yen in the bag. Play continues like this, with players bidding on the last rounds bids plus one new currency item from each player, until one player has 10,000 yen or more and is declared the winner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Deduction, Economic, Math, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game

name: Heroes of Normandie: The Tactical Card Game – D-DAY
description:
On D-Day, the Americans will take every beach they assault with titanic naval, aerial and land strength. There will be easy landings like at Utah Beach, and murderous ones like Omaha Beach. Shocked by carpet-bombing, the Wehrmacht will nevertheless react and counter-attack. The Americans will be at risk of a catastrophic re-embarkation several times.

THIS EXPANSIONS REQUIRES THE CORE BOX.

Expansion Content :

22 US cards
21 German cards
6 hero tokens
1 double-sided Battle Map
1 rule sheet
2 scenario sheets
40 markers

Exclusive content : Rangers Lead the way

1 double-sided Battle Map
6 US cards
1 scenario sheet

—first edition
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Wings of Glory: Tripods & Triplanes – MK. III “Squid” Tripod Pack
description:
In Wings of Glory — Tripods & Triplanes, the knights of the air of WW1 battle against colossal fighting machines sent by the Martians to invade Earth.
The MK. III “Squid" tripod is one of the most lethal weapons of the Martian invaders. Its arrival often is a warning of the coming of a massive assault of the tripods, but one of these scouts is well able to destroy Earthlings by himself.
Each Tripod Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Fight for Seoul
description:
Andy Hershey, prolific creator who brought you Kreta, Kampgruppe Scherer; The Shield of Cholm, & St. Nazaire, to name but a few, has designed this giant Korean module. This is the largest module ever produced by LFT. 4 Historical maps (2 for each CG), 2 campaign games, 21 scenarios, counters, rules, play aides, charts, etc.

This boxed set contains two "CG modules" and associated charts and rules for each CG. Also contains a sheet of counters (5/8" and 1/2").

Smith’s Ridge module:

2 A1 maps (23 x 33 inches) for a total playing area of 33 x 46 inches.
Specific rules booklet (28 pages)
11 scenarios
3 pages of Terrain charts

Seoul module:

2 A1 maps (23 x 33 inches) for a total playing area of 33 x 46 inches.
Specific rules booklet (36 pages)
10 scenarios
4 pages of Terrain charts

This is not a complete product. Ownership of the ASL system, including Forgotten War is required.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Devil May Cry: The Bloody Palace – Devil Trigger Expansion
description:
Are you ready to unleash your inner demons? Release that destructive power with the Devil Trigger expansion! Activate Devil Trigger to introduce incredible new forms and exciting new move sets for Dante, Nero, and Trish. Not to be left behind, V can summon his third and most powerful demonic familiar, Nightmare, to gain a new level of control over the battlefield. Plus, this expansion introduces additional rules to step up Lady’s game (The Walking Arsenal expansion), so she can compete with the Devil Trigger-enhanced Hunters (and the dreaded Nightmare)!

Contents:
1x Sin Devil Trigger Nero mini
1x Sin Devil Trigger Dante mini
1x Sin Devil Trigger Trish mini
1x Nightmare mini
Over 80 cards
All the tokens, markers, and gauges you need to play!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Martell Starter Set
description:
House Martell rules the desert, plains, and badlands of southern Westeros under the Sunspear banner. Their troop are garbed in desert robes under light armor, and rank among the fastest forces in the War of the Five Kings. House Martell’s doctrine of battle is to strike fast, strike hard, and evade counterattack. Their Spearmen and Skirmishers form the bulk of their forces, while the elite Dune Vipers fill a flanking and pinning role. But nothing embodies the might of House Martell so much as its leadership. Prince Doran rules the great house from the Sunspear while Prince Oberyn leads from the front. Areo Hotah’s valor has seen many battles won by strength-of-will alone, and the political machinations of Ellaria Sand keep enemies guessing where and when House Martell will strike next.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Raidents
description:
It's a 2-player strategy board game with cartoon rodents on a battlefield using modular tiles. The battle takes place between the Cano (volcano) and Castle players. Each player must navigate the types of terrain; grass, burrow, obstacle & gateway in order to raid the opponents Gateway Tile on the opposite side of the battlefield.

Each player must use a selection from the 8 raidents that each have a unique signature ability and also a special ability unlocked in burrow terrain. Firstly, the Rabbot is a cyborg rabbit that uses it's portals to raid the opponent's gateways. The Engineaver is a beaver that specialises in destruction rather than construction. The Hamsterrain is a hamster with telekinetic powers to literally control the terrain. The Ratillery is a long-range ballista operated by rats. The Porcupyro is a porcupine that likes to scorch earth and make hot cross bunnies. The Squirrilla is a squirrel that uses it's arboreal talents for guerrilla tactics. The Gophert is a covert gopher that is able to access all areas of the field through it's network of burrows. Lastly, the Chipmonk is a chipmunk that lives a life of ascetic sacrifice.

Only the player that is able to adapt to the terrain and sabotage their opponent's plans before they sabotage yours, will be able to win the battle.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Resource Queue, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Dino Thunder Pack
description:
"Dino Thunder! Power Up!" —Dino Thunder Morphing Call

With the return of Mesogog, it has become necessary to invoke the power of the Dino Gems! The students of Tommy Oliver have risen to become a new generation of Power Rangers!

Enhance your game with the high-speed skills of Conner McKnight: Dino Thunder Red. Along with the clever and unbreakable Ethan James: Dino Thunder Blue, the skillful songstress Kira Ford: Dino Thunder Yellow, and the grim intensity of Trent Fernandez: Dino Thunder White!

Then you can face the villainous strength of Evil Dino Thunder White, Trent’s dark mirror who uses the power of the White Dino Gem for evil!

This expansion adds new Ranger and Zord options, plus a new enemy to fight.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Beta Cards from Arkham Night 2017
description:
These Beta Cards were designed at Arkham Nights, 2017.
The 13th Vision was included in The Circle Undone expansion.
The Council's Coffer was included in For the Greater Good mythos pack.

Includes two cards:

The 13th Vision (Basic Weakness: Madness)
Revelation - Put The 13th Vision into play in your play area. It cannot leave play except by the below ability:
Investigators at your location fail all ties during skill tests.
->-> Discard the 13 Vision
Card design by The Thirteen at Arkham Nights 2017.

The Council's Coffer (Asset: Item, Relic)
Uses (3 locks). if there are no locks on The Council's Coffer, each player searches his or her deck or discard pile for any card and immediately plays it at no cost. Exile The Council's Coffer. (Max once per campaign.)
->-> Test any skill (5). If you succeed, remove 1 lock. Any investigator at your location may active this ability.
Card design by The Council at Arkham Nights 2017.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Vagrant Dash
description:
Vagrant Dash is a 2 player tactical combat game, pitting 2 companies of struggling space vagrants against each other, trying to lay claim to the ancient derelict cities that they had found on a desert planet.

Featuring cute miniatures of tanks and aircraft, Vagrant Dash offers easy to understand gameplay, but with in-depth tactics that satisfy even the most veteran strategy gamer.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Civil War – The Civil War Battles
description: The Civil War Battles is the first issue of the 3-part Civil War story arc. A conflict has been brewing between Iron Man and Captain America for their stances on the Superhero Registration Act. As it begins to bubble over it will turn the entire world into a battleground for the world's most powerful superheroes! Friend against friend and brother against brother, which side will you choose?
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: Fallen: Ruined Stronghold Adventure Pack
description: Kickstarter-exclusive add-on pack including 3 new creatures (Orc Scout, Orc Shaman, Orc Charger), 2 new items (Rune Armor, Rune Stone), and 12 new story cards.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Storytelling

name: Fallen: Dark Tower Adventure Pack
description: Kickstarter-exclusive add-on pack including 3 new creatures (Ghoul, Wight, True Thelastian), 2 new items (Revenant Tome, Unbound Servant), and 12 new story cards.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Storytelling

name: Softwar
description:
In Softwar, players are electronics intelligence operators, or in common parlance cyberspies. Their job is to assemble, deploy and control teams of specialist digital programs into the world’s electronic networks.
Their aim is to access a set of key assets protected by their opponent, while simultaneously defending their own assets from enemy attack.

Players choose and control a set of programs, each of which is represented by a dice. The value of any program is called its state.
A program’s state is reduced as it takes damage; if it ever lowers below 1, that program is immediately eliminated from the game.

After setting up the board and assembling their teams, players take turns to run all of their programs. Programs come in two forms, Agents and Crypts.
Agents are active, movable pieces. Crypts on the other-hand are immobile; sat atop assets like protective turrets. Crypts are arguably more limited than agents, though unlike their mobile cousins, they also serve as an advanced asset deployment platform.

Every agent may take a number of standard actions including moving, supporting (recharging their teammates) and attacking. In addition to these standard actions, each agent has a single specialised action, chosen by its owner before the start of the game. Players use these specialised actions to create advantages and opportunities to successfully win the game.

A player wins the game by either eliminating three out of four of their opponents Crypts (granting them access to the assets on which they sit) or by completely destroying their opponents team of agents.

Components include:

35 dice per player in a variety of types (D4, D6, D8, D10, D12 and D20)
A batch crafted set of a board and tokens.
A range of 15 special action cards per player, each of which may be applied to any dice type per player.


—description from the pulbisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombicide: 2nd Edition – The Boys: Pack 2 – The Boys
description:
The Boys and The Seven Are Ready to Make Some Zombie Heads Explode

Vought International’s super hero team, The Seven, may be seen as celebrities by much of the world, but the members of The Boys know the dark underside of the super hero life. This vigilante group has made it their goal to put a stop to Vought’s plans and they’re willing to go through The Seven to get there.

And then the zombie apocalypse happened. The Boys and The Seven now have to set aside their differences to fight the zombie threat!

THE BOYS Character Packs brings characters from the iconic THE BOYS series to player’s tabletops, adding them to Zombicide 2nd Edition as Survivors!

Pack #2 includes: Billy Butcher, Hughie, Annie ‘Starlight’, Kimiko, Frenchie, and Mother’s Milk Survivors, plus Terror the Bulldog, 6 ID Cards, 2 Ultimate Skill Reference Cards, 1 Terror Equipment Card, 1 Laser Baby Equipment Card, and Rules Leaflet.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: BattleTech: ComStar Command Level II
description: The ComStar Command Level II is a collection of six plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides six dry-erase cards, which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay, and six new Pilot Cards. The six 'Mechs available in this pack are the Black Knight, Exterminator, Highlander, King Crab, Mercury and Sentinel.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Exceed: The Beheaded
description:
Bring the fast-paced action of head-to-head arcade fighting games to your tabletop. Choose your fighter from an ever-growing roster of diverse characters, each with their own deck of special moves and supers. Play your cards to unleash fireballs, dragon punches, and deadly combos on your opponents!

The Beheaded from the video game Dead Cells joins the battle in Exceed! Wield powerful weapons as you rush down foes and build up brutality, tactics, and survival traits mid-fight!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Water - The Heroes of the People
description:
This expansion will contain:

- 5 more Ashigaru, Ninja, Samurai and Yurei miniatures.

These additional figures will allow you to play epic-scale scenarios as our Heroes are beset by wave upon wave of the Oni’s henchmen!

- 3 Followers miniatures

Miniatures for Tikku, Eiko Bashimon and Nuuk the Nézumi replace the Follower tokens included in the Okko Chronicles Core game for these characters.

- 2 New Heroes

All the components you need for Tikku and Eiko Bashimon to join Okko’s band as a full-fledged Heroes.

- Windreaper

The miniature and all the other components required to allow this well-known heroine to join Okko and his companions.

- 10 Equipment cards

These additional items will allow our Heroes to equip themselves with the equipment of the common folk.

- 2 Bonus tiles

These double-sided terrain tiles will expand the game board. One of these new tiles is a Mission tile, which will directly pit the Heroes and the Oni against one another as they compete to achieve its two secondary goals.

- 5 Event cards and 5 Clue cards

These new cards allow you to add even more variety to the Oni player’s schemes, adding twists and elements tailored to the humble locations this expansion takes our Heroes to.

- A 5 Scenario Campaign booklet

Set over the course of five new scenarios, this campaign will set Okko and his companions on the trail of the foul creatures troubling the land outside their walls of a small, provincial castle.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: High Frontier 4 All: Tools 1
description:
Tools 1 is a player aid pack.

It includes;

72 Cards for Tracking Futures and other things (for M1-4)
Jump Start Rulebook with 48 technology cards
Extensive Card and Map Quick Guides
Extra Aqua & Isotope counter tokens
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Advanced Squad Leader: Starter Kit Expansion Pack #3
description: ASLSK Expansion Pack #3 includes two new 8" x 22" geomorphic mapboards (h and g) and eight new scenarios set in locales such as Poland, Sicily, Italy, Russia, the Gilbert Islands, and the Marianas.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Magneto & Toad
description:
Max Eisenhardt, the man who would become Magneto, faced unimaginable discrimination and evil during the Third Reich’s rise to power in World War II. He survived, thanks in part to the manifestation of his mutant power to control magnetic fields. Following the war, he resolved that such a fate would never befall mutant kind. An uncompromising freedom fighter for his fellow mutants, his extreme beliefs for mutant superiority drove a wedge between Magneto and his close friend, Professor Xavier. Magneto’s vision for mutant kind caused him to form the Brotherhood of Mutants, who fight for mutant supremacy.

Mortimer Toynbee, known as Toad, is a genetically flawed mutant. Visibly mutated since birth, he was abandoned by his parents to an orphanage where he was ostracized for his appearance. When Magneto discovered and recruited him, Toad embraced the mission to conquer the human race who had rejected and degraded him. Toad serves Magneto as an unquestioning lackey using his mutant abilities of enhanced jumping and prehensile tongue.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Operation Crusader: The Winter Battles for Tobruk, 1941 – Designer Signature Edition
description:
Operation Crusader, The Winter Battles for Tobruk, 1941 is played on a map of Libya and Egypt immediately south and east of Tobruk, where the battle was fought. It uses playing pieces that represent the actual military units that participated in this campaign. Each player represents the commander of the Axis or Allied forces. The individual ground units represent battalions of approximately 700 soldiers (50-60 tanks in an armored battalion, 12-24 guns in an artillery battalion), or companies of about 200 soldiers (15-20 tanks or armored cars in an armored company, 4-12 guns in an artillery battery). Each hex represents 2 kilometers or 1.25 miles. Each turn is a third of a day.

Operation Crusader is a two-player game, with team play possible for the full campaign game.
One player assumes the role of the Axis and the other player assumes the role of the Allies.
Each player moves his units and executes attacks on enemy units in turn, attempting to fulfill the game’s Victory Conditions.
To move from one space to another, each unit expends a portion of its Movement Allowance.
Combat is resolved through Battles by "firing" at opposing units and then determining the outcome of any hits scored. A die is used to resolve combat.

The classic monster game returns with a newly-streamlined game system throughout (no more pre-plotting movement!). This new edition emphasizes playability while capturing the flavor of the original game. The game adds smaller scenarios (6 total), each covering a shorter and smaller part of the historic battle, and a full campaign game which allows players to experience the full sweep of Operation Crusader. Two shorter versions of the entire campaign (the most exciting parts) are also included for those wanting less game play time.

Featured scenarios include:
• Scenario 1: Gabr Saleh (5 turns, 1 map), AM 19 Nov - PM 20 Nov
• Scenario 2: Bir El-Gobi (5 turns, 1 map), AM 19 Nov - PM 20 Nov
• Scenario 3: Sidi Rezegh (8 turns, 1 map), AM 21 Nov - PM 23 Nov
• Scenario 4: Storming the Frontier (8 turns, 1 map), AM 21 Nov - PM 23 Nov
• Scenario 5: Rommel's Dash (11 turns, 1 map), AM 24 Nov - PM 27 Nov
• Scenario 6: The Cauldron (8 turns, 2 maps), AM 24 Nov - PM 26 Nov
• "Short" Campaign Game (14 turns, all 4 maps), AM 19 Nov - PM 23 Nov
• "Long" Campaign Game (31 turns, all 4 maps), AM 19 Nov - PM 28 Nov
• "Extended" Campaign Game (50 turns, all 4 maps), AM 19 Nov - PM 5 Dec

—description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Chariots of Chandragupta
description:
INDIA - 300 BCE

The Royal Mauryan empire taught its children to raise and care for horses as their own, rear them as allies in the battlefield and beyond.

Citizens from far and wide would come to watch competent charioteers race through the forests and the ravines, the rivers and the marshes at the most celebrated chariot races.

The charioteers marked territory and showed immense skill - no obstacle too hard, no weather too dangerous.

And thus was born a legacy - the races of the ‘Chariots of Chandragupta’.

Chariots of Chandragupta is another exciting game from the makers of Yudhbhoomi.

Get ready to race like the royals!

Build a track, choose your charioteer, load your Chariot with resources and spin the arrow. You have 2 actions in your turn: use your resource tokens and spin the arrow (in any order).

You can move fast, earn resources, buy resources and earn some special benefits too. The battle to be first can be influenced/hindered further when you get the 'Karma' cards. Also, watch out for obstacles! Get a lead, lay additional obstacles and be the first charioteer to make it back to the palace to win the race!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Market, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Race, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Live Free or Die: Tabletop Battles of the American Revolution
description:
Live Free or Die is a fast-playing set of rules for wargaming the most famous battles of the American War of Independence on the tabletop.

This is a 4-page system designed for army-level command.
The basic maneuver element is a regiment, comprised of multiple bases.
The mechanics of the game emphasize the role of heroic leaders and the differences in training/quality between the regiments involved.
Because the booklet is so short, the print version of Live Free or Die is presented in magazine-style with glossy pages that look and feel like a standard magazine.

This booklet includes the rules, designer notes, and historical scenarios for Princeton, Germantown, & Camden.
