Included with the Journal, however, are several Japanese tanks that were produced (Type 1 and Type 3) or were coming into production (Type 4) by the end of the war. In normal Golden Journal fashion, we have to have a scenario to play where we use these toys and one alternative history scenario is included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Dark Mages: Kickstarter Stretch Goals
description:
Twelve cards to expand Dark Mages:

- Enemy (Tenacious): Clay Golem
- Companion: Crocodile
- Spell (Common Sphere): Dominate Monster
- Trap: Fire Trap
- Artifact: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
- Magic Item: Leather Armor +2
- Encounter: Manticore
- Enemy (Tenacious): Mimic
- Trap: Pendulum
- Potion: Potion of Mage Armor
- Trap: Spiked Pit Trap
- Magic Item: Sword of Subtlely
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Phase Order

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Diana 1792 / Proserpina 1797
description:
The Diana was one of the six Mahonesas-class frigates built at the Mahón shipyard in Minorca, based on French and British construction techniques and improving upon them – She was the fastest ship of her class. It participated in the evacuation of the Spanish forces at the Siege of Roses during the French Revolutionary Wars. On 13 October 1796, she was captured after an action against HMS Terpsichore at the Strait of Gibraltar, nearby Cape Gata.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Mahonesa class frigate “Proserpina 1797”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Neptune 1803 / Ville de Varsovie 1808
description:
The Bucentaure class ship Neptune was launched at the beginning of the Napoleonic Wars. After missions on the West Indies, she was used against the British in Mediterranean Sea. During the Battle of Trafalgar she was engaged by Nelson himself, and she dueled with several British ships, surviving the battle. She later became part of the Spanish fleet, named Neptuno, after Spain declared war to France, and spent most of her life under the Spanish flag.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the French Bucentaure class ship of the line “Ville de Varsovie 1808”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dwarves with Swords
description:
Dwarves with Swords is a tabletop war game that deals with the daily struggles of dwarven clans: Who has the beer? Who is the better fighter? AND WHERE DID ALL THE HAMMERS GO?!?. The game has two primary objectives. Brawl and fight to the death or control areas for victory points.

There are two primary game mechanisms in Dwarves with Swords. The first is Group Building, where the player picks from four different dwarf classes and builds groups of nine to use in combat. Each of these different classes has things they are good at and things they are weak at, so it's important to build the groups based on the map objectives and personal play style.

The second is the actual combat, which is determined by rolling dice according to both the actions that are chosen for the groups and the relevant stat value (Armor, Dexterity, Strength, Knowledge, and Wisdom). The comparison of the attacking roll and the defending roll is done in a way that is unique to Dwarves with Swords, and makes use of all of the different die sizes that we love.

Another major component of the combat is Drunkenness. Every point of Drunkenness that the group has increases its combat stats while decreasing its Speed - but if the group reaches a Drunkenness level equal or greater than its Memory, the group Blacks Out and is removed from the board. All good dwarves know how to hold their booze, so being eliminated from the game this way is incredibly embarrassing!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That, Variable Phase Order

name: Grim Peak
description:
Grim Peak is a fantasy combat game set upon an arena atop a peak. Players are tasked with both surviving their time on the peak and working together to destroy a variety of enemies summoned into the arena with them, some of which, may affect other monsters in the arena, creating new, dangerous threats.

The game becomes more challenging as ever more monsters are summoned into the arena with players. Players must then use their combat abilities, magical powers, or both, to not only destroy monsters, but also distract and slow their progress.

Grim Peak is won if players defeat all monsters while allowing themselves to be defeated in combat only a very limited number of times.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement

name: Uncaged: World Fighters
description:
Uncaged: World Fighters is a 2 player fighting card game designed to simulate the action of a mixed martial arts contest!

Players will select a fighter from our diverse, international roster of martial artists, each representing a unique fighting style. They can then use the decks out of the box or create their own; filled with punch, kick, takedown and submission cards all designed to reduce their opponent's HP to 0 and finish the fight!

Using their individual decks, players will string together huge combinations to either inflict massive damage or lay traps for their opponent. The winner is the last person standing, and every style has a chance to score a knockout.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: MICROStars SuperClub Football
description:
An Action Challenge soccer game using standard rules of soccer and dexterity for ball movement.

MICROStars SuperClub Football uses real soccer hero figures in their real kits to compete against each other in full-match soccer. You help your footballers to dribble, pass, shoot, and save in this action packed, miniatures soccer game.

Additionally you can collect MicroStars from your favorite teams with fillers to world class players like Messi, Henry, Rooney, Cannavaro, Nemyer, Ozel, Ronaldo, Beckham and more.

Play occurs on a tabletop felt pitch and movement is controlled by holding your player figure by the head and using one of four techniques to hit and move the ball. Additional player movment of teammates is controlled by measuring sticks to move your players on the pitch. The standard game is played over two 10-minute timed periods with a 3-minute half-time break. Tied games at the end of the match can be decided by a Golden Goal or additional play time as agreed on by the players.

There are rules for fouls, free kicks, penalties, goalkeeper play, offsides, corners, throw-in's, kick-offs, and more.

Contents:
- 2 SuperClub Pitch (felt 35x56")
- 2 Goals
- 3 Balls
- 1 Rulebook
- 2 Goalkeeper rods
- 2 Measuring Sticks (long and small)
- 22 assorted MicroStars from top clubs in the world including 2 goalkeepers
categories: Action / Dexterity, Collectible Components, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Area Movement, Simulation

name: Stranded
description:
Tragedy strikes as your spaceship descends through the planet's atmosphere and crashes on its surface...You have become stranded.

A decision must be made: build a self-sustaining colony or find a way to get a strange alien ship working again.

In Stranded, you score victory points by constructing colony buildings and by investigating the alien ship. But, in addition to competing for access to best building and newly discovered technologies, you must negotiate how you will work together with other players to complete the colony or escape via the alien ship.

Each turn players take a number of actions with their explorers cubes depending on the cards they play. These actions can include: Claiming a part of the colony, which requires a set number of explorers, or claiming an alien technology for which you use your explorer to 'outbid' other players. Colony buildings and ship technologies when claimed are added to your hand of cards, thus increasing your ability to take additional actions in future turns.

Colony building and actions that repair the alien ship can be done collaboratively--and players can negotiate the completion of a specific building or the repair of a part of the ship to their advantage.

The game ends when either the colony is completed or the ship is fully repaired. Since players are awarded extra points for correctly forecasting which outcome ends the game, ad hoc alliances are formed as players seek to steer the game to their chosen conclusion.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Governor Booster
description:
This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add The Governor and Gloria to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Black Order
description: Vs System 2PCG: Black Order, the final installment in the three-part Vs. System 2PCG Infinity War arc, is a boost for the forces of evil. Infamous villains Thanos, Nebula, Mistress Death and others have arrived to wage war on the universe. Is your deck strong enough to stop them? Don't let Thanos gain control of the Infinity Gauntlet…unless of course you are Thanos!
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management

name: History Talk
description:
Is there any sense in history? Why did the Roman Empire decline? Who killed JFK? History Talk's 99 thought-provoking cards are raising the big questions of history. You can reflect them alone or together with friends.

Each player in turn picks a card, reads the question or thesis aloud and tries to give a well-founded opinion which is then discussed in the group. Winner is whoever makes the most convincing case. The game's aim is, however, for every participant to gain new insights into the fascinating subject of history.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: NewSpeak: Rated
description:
Navigate the precarious world of social ratings in this modular expansion for NewSpeak, bringing Dissident Player ratings and Location ratings to the game to add another element to the code-breaking challenge. Play as two all-new Dissident characters, and don’t forget - keep your rating high!

In Rated, each dissident player is assigned a social rating wheel as well as their targeting dial, showing their social rating to moderators at all times. Each location is also randomly assigned a social rating token.

If a dissident is caught by a moderator, their social rating is decreased by one to a minimum of one. Dissidents may not target a location that has a higher social rating than they currently have. The only way to get around this is to avoid capture, or focus on a diminishing number of locations that have been unfiltered by the dissidents - which have a rating of 1 by default.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Enclosure, Pattern Recognition, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

name: NewSpeak: Sabotage
description:
Expand your Dissident team to incorporate up to 8 players in each game of Newspeak. While your Dissident team may be larger, there may be traitors amongst you - seeking to secretly communicate with the Moderators to undermine your revolutionary efforts.

Sabotage includes materials to extend your games of NewSpeak to 8 players from up to 6 in the core set, with an additional set of 'loyalty' cards for up to 6 dissident players, allowing for an extra layer of subterfuge, assigning up to 2 dissident players a secret identity as a moderator mole. While traitors can be outed by majority vote of the remaining dissident players, an incorrect accusation will cost them dearly.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Political, Real-time, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Enclosure, Simultaneous Action Selection, Traitor Game
publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Mining Lift
description:
A limited-edition product of the DarkStone Forge, this set includes a resin cast mining lift for inclusion with the Shadows of Brimstone Mine map. Comes with two brand-new missions utilizing the lift, as well as special rules for playing with a multi-level map that allows for easier splitting up of the posse as the heroes try their best to cover as much ground as they can.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Dimes
description:
Dimes is a party game that tests your ability to read the minds of your friends.

Using a Dimes card you'll present a friend with an either/or question. All the remaining players will try to guess which item that player prefers. Players are rewarded for successfully reading other players' minds.

The game is easily adapted as a drinking game and is ideal for party/social settings

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Voting

name: Live Free or Die: Three Battles for America
description:
Following the successful deployment of missiles on Cuba in 1962, the Communists gained much ground in Latin America. Western Europe became less convinced of American commitment to defend the continent. This led to the NATO alliance being dissolved and replaced by a neutral bloc.

America was now alone!

Live Free or Die is an alternate history simulation of battles associated with a Communist invasion of continental USA. Live Free or Die is a game set consisting of three independent games:


Asian Invasion captures the Peoples' Asian Alliance landings in California;
Remember the Alamo covers the Organization of Central American States drive into Texas; and
Southern Discomfort focuses on a Warsaw Pact invasion of Florida, Georgia.


The Basic Game focuses on ground combat, providing a quick, entertaining game. The Advanced Game introduces air and naval units as well as additional specialized units like cruise missiles, laser defenses and political troops. And beware, there are rules for nuclear, biological and chemical warfare!

The three 11"x17"map boards represent battle grounds in California, Florida, Georgia and Texas. The 480 1/2" counters (die-cut and back-printed) show brigade and divisional level forces of the US, the Warsaw Pact (Soviet Union, East Germany, Poland and Czeckoslovakia), the People's Asian Alliance (China, North Korea and Viet Nam), and the Organization of Central American States (Cuba, Mexico and Nicaragua).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Armata Strigoi: Limited Deck Expansion + Handmade Painted Set
description: 10 exclusive cards to play the game Armata Strigoi with special new powers, plus the 7 figures handpainted in a beautiful and numbered wooden box! Only 250 sets available!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Keil
description:
IntroductionKeil is a Go-like territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty hexagonal grid of triangles. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.

Apart from the board, Keil differs from Go in the idea of linking points, which preserves crosscuts and ko by reducing the natural connectivity of the triangular grid.



DefinitionsTwo adjacent points, and any stones on them, are linked if there is another point adjacent to both that is the same type as at least one of them. Two points are the same type if they are either both empty or both occupied by stones of the same color.

A group is a stone along with all other like-colored stones one could reach from it through a series of steps between linked stones of that color.

A liberty of a group is an empty point linked to at least one stone in that group.

Similarly, a territory is an empty point along with all other empty points one could reach from it through a series of steps between linked empty points. You own a territory if all stones linked to points in that territory are of your color.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, you must pass or place a stone of your color on an empty point. After a placement, remove all enemy stones in groups without liberties. After all removals, the stone you placed must be part of a group with at least one liberty, and the current board position must be different from the board positions at the end of all your previous turns. Otherwise, your placement is illegal.

The game ends when both players pass in succession. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. A player's score is the number of stones of their color on the board, plus the number of points in their territories, plus komi in the case of White. The button is used to avoid ties.



Komi and buttonKomi is the whole number of points which is added to White's score at the end of the game as compensation for going second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value for all games.

The button is a special token which is placed next to the board at the start of the game. On your turn, if neither player has taken the button yet, you may not pass, but you may take the button instead of making a board play. At the end of the game, a half point is added to the score of the player who has taken the button. When checking for repetitions, two identical board positions are still considered different if the button had already been taken in one of them but not in the other.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Enclosure, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Deadzone: Escalation
description:
Deadzone Containment Protocols: Escalation is the latest update to the hugely popular sci-fi skirmish game, Deadzone.
In this new supplement, players will find rules for adding ruthless mercenaries to their games and an entirely new mercenary-based faction. Rebs get a boost to their cause with new fighters, while the insidious Veermyn gains the support of the technologically advanced Volt Chasers. Plus, all existing faction lists are reprinted with the latest points and errata. What’s more, you’ll also find new multi-mat based scenarios and rules for adding interactive scenery to your battles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Squad Hammer: Dirt simple war gaming for many settings...or all of them
description:
What does the rubble of Stalingrad, Vietnam, the far future and sword wielding dinosaur hunters have in common?

You can play all of them (and more) using Squad-Hammer!

Aimed at friendly, casual games by people who are interested in easy rules, Squad-Hammer can be summarized on a single sheet of paper.

Inspired by systems such as "One hour wargames", "I ain't been shot mum" and "FUBAR", the rules use a simple universal combat system, relying on player judgement to set target numbers.

(Though don't fear, we do provide "canned" target numbers if you prefer to have the book do it)

The book includes a quick mission system (with victory points) and campaign rules, options for off-table support and a big section on creating your own units, from T-72 tanks to fire-breathing aliens.

We round things out with a points system to calculate the rough effectiveness of troops and of course the mandatory NWG optional rules chapter, letting you customize the game to your liking.


* * * *


Squad-Hammer is a call-back to an older, more casual style of gaming: A game where having a fun battle takes precedent over aggressive competitiveness and where the rules support your model collection.

Standard units can be any size you like. The default is squads of 5-8 infantry models or single vehicles/monsters but nothing would stop you from playing with individual models (Man to Man) or using troop stands with multiple figures per stand).

Note that unlike some of our games, Squad-Hammer does NOT include explicit solo mechanics though due to the simplicity of the mechanics, it is very easy to play with one player controlling both sides.

—description from publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: The Perfect Moment: An Escape Plan Gone Wrong
description:
The Perfect Moment: An Escape Plan Gone Wrong (2010) is a six-card expansion for The Perfect Moment that replaces one of the three base sets for a different playing experience.

Reimplemented in The Second Most Perfect Moment as a new full base game, together with other two expansions and a solo mode.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Dimentals: Unseen Warfare
description:
On the edge of a distant galaxy, life has been thriving in the solar system of the ancient star, Zohneth. After discovering their Sun was beginning the violent process of dying and their planets were in imminent danger, all alien races came together and invented the Kyur: a gravitational machine capable of stabilizing the vehement star. No one could have foreseen what happened next. The Kyur created an interdimensional bridge. Dimentals, invisible beings from a parallel universe, were released and are infecting the hearts and minds of these once peaceful species. War has begun.

Dimentals: Unseen Warfare is an expandable card game for 2 players. Players will select and collect resources and play cards onto the battlefield to protect their homeworld and attack their enemies. The game is played by turns and is expandable to up to 6 players.

Dimentals: Unseen Warfare features a unique Spectrum Shifted Blacklight Technology. The game includes exclusive card art and patented ink which glow in UV light. The ink is invisible in normal light so special hidden abilities and pictures come to life once the blacklight is activated. Special Dimentals cards are completely hidden from the players until revealed as well.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Varia
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.





Varia is a new style of expandable card game that pits you against your opponent in combat.

When playing Varia, there are no minions to protect you or creature summons to hide behind. Instead, you raise the shield. You cast the spell. You swing for the win with your weapon of choice. If you want to win a game of Varia, you are going to have to do the fighting yourself.

Each Varia class deck allows players to feel what it's like to actually be that class. While each deck offers its own unique take on combat, Varia is a highly-configurable system that also enables you to build a custom class that best represents you. ​With Varia, the only limit is your imagination.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Track Movement

name: Natural Chaos
description:
The world of nature is in chaos and it up to you to bring back order!

Natural Chaos is an abstract strategy game where each player controls two natural elements. The goal is to get four of your elements in a row on one of the four playing boards. But watch out the elements have a four way rock paper scissors type ranking system that allows you to keep your opponent on their toes!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Square Grid

name: SATANIMALS: Littergy
description:
The pyramids of hell have risen... and along with them, the dead!

Three cats (Fluffy, Fuzzy & Foul) join SATANIMALS with the abilities to perform mass sacrifices and raise the dead! Play cats into your petting zoo to force other players to sacrifice their cards. Raise the dead by stealing cards from the sacrificial pit!

Littergy also includes new main attractions to spice up your ULTIMATE Demonic Petting Zoo strategy! Instead of just Satanimals scoring you secret bonus points, it could be Zoo Keepers, Visitors or even the Eternal Flame!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Religious
mechanics: Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: INKAS: The Legend
description:
Based on the legendary history and mythology of the Inka Empire, Inkas: The Legend is a strategy board game for 2 to 4 players that takes you back to a mystical time of spirits, monsters, and dragon-like Amarus, where you must battle gods and enemy nations for the chance to become the founder of a NEW empire.

The game represents the legend of the Ayar siblings and the creation of the Inka Empire. In this legend, the almighty god creator Wiraqucha gives his children, Ayar Manqu, Mama Uqllu and their siblings, a magical gold staff named the Tupayauri. With it, they travel across the future Tawantinsuyu, searching for the perfect land to found the Inka Empire.

In this game, players first race for the Tupayauri at the center of the board, then they try to steal it from each other. The Tupayauri is needed to be able to conquer a wamani (province). Once a wamani is conquered, its hidden "Pacha Card" is revealed. Within one of the 12 peripheral wamanis, the Qusqu (Cusco) card is hidden. Whoever finds Qusqu or defeats all enemy warriors, wins the game.

There are 5 different ayllus (clans), with 5 type of warriors each: A Guide, a Scout, a Fighter, a Hunter, and a Shaman, each with special abilities needed in the game.

The game also showcases llama pieces, which serve to energize attacks and as offerings to the god Wiraqucha.

INKAS: The Legend currently has rulebooks in English and Spanish, and a Quechua version is forthcoming. Quechua is the main language of the Inka Empire, still spoken by 10 million people in South América.

—description from the designer
categories: Educational, Exploration, Miniatures, Mythology, Prehistoric, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Action Retrieval, Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Kill Steal, King of the Hill, Player Elimination, Race, Resource to Move, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Sudden Death Ending, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Zone of Control

name: Operation Fustian: The Battle for Primosole Bridge July 12-15, 1943
description:
The Allied invasion of Sicily in July 1943 essentially involved a race as to which force, British or American, would first take the port of Messina. The British forces landing near Syracuse had the shortest path, but that way was beset with numerous rivers that ran west to east and were easily defended. British airborne troops were given the task of taking the most heavily defended river position, the Primosole Bridge over the Simeto River in an attack dubbed "Operation Fustian". Unbeknownst to the Allies the Germans also rushed airborne troops to help secure the position along with the Italian garrison. One of most costly and violent battles of the Sicilian campaign would be fought here. Can you do as well or better than your opponent?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Age of Valor: Thunder in the East, Russia at War 1877 and 1904
description:
Thunder in the East, Russia at War 1877 and 1904 is an independent Age of Valor (AOV) expansion chapter or mini-module for Age of Eagles II, also known as Napoleonic Fire & Fury. It covers both the Russo-Turkish War of 1877 and the later Russo-Japanese War. As such AOE II is needed to properly play this game. In most cases all rule changes have been imbedded in the Data Charts as well as the charts and tables on the Quick Reference Sheet. All players need to do is use these new specifications or DRMs with the original rules, then play as normal. Any changes unique to the Russo-Turkish and Russo-Japanese Wars, the subject of this expansion set, are included for both the conflict overall, and the included battles of Plevna, Aladja Dagh for the Russo-Turkish War, Telissu and Liao Yang scenarios for the Russo-Japanese War.

The AOV product line is sold direct thru digital distribution, though hardcopy versions are available from certain retailers. It is 44 pages long. Kindle formatted products are sold exclusively thru Amazon, while digital downloads exportable to PDF format may be purchased via Google Play.

Online, public research portal for this game and its historical period (to include flags for miniatures, official histories, Public Domain military maps, images and publications - all copyright friendly and FREE to download) at http://tinyurl.com/AOV-Research-Portal-1877-RTW for the Russo-Turkish War and http://tinyurl.com/AOV-Research-Portal-1904-RJW for the Russo-Japanese War.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Turn Order: Random

name: Battalions of the Empire
description:
Free print & play game

In this highly tactical game, situated in the Napoleonic era, you must crush the opponent army by making them rout.
Choose how to compose your brigades (infantry, cavalry & artillery) and set-up them up on a modular board. Choose which units to activate and move them in position to attack the enemy. Optimize the use of terrain features and lure the enemy in a deadly ambush.

As there are no dice or cards in the game, luck doesn't play any role. This game is only for the most brilliant generals. Without a strong battleplan, you have no chance to win.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Movement Points, Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Level 7 [Omega Protocol]: The Judas Protocol Mission Guide
description:
Four missions for Level 7 [Omega Protocol]

Before the events of novel The Judas Protocol, Disco Team had to deal with a desperate situation in the Subterra Foxtrot facility. With the Mission Guide, you play through four different missions as Disco Team to try and put a lid on things before they spiral out of control. Each mission features both an easy and a hard mode — for when you really want to challenge Disco Team — and should be played with the components in the Level 7 [Omega Protocol] core game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Master of Wills: Core Faction Expansion Set
description:
This expansion set brings new Action, Epic and Legendary cards to each of the 4 core Factions. Expanding the Factions with new options provides exciting and unique power combinations that are not available in the base game. How will you utilize these different characters and abilities to crush your opponents?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Flames of War: British Starter Force – Armoured Battlegroup
description:
From across the world, you have come to fight for King and Country.

Your bravery will echo across the ages as did that of your ancestors at Agincourt and Waterloo.
The weapons may be different but, by jove, the determination and bravery of this generation will prove the equal of any other in the history of the Empire.

Rule Britannia!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Blood Red Skies: British Ace Pilot – 'Bob' Braham
description:
John Randall Daniel "Bob" Braham was a fighter ace and night fighter. He gained his first victory during the Battle of Britain and continued to act against The Blitz.

Promoted to squad leader by June 1942 and served throughout until Jun 1944 when he was shot down and captured.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: SPQR: A Clash of Heroes Starter Set
description:
With a lightning-fast and easy to play system, SPQR allows you to build a complete warband capable of scouting out enemy armies, clashing across borders, and conducting raids on farms and villages.

Units in SPQR are divided into two broad categories; heroes and minions. Units of 5 or more Minions form the bulk of your warband, faceless henchmen who have been sworn into your service.

Heroes are powerful individuals that will grow in stature from battle to battle, gaining new talents and becoming true legends!

Each warband features specialised scenarios to reflect its own tactics and methods of waging war.

SPQR comes a complete campaign system along with a detailed progression system for your heroes, allowing you to customise how they fight on the ancient battlefield!

This is what sets SQPR apart – forge your own destiny and join the battle!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Blood Red Skies: German Ace Pilot – Walter Borchers
description:
Walter Borchers flew Me110s with ZG 76 in the early phases of the war, scoring 10 victories in the aerial battles over France and Britain in 1940.

Borchers’ unit was made into a night-fighter squadron incorporating Ju 88C heavy fighters for the Defence of the Reich late in 1941, although Borchers didn’t score his first nocturnal victory until March 1943.
His tally rose swiftly after that, including several American four-engine heavy bombers.
Borchers’ victories rose to 46 in total by March 1945.
Shortly after claiming his 46th enemy near Altenburg he was shot down and killed by an RAF Mosquito night-fighter.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Simulation

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Explosive Barrels
description:
This set includes 4 Explosive Barrel terrain pieces, as well as a brand new Mission (Blast 'em Back to Hell) to use them in your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

Blast 'em Back to Hell - An overwhelming horde of creatures is approaching fast from all directions! If not stopped, they will overrun the entire area in a matter of hours, destroying everything in their path. Gathering up as many explosives as you can, you're only gonna get one shot at this. Collapsing one or two paths won't do, you need to set traps and lure them in to blow as many of these creatures back to hell as you can... and hope that you have enough firepower to clean up whatever is left.

With a new mechanic for generating a Random Fixed Map and an 'insane' difficulty mode using Epic Threats for 5-6 Heroes playing the Mission, this Explosive Barrels set lets you pile more Enemies from your collection on the board at once than ever before! It will assuredly put more bang into your Adventures!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon Dice: Dwarves
description:
Return to the ancient days of creation in Esfah… and find that legends live!

The Dwarves have been on Esfah since the earliest ages. The power of Earth and Fire creates a hardy race born for the highlands. The Dwarves are tough and durable, and are fierce fighters on any terrain. Few races dare to challenge them in the mountains. Now available in a kicker pack, the Dwarves
also bring their monstrous allies, including the legendary beast Behemoth, making its first appearance in Dragon Dice™

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of red and gold Dwarf, plus rules summary.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: The Beast
description:
In this competitive deck building game, you are all villagers who wish to save your town from a beast that has been ravaging and destroying your homes. Build up your hand, for when the beast comes, you'll have to be ready. You attack in turns, so be careful how much you attack, because you don't want anyone else to slay the beast.

And remember: you need defense, otherwise you will get slain yourself.

Also, the game varies with different amounts of players, ensuring an exciting and unique gameplay every single game! With different amounts of players, your strategy has to change, which always keeps you on your toes!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Mars: Code Aurora
description:
Sci-fi skirmish miniatures game. Mars : Code Aurora has no dedicated models range, you can use any brand you like.

Fast-paced game, with 7-12 models in average on 90x90cm board.
Choose which faction you want to fight for among 8.
Objectives based scenarios.
Missions generator.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random

name: Medium: Destiny Revealed Promo
description:
Medium A Mind-Reading Party Game
DESTINY REVEALED PROMO
If a team senses that their minds are in tune, they can tempt fate by playing the new ESP card Destiny Revealed. At the start of a team's turn, instead of playing word cards from their hands, one partner may play the top two cards of the deck and use those two cards as their starting words for the turn. If they can't match on the first try, they proceed with their turn as normal, using the words they just said. But, if they are so in tune that they Mind Meld on the first attempt, they'll get two First Attempt Mind Meld tokens instead of one!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Catfight
description:
Catfight is a very fast two-player card game in which players compete to have the strongest gang by trying to collect as many different cats as possible. Each turn, they draw two cards then either discard one card or lay down a set of cards. To lay down a set, you need at least two cards if the same gang member hasn't been played or more cards than are already on the table if it has been played. Any cards of the same gang member on the table are discarded. The round ends when one player has five different gang members, OR the draw pile is exhausted. When the draw pile is exhausted, players score for the different gang members they have laid down in front of them.

Just like in a fighting game, Catfight is played as "first-to-2", or I think it's also known as best of three.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Cronocartes: Història de Catalunya
description:
Cronocartes: Història de Catalunya ("Cronocards: History of Catalonia") is a card game with Catalan history theme. Each card has an image and a text that represents a key point or achievement in the Catalan history, art, gastronomy or culture.
The front and back of each card are identical except for the fact that the back of the card include also the year in which the event happened.

Each player is given 7 cards face up so that the year is not visible to them.
One card is then placed face down (so that the year is visible) on the table.
Each player, in his/her turn, will place one of his/her cards face up before, after or between the cards already in the table and then turn it faced down so that the year is visible. If the card has been correctly placed chronologically, the card remains on the table, otherwise, the card is discarded and the player takes another card. The first player to finish the cards wins.

For an additional degree of difficulty, instead of discarded an incorrectly placed cards, leave it on the table face down (with the year visible) in its correct position.

This is a standalone game, but is fully compatible with similar games such as Timeline series and can be combined with them.

[Catalan translation]

Cronocartes: Història de Catalunya és un joc de cartes de temàtica històrica.
Cada carta té una imatge i un text que representa un esdeveniment o fita a la història, art, gastronomia o cultura catalanes. L'anvers i el revers de cada carta són idèntics excepte pel fet que a l'anvers figura l'any en què va ocórrer l'esdeveniment que fa referència la carta.

Es reparteixen 7 cartes a cada jugador sense que se'n vegi l'any. Després es posa una carta a la taula mostrant el revers (cara amb l'any de l'esdeveniment).
Cada jugador, al seu torn, posa una de les seves cartes abans, després o entre dues de les cartes que hi ha a la taula sense que se'n vegi l'any. Seguidament gira la carta per mostrar l'any. Si la carta s'ha col·locat correctament
(cronològicament), la carta roman a la taula. Si no es descarta la carta i el jugador agafa una altra carta nova. El primer jugador a acabar les seves cartes guanya.

Si voleu fer el joc una mica més difícil, en comptes de descartar la carta mal col·locada, deixeu-la al seu lloc cronològicament correcte.

Cronocartes és un joc complet, però completament compatible amb jocs similars com els jocs de la sèrie Timeline, pel que es pot combinar amb ells.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Print & Play, Trivia
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs: Board Pack
description:
Explore haunted ruins, mind-bending labyrinths, profane temples, and infernal forges as you quest for glory – but beware, for death is always waiting in the shadows to claim the unworthy…

Test your tactical skills and try new, thematically rich battlefields in Warcry with this board set! Designed to work with Warcry: Catacombs, each of these boards offers a thrilling new set of opportunities. Brave the twisting Lair of the Sphiranx, fight in the tight confines of the Cinder Warrens, dominate the centre ground in Halls of Velorum, and weave between the columns of the Temple of Nagendra – combined with the Warcry: Catacombs set, this promises hours of fun and variety.

This set contains two double-sided 760mm x 568mm game boards, plus a booklet with tips and rules for adding them to your games. Please note – you'll need a copy of Warcry: Catacombs to make use of this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: 1823 France
description: 1823 France is an 18xx game set in France. It has elements of 1817 (loans, mergers, acquisition, liquidation, friendly sales, 1D market), 18MM (randomly distributed revenue locations on the map) and unique things such as plain tiles remaining yellow, but paying to add "spokes".
mechanics: Connections, Market, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Pixel Farm
description:
Pixel Farm is a deck building game mixed with puzzles and pixel art inspired graphics for 1 to 4 players and 30 to 45 minutes per game.

On each turn, you will draw cards to create a new farm. Each farm will produce tomato, lettuce and corn, and you will use these vegetables to buy new cards or get points.

Also, you can use special actions to produce extra vegetables, buy more than one card o draw extra cards on the next turn.

But beware of the plagues! They will reduce your harvests production and your total points by the end of the game.

The goal is to be the most prestigious farmer. You will reach this goal with the points you get through the game and avoiding plagues.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pattern Building

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Destruction Battletome – Gloomspite Gitz
description:
The Bad Moon is rising on the Mortal Realms – and the grots are marching to war. This battletome allows you to field an army of Gloomspite Gitz – a coalition of Moonclan Grots, Spiderfang Grots, troggoths and gargants united by a love hallucinogenic fungus and heinous violence. Inside this book, you'll find…


An in-depth look at the origins, lore and great battles of the Gloomspite Gitz
A showcase of stunningly painted miniatures – plus tips for painting your own
Powerful new faction abilities that let you represent the madcap tactics of the Gloomspite Gitz on your tabletop
Warscrolls and points profiles that let you build any kind of army you want – teeming hordes of grots, scuttling Spider Riders, brutish tribes of troggoths or a mix of the three
And more!


If you're looking to spread destruction (or just take on the tabletop with hordes of squigs), Battletome: Gloomspite Gitz is your essential guide.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Psychopath
description:
PSYCHOPATH

A Killer Card Game for 1 to 4 Campers and One Psycho!

Psychopath is a ‘One vs. Many’ card game where one player acts as the Psychopath - a deranged killer attempting to hunt down and kill the Camper players using a variety of Actions and Items at his disposal. The Camper players try to survive the Psychopath’s attacks and hope for rescue using the Actions, Items, Allies and Skills available in their deck of cards. If the Psychopath manages to kill all the Campers, he wins the game! However, if at least one Camper survives or manages to become rescued, the Campers win! Psychopath can also be played as a Campaign, with both sides scoring points over a predetermined number of games.

Psychopath is presented with a campy B-Horror Movie flavor splashed with inane commentary and featuring over-the-top, and sometimes gruesome, imagery!

Game Play:

Psychopath is played in rounds. At the start of each round all players secretly select a card from their hand to be played as their starting card and place it face down on the table. When all players have done so, cards are then revealed to show the location each players is at: the Lake, the Cabin, the Shed, or the Woods. Campers unlucky enough to be at the same location as the Psychopath enter into a Struggle with him.

During this Struggle, the Psychopath and Campers take turns playing cards from their hand and using Keep in Play cards they have on the table they have previously put into play. Campers can play Allies, Skills, Items and Actions to bolster their defense, attempt to Escape or become Rescued, and to thwart the attacks made by the Psychopath. The Psychopath will play Items and Actions to cause Wounds to the Campers in order to weaken or kill them. After players in a Struggle have played all the cards they wish, Struggles are resolved with Campers losing cards from their hand of cards equal to the number of Wounds they suffered. If a Camper suffers more Wounds than the cards in their hand, they are killed! The Psychopath suffers his Wounds by discarding that number of cards from the top of his deck of cards. If, at the start of the next draw Phase, the Psychopath has no cards remaining in his deck, the surviving Campers escape and the game is over!

After all Struggles are resolved, if there are two or more Campers at the same location and they are not at the Psychopath's location, they may Collaborate by giving each other Items and Allies, and by strategizing (Campers cannot otherwise discuss strategy during the game). A new round then begins with the Campers each drawing a card from the Camper deck of cards and the Psychopath drawing cards from his deck to fill his hand of cards to its starting limit. Hand management is an important aspect of Psychopath; deciding when to play cards and when to save them in your hand for later use can mean the difference between Survival and Death!

Game Contents:

126 Thick Game Cards (60 for the Psychopath, 66 for the Campers)
1 Rulebook
1 Nice Shiny Box including a 4-Way Plastic Divider for the cards with Extra Space to hold Upcoming Expansions!

—description from the designers
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Minimize
description:
A card game where players try to minimize the range of six cards in their hand by swapping from the draw piles in order to challenge that they have the lowest score and go through to the next round. Your score is your highest card minus your lowest card minus any pro points and plus any bonus rule points.

The MINIMIZE deck consists of 78 cards, with 13 different numbers, 13 different colours and 13 different shapes. The deck has been designed so that it avoids duplication of each number/colour/shape combination.

On your turn you draw from one of the three draw piles and then discard a card. Some cards trigger actions such as being forced to swap more cards. Duplicate numbers deduct bonus points from your score (a good thing) but duplicate colours and shapes add points (a bad thing). When you think you have the lowest score you can challenge (but each player can only challenge once per round), and the player with the lowest score goes through to the next round, with play continuing. The last player left each round is eliminated and the player with the lowest score in the final round is the winner.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Deck Construction, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Tomten
description:
Become one of the friendly, hard-working Scandinavian tomten, completing tasks in preparation for St. Knut's day. Players will compete to collect task cards for a mix of instant rewards and engine building by working and resting their way through the holiday season.

A game takes place on a calendar-themed board beginning on December 1st, culminating on St. Knut's Day on January 13th. Tasks performed will cause resources to be spent, but resting (and some task rewards) can bring those resources back into the ready position. As players collect task cards, they'll build an engine by adding each card's rewards to their train of completion rewards when working, playing, or partying on holidays.

At the end of the game, players will all join together for St. Knut's Day and score final victory bonuses based on the artwork shown on cards they've collected throughout the game. Each card features a unique illustration by Jenny Nyström, a Swedish painter and illustrator famous for her works featuring the jultomte performing tasks throughout the Christmas season.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Tags, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Raiding Gear Game Supplement
description:
15 new Norse Lands Gear Cards.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Flames of Ragnarok Game Supplement
description:
This pack of 15 new cards expands the decks of the Norse Lands. Includes Gear, Artifacts, Encounters, and an Adventure Card to set your adventures amidst the apocalyptic times of Ragnarok!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Aventuria: Alternate Schatzjägerin Promopack
description: This promo pack contains the hero card, skill card, life point card, action card "Südweiser (Thorwalisch)" and rules card for the alternate hero Pelara Kroftoff, Festumian Explorer.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Classic F1
description:
Classic F1 is a lap by lap reproduction of Formula One auto racing. The game comes with all 33 Formula One champs, as well as all the active drivers from 2019. Every year, car, and constructor for each driver is represented individually and normalized across the history of the sport so you can match, for example, Fangio, Stewart, Senna or Hamilton head-to-head in any car they drove during their careers.
Additional drivers are also available by decade, including a pre-1950s set including such greats as Nuvolari, Rosemeyer and Wimille.

Each driver card has ratings for speed & tactics, qualifying, fastest laps, passing, defending, ability in the rain, accidents and potential mechanical issues, to name but a few. Speedy drivers who excel on fast tracks will do the same here, while tacticians will show their worth on hard to pass tracks like Monaco. Drivers prone to accidents will have more issues than others and cars prone to breaking down with mechanical issues will have difficulty finishing a race.

Each of the tracks from 2019 are represented their own chart which will determine the events during the race based on a die roll. These results may require further checks to the track chart or examining one or more driver ratings for the track action over one or more laps. Tracks that favor a fast driver will do so, while tracks that test a car’s endurance will have more mechanical checks. Each track has its own historic weather check. The ability to pass on the various tracks is represented as well; tracks like Hungaroring will have few passing opportunities, while Monza will have more chances. Some tracks also give the driver the option for a one or two stop pit strategy. No two tracks are alike and the Track Set 2 provides an additional 20 classic circuits including Bremgarten, Detroit, Mt. Tremblant and the daunting Nurburgring "Nordschleife."

Every aspect of F1 is here - driver, car & circuit variety, qualifying, the chaos of lap one, accidents, safety cars and breakdowns. Qualifying takes about a half hour to run; a race can be run in roughly an hour and a half. There is some basic math involved, as you do not move on a track but rather, calculate the number of “spaces moved” for each car/driver, based on the results of a die roll, cross-referenced against the specific race track used as well as the driver/car ratings. The positions after each turn represent a certain amount of time behind the leader and after a pre-determined number of laps have been completed the driver in the lead wins the race. The broad range of random and not-so-random results make no two races the same.

There has never been as detailed a representation of the sport’s history as this game offers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Crisis on Cardea
description:
Crisis on Cardea is a fast-paced sequence-matching, deck-building card game for 2 to 5 players. Taking place on planet Cardea, home to humanity's latest colony, you and up to four other players will compete by building teams of Cardeans to study, investigate, test, and eradicate the planet’s native pathogens.

Players will build teams of specialized Cardeans to resolve Outbreaks across the planet.

The game consists of 2 decks of cards; a Risk Deck and Safe Deck.
Deal each player 6 cards (from the Safe Deck), and place the two decks in the middle of the table. Place out as many cards as there are players in front of you from the Risk Deck and reveal. - These are your Outbreaks.

During the game, the players will form a Personal Deck, by drawing more cards, move Cardeans to their Team, play Action Cards, and Resolve Outbreaks.

The first player to collect 10 Outbreak points, wins the game. Players get an equal amount of turns, so when a player reaches ten Outbreak points, the round continues until each player has completed their turn.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Kingdoms of Akandia: The Seven Realms
description:
Welcome to Kingdoms of Akandia "The Seven Realms".

The first volume in an extensive, immersive and FULL-cooperative open world. You and your friends are fighting together against the spreading darkness. You choose your group of heroes and have your own adventure over 3 chapters and 35-65 hours of gameplay with 1-4 players.

Some mechanics:


open world "The Seven Realms"
supply chains / resource management
full co-op group abilities
use mounts
mix of card and dice-fighting system
upgrade tower defense
destiny cards which changes every gameplay
and much more
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Novel-based
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Shimiagaran
description:
Shimiagaran are a forgotten breed of ancient scientists, wiped out from history by the cruel alchemists, out of jealousy, despite, and greed. The beliefs of mainstream alchemy could not bear the thought of another group beating them to the elixir of life. Hence, they got the kingdoms to support them, announced the elixir of life impossible, and denied the existence of Shimiagaran.

"Shimiagaran" is a play on the word "alchemists" in Farsi, something like "Alchemystery" if you will.

Shimiagaran is a competitive push your luck and resource management family game. In this game, players have to gather the necessary ingredients for concocting Light and Dark Potions. Ingredients are distributed in two separate sacks at the start of the game: the White Sack, and the Black Sack, which include a different number of Tarantulas. The White Sack has a drafting mechanism, and the Black Sack has a push your luck mechanism. After gathering the required ingredients and making the necessary potions, players can mix their potions to make legendary Elixirs.

Each player has 3 containers: a bottle to keep liquid ingredients in (white and red), a mortar to keep the plant ingredients in (green and pink), and a bag to keep mineral ingredients in (blue and yellow). Each container can hold a total of 5 cubes, and tarantulas can be kept in any container. At the beginning of the game, the white sack has many ingredients and few tarantulas, and the black has few ingredients and many tarantulas. As the game goes on and players take action, all the cubes, including tarantulas circulate between the two sacks.

On a player's turn they can perform one of the following actions:
Take cubes from one of the sacks or Make a potions or elixirs for Victory Points.

Players keep their cards beside their player board, and the amount of VP any player has is public. When one player surpasses the 30VP, the game ends after 2 more rounds.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Race, Set Collection, Take That

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Karstark Spearmen
description: This pack contains 12 figures for the game A Song of Ice and Fire.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: BattleTech: Savannah/Grasslands Battlemat
description:
Each map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes a never-before published map for one of the following terrain:


Desert
Lunar
Alpine
Savannah


The secondary side also includes brand-new maps—designed to be used together—as featured in the soon-to-release BattleTech Map Pack: Grasslands. Each of the four BattleMast displays a unique Grasslands map on the back.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: BattleTech: Lunar/Grasslands Battlemat
description:
Each map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes a never-before published map for one of the following terrain:


Desert
Lunar
Alpine
Savannah


The secondary side also includes brand-new maps—designed to be used together—as featured in the soon-to-release BattleTech Map Pack: Grasslands. Each of the four BattleMast displays a unique Grasslands map on the back.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Catan: Das Duell – Sonderkarte 2021: Weinberg
description:
Bonus Card for "Catan - das Duell"
Text on card "Auslage: An ein Hügelland. Sie starten mit 1 Wein. Beim Ereignis Ertragreiches Jahr drehen sie den Weinberg (falls möglich) 1 Stufe höher. Drehen Sie den Weinberg beim Ereignis Fahrender Händler 1 Stufe tiefer, erhalten Sie 1 beliebigen Rohstoff. Bedingung: Kloster"
mechanics: Unspecified

name: BattleTech: Pozoristu Mountains/Kozice Valley Battlemat
description:
Battles of Tukayyid Battlemat

This map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

This map details the Pozoristu Mountains (Clan Wolf) on one side and Kozice Valley (Clan Diamond Shark) on the other side.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: WarBonds: Battle For Vitoria
description:
"WarBonds: Battle For Vitoria" is a strategy war game where players deploy and mobilize a medieval fantasy army in an effort to reign supreme amidst the war torn lands of Vitoria. Players start with a unique warlord that’ll serve as the leader of their army, and the first unit deployed onto the Battle Map. Each warlord is vying for control and ideological dominance. All units, warlords included, have an ideological alignment that will be tried by the brutalities of war. Players will make nuanced decisions that will affect the leadership of their warlord, and the loyalty of their units.

One such decision involves influencing the public to incite revolt or enforce order across the land. Inciting a revolt is looked upon favorably by all chaos alignment units, but unfavorable to all law alignment units. Such a decision will cause these units to gain or lose loyalty. Units without loyalty are susceptible to leaving your army; or worse, be persuaded by the leadership of an opponent's warlord to join their army. There is no randomness; players must out-think their opponents to achieve victory.

To achieve victory, a player must satisfy any one of the below conditions:

Be the last player with a surviving warlord and war camp.
If your warlord is killed, you lose the game.
If your war camp is destroyed, you lose the game.

Be the first player to gain a level 3 war camp.
If the dragon arrives, when it reaches the End of Game event, have the largest army size (IE: victory points).


When a game is fully set up and ready to start, the gameplay runs through a cycle of game rounds until one player achieves victory. A game round consists of a series of ordered turn handling for the deployed and enabled units and war camps; followed by the handling of various ordered events. The next game round starts after all aforementioned game objects have completed their respective turns, and each event has been handled. To assist with tracking and management of a game round an Initiative Table is used to indicate which in-game object’s turn must be handled next. Players only take their turn when one of their owned and controlled in-game object is designated to take their respective turn. This cycle of starting and ending game rounds proceeds until a player achieves a victory condition, or the game reaches its final round triggering the End of Game event.

In WarBonds: Battle For Vitoria each player selects a single warlord from a pool of warlords for which to start their war campaign with. Afterwards, in the same order, all players select their starting war camp and warlord location on the battle map. Once war camp and warlord placement is complete, the game can now begin, starting with the player whose warlord has the lowest initiative score indicated on the Initiative Table. As each round progresses, players will select and deploy various units to make up their army.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Wargame
mechanics: Events, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Predictive Bid, Simulation, Square Grid, Stat Check Resolution, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Solarpunk Futures
description:
Solarpunk Futures is a 10-minute rules-light role playing game where players imagine the pathways to a desirable world from the perspective of a utopian future.

Players use a deck of cards to remember Ancestors (e.g. grower, engineer, newcomer) and work together using Tools (e.g. recycled materials, equipment library, off-grid energy) and Values (e.g. care, responsibility, usufruct) to overcome a set of real-world Challenges (e.g. borders, ableist infrastructure, climate refugee crisis). Through dialogue and collaborative worldbuilding, collective and visionary narratives emerge of a new society, along with plausible scenarios for how to get there.

The players are guided through a collaborative storytelling process, imagining the pathway to their utopian future. In a conversation that can range from solemn to comical in tone, the players decide collectively how they worked together and why it took all of them to overcome the Challenge.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: 7TV: Fantasy
description:
7TV: FANTASY is a tabletop skirmish wargame inspired by the myriad of cinematic fantasy worlds and the books and games that inspired them. Battle over the tabletop pitting sword and magic against dark lords, endless hordes and villainous sorcery!
—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Fumble!
description:
Fumble! is a fast-paced football-themed game combining cards and pong skills to make for an exciting match of skills and reflexes. Cards are dealt and Custom game ping pong balls are set on the playing surface, one less than the total number of players. An orange ball is always set on the table, and the rest are white.

Players start with 5 cards. When "HIKE!" is called, play begins. Each player passes a card to their left. Play continues until someone collects 5 cards of the same position (QB, RB, WR, CB, DL, LB). When this occurs, that player grabs the ORANGE ball in the center of the table and claims 6 points. This starts the FUMBLE! where the remaining players scramble to get one of the WHITE balls (one player is left without).

Once the balls have been claimed, players take their "kicks" by bouncing their ball off the playing surface into the cup. The white balls are worth 3 points (a field goal) and the orange ball is worth for 1 point (an extra point).

Example: In a 4 player game, Player 1 gets 5 cards of a kind first and recovers the orange ball, scoring 6 points. Players 2 and 3 each recover a white ball. Player 4 misses out on the fumble. Player 1 then "kicks" the orange ball for an extra point and players 2 & 3 get a chance to kick a field goal for 3 points.

(In a round a player can earn a max of 7 points)
The first player to get 21 points, wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Sports
mechanics: Set Collection

name: The Last Gig
description:
The Last Gig is a board game that simulates your band life on the road: unforgettable concerts and poor food, merch to sell after each Live, and records to be recorded in the studio. But mostly many, many, MANY kilometers to travel with your partners!

There is only one way to beat your opponents: get on stage!

On your turn, roll the dice, stop in the tour spaces, play in awesome venues, do live sessions to get (or lose) Tour Points, spin the Rock Wheel to or buy new Merch cards that you can sell at your next Live session.

Race around, gather as much Tour Points as possible, and be the first to finish the game with your Last Gig!
mechanics: Action/Event, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Draconis Invasion: Glory
description:
Rising up from the Draconis Invasion are new hopes of GLORY. Together we might rise triumphant! The GLORY pack is a set of 3 modular mini-expansions. GLORY increases gameplay options for both the base game and Wrath expansion.

- CHAMPION cards add asymmetric powers that can be summoned at pivotal moments in the game.
- BONUS cards create changing end-game bonuses such as "Largest Army" or "Most Terror".
- INVOCATION cards shift the entire flow so that a purchased card can be Invoked - bringing it forth into your hand at your beckon call.

These additions modify the strategy without changing the core mechanics that Draconis Invasion fans love.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Bridge Constructor: Breaking Point
description:
Engineer the best bridge you can with limited supplies and cross vehicles successfully. The tabletop game keeps the puzzliness, the wackiness, and the fun of the mobile game while expanding into areas that are uniquely suited to the tabletop realm, such as: In-person, face to face multiplayer action, unexpected events to confound other players, the ability to cross tons of vehicles, and more.

The gameplay is half puzzle and half press your luck. Each round you'll pick a bridge tile and either continue to strengthen or rebuild your bridge or use the tile to cross your vehicles. Choose from Super Light, Light, Medium, or Heavy vehicles that each have their unique points and challenges. Watch out for your fellow engineers though, at anytime they might play an event card on you, unleashing devestating damage to your perfectly planned bridge. Who's got the smarts to cross more vehicles and gather the most points before time runs out?

An easy-to-learn and difficult to master game of tile placement, hand management, and press-your-luck that everyone will enjoy.
mechanics: Chaining, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Events, Income, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Race

name: ImmunoWars: STD Booster Pack
description:
The Naughty. Expand your ImmunoWars collection with a bunch of late-night bioweapons. Feeling itchy after that one-night stand? Infect your enemies with sexually transmittable diseases (STDs), such as Syphilis, Herpes Simplex, and Gonorrhea. Do you feel sexy, punk?

Features: 32 additional cards

Requires IMMUNOWARS to play.

—description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Medical
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Income, Lose a Turn, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Storytelling, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Warzone Eternal
description:
Warzone Eternal is a fast-playing skirmish miniatures game in which players collect a force representing one of humanity’s five powerful megacorporations—Bauhaus, Capitol, Cybertronic, Imperial, and Mishima—or the hordes of necrobionic warriors of Algeroth, the Dark Legion Apostle of War. Through scenario-driven battles, players will engage in the constant covert, or not so covert, fight for supremacy amongst the megacorporations or the never-ending battle against the darkness to preserve humanity—or destroy it.

Warzone, the classic tabletop miniatures game of skirmishes in the techno-fantasy universe of Mutant Chronicles, returns with Warzone Eternal! A massively popular miniatures game in the 1990s, Warzone captured the imagination of players with its adrenaline-fueled imagery and its quick and engaging ruleset. Res Nova seeks to recapture that spirit with Warzone Eternal and has assembled a crack team to do so.

—description from the publisher
categories: Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Stat Check Resolution, Turn Order: Pass Order, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers

name: Obscure Battles 6: A Cruel Sea
description:
In "Obscure Battles Volume 6 – A Cruel Sea", the player takes the role of a Submarine commmander trying to locate and destroy enemy shipping on a patrol.

This is a exclusively solitaire game: you don’t need any other player to play the game. Extremely fast playing and simple but detailed , fun game - just a A3 for your map board, the game is extremely easy to play. Just roll a single D6 and pick the targets then see if you can execute a successful attack and then survive to tell the tale !

Game comes with 8 Submarines: German Type 21 and 7C from WW2 and UC/III from WW1, French Surcouf, Japanese Junsen 2 , US Gato from WW2, Soviet Foxtrot and one special yellow submarine :) .

Play the standart game or you can also design your own missions using the supplied Submarine Info , Target ad Escort Type Cards. There are more Submarine types and loadouts that are provided as part of the optional packs.

Your targets are selected from different decks of cards such as different freighter types, fishing vessel, troop Ships, tankers, capital warships etc.

Your submarine will not be safe out there: there are several usual ASW escorts such as Destroyers, Frigates, ASW Planes, Corvettes and and even Q-Ships.

There is also special set of "named" Target and Escort cards that come with their own name such "HMS Saltash Castle", "USS England" and "IJN Shigure" and more.
Finally, the combat cards give you the expected unexpectedness of the life at sea.

—description from the publisher
categories: Korean War, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Command Cards, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Ruinous Nightmares Pack #1 – Nightmares From Beyond Game Supplement
description:
There are things in the dark places of the world that are best left unseen by the prying eyes of man. Some horrors that cannot be fathomed. These are the nightmares from beyond, that haunt the deepest shadows, and feed on the fragile minds of those foolish enough to seek them out.

This 15 card Challenge Supplement adds an all new deck of Ruinous Nightmares to Shadows of Brimstone, allowing players to increase the difficulty of the Adventures. Choose from Nightmare Level 1, 2, or 3 to give your Heroes a serious run for their money. There are some extra rewards for exploring the more dangerous parts of this world though, and Heroes may find that if they can overcome the challenge, glory and riches await. But be warned, Ruinous Nightmares are not for the faint of heart. You have been warned.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Wizlords in Space: Cosmic Card-tastrophe
description:
Wizlords in Space: Cosmic Card-tastrophe is a tactical 2 player card game from Wizbiz Games!

Magic-enhancing oomph has been discovered deep in space, and wizards are battling over who can gain the most of it in order to be crowned the Wizlord! But how much oomph will it take to reign supreme? That’s not a trick question; the first player to store 6 oomph will become the ultimate Wizlord in Space!

Take turns playing and using different combinations of elemental wizards to attack opponents, ward to set up future turns, meditate to gain oomph, store the oomph already on your wizard, or use each wizard's unique cantrip. Players can also equip powerful, double-sided spell cards from a shared deck if the element on the spell matches one of their wizards.

At the end of each turn, players gain an amount of oomph that increases each time the spell deck is shuffled, making things more and more frantic as the game goes on! Will you store your oomph for safekeeping, or use its power to take out your opponent and risk losing it all? Choose wisely, and you just might be crowned the Wizlord in Space!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Take That, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Rum Runner
description:
It's the Age of Sail and the Crown is distilling rum on colonized islands for enormous profit. Meanwhile pirates intend to sail in, steal that rum, and drink it all . These two factions (*Crown* and *Pirate*) play their conflict out over a two player asymmetric card game. Each player has a deck, a hand of cards, coins, and a menu of 3 actions to choose from each turn. But what each does varies substantially.

The *Crown* player will work in secret, laying traps and pushing for an economic victory. They score rum by founding it on an island and investing coins into it over time. They protect that investment by placing hazards in front of the island face-down. When the Pirate player tries to raid that island the Crown can decide to spend their coin to raise those hazards against the Pirate, stopping them or making them pay a terrible price. The Crown may alternatively place traps or economic investments on their islands, luring the Pirate to certain doom or increasing the momentum of the Crown's victory. If the Crown manages to hold out and score four points of rum, they win the game.

The *Pirate* player will assemble ships and crew. These will hopefully raid their way to where the rum is with a combination of deduction and perseverance.
