But regardless they will trigger and combo together unique crew's unique abilities to gain an advantage. If the Pirate finds four bottles of rum (quality doesn't matter), they win the game.

—description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Among Cultists: Down into the Abyss
description: 1st expansion for Among Cultists. Enter a forgotten laboratory on 5 islands and try to avoid Tentacles of an slumbering evil. This map indroduces new mechanics: boats & tentacles, also new hidden roles to evolve your gameplay!
mechanics: Hidden Roles

name: Rusty Dagger
description:
Rusty Dagger: Solo Adventure Zine Game is a set of print and play rules that require very few additional items to start playing. All the features of the big box games have been packed in: hero creation, companions, Item list, leveling up, Enemy AI, and skirmish combat. Time for an Adventure!

You play a hero and follow an adventure booklet.
In this booklet you will alternate between narrative challenges (convincing a companion to follow you, avoiding a trap,...) and combat challenges.
The combat challenges are played on a tile that you can print or build yourself.
In these challenges you have to eliminate the enemies.
You must defeat the end boss to complete the adventure and gain experience.
With this experience you can upgrade your character and participate in more difficult adventures.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mexica Museum
description:
In this game, 1 to 4 players take on the role of human characters, who must survive a night trapped inside the Museum, working together, engaging in combat, solving riddles, and collecting various items such as weapons, keys, or ancient artifacts from the exhibition, to fulfill different missions that will allow them to escape alive, before their time runs out.

A single player will take on the role of the ghost priest. His sole purpose is eliminate all humans who wander around the museum, so that they serve as ritual sacrifice to the ancient gods. To do this, he will have the help of subortinated entities and various EVENTS that will occur every in-game “hour”.

HOW TO PLAY (overview):

Each round, HUMAN characters play following their specific character order. HUMAN players get two actions each turn, which can use to a) move, b) use Healing or defensive ITEMS (on themselves or on another player, adjacent to them) or c) share ITEMS with another adjacent player. Players can also skip one or both of their actions, and throw away unwanted ITEMS to clear storage space (each player can carry up to 4 ITEMS)

Last is the GHOST PRIEST's turn: each turn, this character plays one card from his/ her GHOST DECK: these cards show different Chess movements, that the GHOST can perform during his/ her turn.

After the GHOST’s turn, the game’s clock is moved 10 “minutes” and a new round begins.

When an in-game “hour” is completed, the GHOST resets his/ her deck, and takes an EVENT card: its instructions are followed by all players.

If a HUMAN looses all HP, get’s WOUNDED: its unable to move, use ITEMS and has to let go of all ITEMS. If another player doesn’t heal the WOUNDED player during 3 turns, the wounded character DIES, and transforms into another GHOST, hunting down his/ her former allies onwards.

Each game is set around a different story or “game mode”, that sets different player counts and goals. There are currently 3 different modes:
“THIEVES IN THE SHADOWS” is a quik heist mission, with one side acting as thieves, and another defending the museum’s artifacts (no EVENTS).
“NIGHT OF THE RITUAL” is a 4-5 player story, involving secret objectives for each player.
THE SKULL SHRINE” is a story campaign for 2-3 players.

All campaigns have a time limit. If time runs out and players can’t achieve their specific goals, HUMANS automatically lose.

-description from designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Godsforge: Return of the Dragon Gods
description: An expansion for Godsforge. Introduces Upgrades that increase your game’s power level, added dragon-themed creation and spell cards, and increases player count by one.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards

name: River Rats: SEAL Team
description:
River Rats: SEAL Team is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire/2-player co-op print and play wargame using a tables-based game engine.

As the squad leader of an elite US Navy SEAL team operating in the Vietnam Mekong Delta region, your ultimate goal is to survive a 6-month Vietnam tour of duty during the year 1968. Mission assignments against the Viet Cong will include search & destroy, reconnaissance, downed US airmen rescues, demolition of VC structures, and VC officer assassinations.

With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization. And with numerous SEAL skills, weapons, mission types, possible tactics, weather effects, terrain types, random events, and a multitude of table modifiers, River Rats: SEAL Team offers high replay value. Are you up to the challenge?

The player will move his soldiers through various travel boxes on a map during each mission on his way to the assigned mission area, then must successfully return back to home base.

Game components include a crewmen placement mats, strategic map mat, tables book, crewmen status sheets, campaign log sheet, and counter sheets representing individual soldiers, weapons, equipment, etc.


The game is available as Print and Play on Wargame Vault.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bug Council of Backyardia: Promo Pack #1
description:
Includes 5 promotional wild cards for Bug Council of Backyardia.

Card breakdown:

3 value 0 wild cards
2 value 15 wild cards

The suit of each wild card is defined only when played into the trick. If you lead with a wild card, choose and announce which suit the card will be, otherwise, the suit of the wild card will always match the 'lead suit'.
mechanics: Mancala, Trick-taking

name: Godtear: Lily, Thornsinger of the Azure Forest
description:
Older than the woods she wanders, nothing escapes Lily’s notice, even the tiniest sapling. In her wake, she leaves a trail of crystalline fairy dust that empowers her allies and ensnares her foes. Around her, an overgrowth of Thornlings sink their roots, ready to confront anyone foolish enough to trespass in their forest home.

Sprinkle some fae magic on your Godtear warband! Lily might not be an offensive powerhouse, but don’t underestimate her. What she lacks in direct attacks, she makes up for with powerful support abilities and fae trickery. Using fairy dust, she’s the first ever champion able to seed boons and blights on the battlefield for other characters to step on, helping her friends and hindering her foes!

Lily’s loyal followers are the Thornlings — woodland beings who sink their roots deep and entangle enemies to slow them down. Meanwhile, Lily flits around the battlefield with impressive speed, leaving treats and traps in her wake!

Inside this box is everything you need to bring the Shaper champion Lily, Thornsinger of the Azure Forest and her Thornlings to your tabletop. Use this expansion with any Godtear starter set for a ready-to-go warband.

Components:
1 Lily Miniature
5 Thornling Miniatures
1 Lily's Banner Miniature
3x Double-sided profile cards

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Hydra Tank Terrain & Ultimate Encounter
description:
Players test their skills against the pinnacle of Hydra might in Marvel Crisis Protocol: Hydra Tank Terrain & Ultimate Encounter.

A twisted machine of occult warfare, the Hydra Tank found in this pack has one purpose: total annihilation. No mere terrain feature, this pack contains everything players need to wage battle across a Hydra-dominated field in the all-new "Fire at Will!" Ultimate Encounter. Whether they take control of the Hydra Tank itself or those who oppose it, all will know the power of Hydra.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Battles of the American Revolution Tri-Pack II: Monmouth, Germantown, Newtown
description:
The second compilation of earlier releases from GMT Games' Battles Of The American Revolution series consisting of:
Monmouth
Germantown
Newtown (which also includes the smaller Oriskany battle)

These are tactical level battles at the regimental level.
The map scale is approximately 200 yd/hex.

Additions to the original releases include:

maps are hard-mounted
packaged in a GMT "deep box"
rules and player aids printed in color
all replacement counters that have been issued since the games' original releases
a new one page matrix-style play aid to assist the First Nations player in Newtown
Joel Toppen's Solitaire Tactics Card play aid
a significantly upgraded Germantown rulebook addressing errata and ambiguities
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Winter's Victory: The Battle of Preussisch-Eylau, 7-8 February 1807
description:
Winter's Victory is a grand tactical, battalion level simulation of the battle of Preussisch-Eylau that occurred on February 7th and 8th in 1807 in West Prussia (modern day Poland and Russia). It pits the Emperor Napoleon's Grande Armee against the Army of Imperial Russia under General Count von Bennigsen. This winter battle was one of the bloodiest battles of the Napoleonic era. The full campaign game covers the entire two day period of this epic struggle. The game also includes smaller scenarios covering Napoleon's approach to Eylau on the afternoon of the 7th, the bloody battle of the 8th on the high ground beyond Eylau, Davout's III Corps attack against the Russian left flank, and the Prussian late day counter attack.

The game system uses an asymmetric sequence of play and alternating fire combat. The basic combat units are Infantry battalions, cavalry regiments and artillery batteries. All command units, from brigade leaders to army commanders, are represented by individual counters. At 15 minute per turn and 116 yards a hex the game system allows players to make both grand tactical decisions and apply tactical techniques used by the armies of the Napoleonic period.

Infantry battalions are represented by being in either column formation on the front side of the counter and line formation on the reverse side. Additionally, infantry battalions may use strength points to deploy as skirmish companies represented by separate counters. Artillery units are battery or half battery sized units with separate artillery gun crews designated for each battery. Cavalry units are depicted in cavalry formation on their front sides and may suffer exhausted after a charge, flipping to their back side.

Cavalry SP are not squadrons. The strength of some cav units may coincidentally match their number of squadrons, but most do no not.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Agemonia: Man Versus Figurine Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of the Man vs. Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter.

A new World event card. Shuffle into the corresponding deck and proceed as normal.

1 card (70x120mm)
Number 033: Man versus Figurine
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Battletech: ForcePack Proliferation Cycle
description:
In 2439 the Terran Hegemony unleashed the Mackie—the first BattleMech—setting off an arms race across the Inner Sphere. The Proliferation Cycle anthology tells the story of how all six Houses employed force of arms, infiltrations and espionage to field cutting-edge new ’Mechs of their own. The volume also includes the story of the first Clan OmniMech.

This companion ForcePack includes all seven original ’Mechs, which can be fielded on any game table using the rules from Interstellar Operations: Alternate Eras. No assembly required—includes seven MechWarrior pilot cards and seven Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tribes of The Lost Island
description:
Tribes of The Lost Island is an area control civilization builder. The goal of the game is to gain control of a mysterious island. Multiple tribes wash ashore on the outskirts of this lost island. As you take turns settling and moving across the island you will gain two types of resources: Population and Knowledge. Population is used for expanding your tribe and building new settlements. Knowledge is used to unlock new technologies from the tech tree and gaining an edge over your opponents. The game is finished when a player either achieves a settlement victory by spreading their tribe across the map, or by achieving a technology victory by building a city and defending it from rival players.

—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Automatic Resource Growth, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Turn Order: Pass Order, Zone of Control

name: Würfelhelden: Alphatiere
description:
The Mini-Expansion adds asymmetric Player powers for your Heroes.
A print-and-play version in German is available for free at the Amigo-Spiele website.

A Mini-Expansion for 3-4 players.

Equip your Heroes with individual powers!

Game-preparations:
In addition to choosing your Hero take the Hero-Board as well as the suitable Hero-Power. (Hero-Powers of not selected Heroes go back in the game-box and are not considered in the game)
Take 3 single-coins (value 1) and place them on the 3 marked spots on the front-side of your Hero-Power. These are your "Action-coins" (keep them separate from your other coins during the game).
If you play with "Mascha" (the bear) you also need the duel-marker (otherwise only needed for the 2-Player-Variant of the base-game).

Rules:
You can at any time during your turn but only ONCE a turn use one of the Hero-Powers that are in play. To do so you need to "pay" with one of your three "Action-coins" (resting on your Hero-Power).
If you choose the Hero-Power of your Hero the coin goes back into the general-supply. If you choose a Hero-Power of another Player the coin goes to the coin-supply of the respective player.
Note: Since you have only 3 "Action-coins" you can only use up to three times any Hero-Power in play. Once an "Action-coin" is used it becomes a regular coin - either in the general-supply or as payment to another player.

End of game/Scoring:
Every leftover "Action-coin(s)" on your Hero-Powers become regular coins and count therefore towards your total.

Hero-Powers:

Phil (the capricorn)
Exploration - you get an extra roll for the this turn (so you're allowed to roll 4-times instead of 3-times, "X"s are still not allowed to re-roll)

Mascha (the bear)
Determination - add this turn 2 swords to your total, if your swords go in the middle than place your duel-marker with your dice (remove the duel-marker when your dice leaf the middle)

Iva (the hawk)
Persuasive power - after you rolled your dice re-roll all "X"s (you have to use this Hero-Power before you take your next roll and the effect is only for the ONE roll you used it after, Note: since you're only allowed to use a Hero-Power once a turn there are no second re-rolls)

Emmit (the otter)
Teamwork - take a yellow or red die from your Hero-Board as if you had rolled a yellow- or red-die symbol in the previous turn (the die is now part of your group - until he shows an "X")
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Martial Clash
description:
Unleash your inner warrior and master the art of combat in Martial Clash, a thrilling 2-player board game that combines strategy, skill, and heart-pounding action. Players choose their martial artist character, each with unique stats and techniques, and engage in a fast-paced battle to be the first to claim 2 win tokens. Experience intense rock-paper-scissors style movement phases, strategic dice rolling for combos and counters, and use powerful secret techniques to turn the tide of battle.

To win a player must get 2 WIN tokens, a player gets a WIN token each time the character health of the other player go down to 0.

Game occurs in 2 phases: Movement phase and Combo phase.

Movement phase, players pick a card from the movement cards (hit, block or grab) (rock, paper, scisors mechanic)

The player who won the movement phase becomes the atacker and starts the combo phase.

In the Combo phase, the atacker do a re-roll and lock of a pool of d6 trying to get the right combinations to do differents techniques.

-description from designer
mechanics: Events, Re-rolling and Locking, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: New Visitors (fan expansion for Fairy Tale Inn)
description:
New Visitors is a fan-expansion for Fairy Tale Inn.
It adds several new character abilities for each of the original characters from the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Chaining, Enclosure, Square Grid, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Marvel United: Multiverse – Pet Companions
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive that brings a whole new feature to the game in the form of adorable and resourceful Companions to help the Heroes in their battles. From a loyal telepathic dog to a deceitfully cute “cat”, with maybe a land shark or frog in the mix as well, these little critters will stand united!

Companions is a new feature players can choose to add to their game, giving them more options and strategies (plus an adorable sidekick). If a Hero chooses to take a Companion with them, they simply shuffle the 3 Companion cards into their Hero deck and place the Companion’s game piece next to their Hero. Every turn, the player can move their Companion one Location for free. While Companions are not considered Heroes (they don’t take damage or suffer other effects), they do provide company so Heroes don’t count as being “alone” in their Location. Companion cards work just like Hero cards, providing an Action to the Hero and a Special Effect to their Companion.

The Pet Companions Kickstarter Exclusive expansion comes with:

1 Redwing Game Piece
1 Goose Game Piece
1 Jeffrey Game Piece
1 Throg Game Piece
1 Cosmo Game Piece
1 Alligator Loki Game Piece
3 Redwing Companion Cards
3 Goose Companion Cards
3 Jeffrey Companion Cards
3 Throg Companion Cards
3 Cosmo Companion Cards
3 Alligator Loki Companion Cards
3 Lockheed Companion Cards
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Appetite for Destruction Squad Pack
description:
"Your screams are like music to my audio receptors!"
- General Grievous

The nefarious General Grievous terrorizes the Republic! Unleashing the Separatist Droid Army throughout the galaxy, Grievous has proven to be more than a match for his Jedi adversaries. A shrewd military strategist, he make use of brutal tactics to claim numerous victories and instill fear in his opponents. His reputation is only bolstered by prowess in combat.

Trained by Count Dooku himself, Grievous wields lightsabers claimed from his fallen foes with deadly efficiency. His cybernetic enhancements further accentuate his skills, making Grievance a key player in the Separatist's hopes to topple the Republic.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Star Saga: The Fear in the Darkness
description:
As the dust settles on planet Eiras, the survivors of Blaine's team return to a meeting with Blaine aboard his starship, 'Dictator'. In their possession is something of exceptional value, an item sure to fetch a great price from some of the most wealthy and powerful beings in the galaxy. However, the Council of Seven are not the only beings with an interest in what was taken from Eiras.

Emerging from mist-shrouded worlds on the edge of corporate space, ‘The Nameless’ are shuffling, rolling, and oozing forth. From tentacled swarms of octopedal minions to titanic ‘ogres’ with thick, crab-like shells and man-crushing claws, there is no end to the horrors of the Nameless horde.

Terrible events in their own planetary system and the very real possibility of mass extinction have led some Nameless factions to resort to extreme measures in order to survive. Seemingly random incursions into GCPS space and attacks on its facilities are all designed to find a means of salvation for their race.

Now, following a mysterious tip off that revealed the location of Blaine and his prized cargo from Eiras, a strike team of tentacled creatures attacks Blaine’s hideout, forcing Blaine himself to fight for his life. Faced with the ruthless onslaught of the frenzied Nameless, can Blaine and his mercenary crew survive their toughest challenge yet?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Argonauts: The Card Game
description:
Argonauts is a cooperative card game that requires careful strategic planning and just a bit of luck, as even the best-laid plans, can fall victim to the wrath of the Gods. The game’s objectives are to acquire the Golden Fleece and return safely to Iolkos without losing Argo or too many members of her crew. Each player controls heroes that participated in the Argonaut campaign, each with his / her own set of skills and special abilities. Following the journey from the myth, the Argonauts must face mythical monsters like Scylla and Charybdis, Harpies, Sirens, the construct Talos, and the dragon guarding the Fleece, not to mention the perilous journey full of lethal encounters with merciless pirates or having to weather destructive thunderstorms all the while making sure their cargo hold is well stocked with the necessary supplies for the journey to and from Kolchis and their ship sea-worthy.

Each turn, the players must decide which of their characters will participate in the encounter they face, dealing with threats with either might or cunning and keeping in mind that these characters will be unavailable to face the next encounter due to exhaustion. But the Argonauts are not alone in their quest. The Gods occasionally take interest in their actions, either helping or hindering the progress of our heroes, laying careful plans to waste… The players win the game if they successfully resolve all the threat cards of the adventure deck!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Into the Wild Supplement
description:
This 15 card Game Supplement for Shadows of Brimstone includes new Gear cards, Darkness cards, and Norse Lands Encounter cards, as well as a brand new Adventure Card that lets you make virtually any Mission to being set on an expedition Into the Wild.

Note that although this Game Supplement comes with Norse Lands Encounter cards, they are used with the Into the Wild Adventure Card, regardless of what World the Heroes are currently in. This card pack works just as well with the Old West, Forbidden Fortress, or Valley of the Serpent Kings sets as it does with the Gates of Valhalla set.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Rifle Bandits Enemy Pack
description: This Enemy Pack contains everything you need to fend off raids by rowdy Rifle Bandits. Included are 6 Rifle Bandit models, the large Enemy Record Sheet for them, and all of the Cards needed to add them to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Sous Scellés: 63 Âmes
description:
It is a small village without history where a dozen families still live. Morgane, a young teenager, dreams of leaving this hamlet in which she feels increasingly judged.

Was it her unease that led her to hang herself from a tree in the nearby forest? In any case, this is what the inhabitants imagine when she is found dead on this cold winter morning — but Hugo, her cousin, doesn't want to believe that she could have done that, and he decides to find out more about Morgane's last days.

63 Âmes ("63 Souls") is a escape-room board game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – We Are Brave Squad Pack
description: An iconic Queen of Naboo and her entourage enter Star Wars: Shatterpoint in this pack! Committed to public service from a young age, Padme Amidala fights for her people on the floor of the Galactic Senate to the streets of Theed and beyond. She is joined by her courageous handmaidens, including her decoy Sabe who often protects Amidala by impersonating her. In addition to a full squad of four miniatures–Queen Padme Amidala as a Primary Unit, Sabe as a Secondary Unit, and two Naboo Royal Handmaidens as a Supporting Unit–that can be fielded together or alongside other Star Wars: Shatterpoint miniatures, this pack also includes the unit, stance, and order cards to get these characters into the fight.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Deep Rock Galactic: Biome Expansion
description:
Listen up and sharpen your pickaxes, miners!

A whole new region below the surface of Hoxxes IV has been discovered, with four new biomes to explore.

They are full of valuable minerals, but also new environmental challenges, biological hazards and a bunch of new creatures.

Preserve your ammo, and be prepared to fight the biggest creature you have ever seen; the terrifying Dreadnought, much bigger than even the ugly Oppressor.

Hoxxes IV will not easily give up on its valuables, so get ready to hack, slash, shoot and stomb your way through icy caves, molten rocks, gooey caves and wonderous, luminescent, underworld jungles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Space Exploration, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Map Addition, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Tile Placement

name: A Lava Story
description:
In A Lava Story, you take on the role of a young volcano with a dream: you want to become the world's most visited tourist site.

Use tectonic plate movements to gain lands and increase your volcanic activity, let volcanic ash rain on land to make it fruitful, grow plants and lure in animals to make beautiful national parks. Or rely on rough natural beauty, raise mountains and rivers, geysers or hot springs. Whatever you do, try not to erupt once you have lured in all the tourists or you might scare them away again.

In this bag building, push-your luck, tie-laying game for 1-6 players you have to keep track of your volcanic activity as well as of your islands beauty. You play through 4 eras of eruptions and if your island features the right tiles, you'll get many rewards. After 45-60 minutes, the last era will be over and players will get one last chance to bring tourists to their island.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Kabuto Sumo: Flor de Muertos
description: This promo adds a new wrestler "Burying Beetle" with the "Flor de Muertos" as special piece. Was available at Essen Spiel 2023. Flor de Muertos is also available in Kabuto Sumo: Beetle Brawl.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: G.I. JOE Mission Critical: Cobra Ascendant
description:
The Serpent Rises!

Gather your team and prepare for battle! Cobra is on the move, and this time they’re led by the sinister Serpentor. You’ll also face the unrelenting one-two punch of the twins Xamot and Tomax.

But, hope is not lost! You’ll be joined by the explosive firepower of Bazooka and Rock ‘n Roll, as well as all new vehicles to add to your arsenal.

Features:
Play as new Heroes – Rock n Roll & Bazooka
Introduces a new boss – Serpentor
2 new lieutenants – Tomax & Xamot
2 new Vehicles

Contents Summary:
20 Hero Combat Cards
16 Lieutenant Combat Cards
1 Lieutenant Deployment Card
8 Boss Combat Cards
1 Boss Deployment Card
2 Hero Cards
2 Vehicle Cards
2 Hero Miniatures
2 Lieutenant Miniatures
1 Boss Miniature
1 Rule Sheet

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Мавка: Магічна Верба (Mavka: Magic Willow)
description:
The selfish and guileful Kylyna has long stayed young taking a drop from the Heart of the Forest, the Forest Source of Life. Once she obtained it by fraud, she has been adding it to her beauty remedies ever since. But over time the drop dried up and Kylyna again grew old. In her efforts to make her life and youth longer, Kylyna wants to find the Heart of the Forest and appropriate it. On her way to this goal, she will try to confuse you by any means. However, you can save the Source and prevent Kylyna from destroying the Forest if you are attentive and overcome all her dirty tricks. Help Mavka and Lukash as soon as possible to meet at the Magical Willow, under the roots of which the Source of Life is hidden, and save the Magical Forest and its inhabitants.

In Mavka: Magical Willow game all participants play as a team against the game itself. All players either win or lose together. To win, you need to bring Mavka and Lukash to the Magical Willow before Kylyna gets there. To do this, you need to be careful and have a ready memory.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory

name: CoraQuest: The Incredible Squeak and Bulk
description:
Originally available as part of Pack Druid from the Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

The Incredible Squeak

Starting Weapon: Any range 1 starting item
Special Ability: Turn this card over and become The Incredible Bulk. Cannot use weapons with more than 1 range. Cannot become determined
Attack Dice: 1 White Die + Weapon
Movement: 6
Health: 8


The Incredible Bulk

Starting Weapon: Any range 1 starting item
Special Ability: Turn this card over and become The Incredible Squeak. Cannot use weapons with more than 1 range. Cannot become determined
Attack Dice: 2 Red Die + Weapon
Movement: 2
Health: 8
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Keep the Heroes Out!: Dice Tower 2023 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available as part of Pack Druid from the Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

1 New Action Card:
Lucky Potion - Look your top 3 tactic cards, keep all cards that have a surge (Red arrow) and discard the other cards.

4 Loot Cards:
Beast

Draw and Ambush 1
Draw and Move


Potion

Portal
Ambush 2 into Swords room and Move


Equipment

Ambush 1
Lucky Potion


Scroll

Move and Melee Attack
Swarm Move
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Lovers
description:
You are the archangel Raphael. Your mission is find pairs of lovers from the Minor Arcana and connect their fate to each of the 22 Major Arcana of the Tarot deck. Nobles will help you by blessing the unions of certain lovers, but time is running out...

The Lovers is a solitaire game played with a Tarot deck. The player takes on the role of the the archangel Raphael and must find 22 pairs of lovers from the Minor Arcana to connect their fates each to a different Major Arcana before the deck runs out. Lovers must share the same rank or the same suit, and their values can be added, subtracted, multiplied, or divided to match the value of a Major Arcana card. Nobles (represented by the court cards) can be used to bless certain unions, altering the individual or total value of the lovers. But they must be used sparingly, since the end of the deck means the end of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dice of the Three Kingdoms
description:
In this game, you capture cities by throwing dice and moving generals, and acquire generals and strategy cards from the captured cities. You can battle with your opponent using the acquired generals and strategy cards, and then use various strategy cards to attack and defend. It's a thrilling game where you can't let down your guard until the end and can turn the tables.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: KeyForge: Menagerie
description:
KeyForge: Menagerie decks are the latest crazy idea to emerge from the KeyForge development team’s secret lab.

KeyForge: Menagerie decks provide their own unique KeyForge experience, each deck includes at least one of more than 50 different Menagerie packets.

Each Menagerie packet is a group of specific cards chosen from the entire KeyForge card pool. Each packet has a name and theme, designed to give a deck a special feel or identify that in the past was either very unlikely, or potentially impossible. There are many different types of Menagerie packets such as the massive cards, creature groups, special combo card constellation, and special theme plays.

KeyForge: Menagerie decks are intended as fun and casual play experiences, ideally with two Menagerie decks facing each other. While each KeyForge: Menagerie is a unique KeyForge deck, they are not legal in tournament play.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Yippee Ki Yay
description:
In this survival game, face a unique challenge at a camp surrounded by wild animals. Employ strategy and cunning to outlast other and be the last one standing. Toss cards, accumulate effects, and brace for action as you fight for survival.
Get ready for an exciting gameplay filled whit unexpected twists!
Do you have what it takes to conquer the forest and be the ultimate survivor?
mechanics: Chaining, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: RuneScape Kingdoms: King Black Dragon Expansion
description:
RuneScape Kingdoms: King Black Dragon Expansion enhances your RuneScape Kingdoms experiences with a new skill, campaign, area and boss. Supplement your abilities with the unique Prayer skill, work with Bob the Cat to traverse the Wilderness and face down the mighty King Black Dragon.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dominion: Cornucopia & Guilds – Update Pack
description: The second edition of Dominion: Cornucopia & Guilds contains eight new kingdom cards, and the Dominion: Cornucopia & Guilds – Update Pack features only these new cards for those who own the first edition of this Dominion expansion.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Limits of Glory: Santa Maura & Capri
description:
The third and forth campaigns in our Limits of Glory series will be two games in one box. Each game is designed to be a stand alone shorter game, playable in an hour, using the same unique Limits of Glory system but on a smaller scale. One game covers the campaign in 1808 by the Neapolitans and French to recover the island of Capri from the British, while the other game recreates the British invasion of the island of Santa Maura just off the Greek mainland to capture it from the French in 1810.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Events, Force Commitment, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: HITSTER: Förläng Festen
description:
Extend the party with this stand-alone expansion pack containing 300 extra hits!
It can be played together with the original game or solo!

Listen to over 100 years of hits and take turns guessing when they were released by placing them on your music timeline.

HITSTER is both a game and soundtrack for your party in one that lets you and your friends go on a trip down memory lane together while enjoying great hits.

How to play
1. Pick a music card and scan the QR code with the free Hitster app to automatically play it in Spotify
2. Guess when the song was released by placing it in the right position of your music timeline.
3. Flip the music card. If correct, you keep the music card to build your timeline.

This version of HITSTER contains:
300 Swedish and international hits released between 1916-2022
30 HITSTER cards
The HITSTER-app that let´s you play the hits automatically in Spotify
3 difficulty levels
categories: Card Game, Music, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Questions and Answers, Singing

name: Don't Starve: The Board Game
description:
Say, pal. Ready for something spectacular?

Based on an award-winning video game series, Don't Starve: The Board Game transports 1-4 players into the unrelenting, randomly generated nightmare world of the Constant, a distant and ominous realm in which magic and science intertwine in ways better left unspoken. Pitched against the elements and a grim bestiary of monsters, the players assume the roles of iconic characters from the series, having to work closely together and use their wits to outsmart fate, strive for subsistence, and simply stay alive.

With its mechanisms highlighting player choice, dynamic combat, crafting, and open-world exploration in night and day conditions, Don't Starve: The Board Game features unexplored levels of immersion, with its visual design fully embracing the unique, whimsical art style long cherished by fans of the series.

Explore, fight, and survive — but most importantly...don't starve.
categories: Exploration, Farming, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Rebel Princess Deluxe Edition
description:
Snow White, The Little Mermaid, Cinderella, and many other fairy tale princesses are celebrating a five-day party. The prince charmings, who have not been invited, will try to infiltrate the ball to propose marriage to the girls. As a princess, you have to avoid marriage proposals and remain single and independent after the celebrations.

Rebel Princess takes place over five rounds, representing the five days of a party, and each round has a special rule that makes each game totally different. The general mechanisms are those of trick-taking games, in which each player plays a numbered card into each trick, following one of the four suits in the game. The player with the highest number of the suit that started the trick takes all the cards of that trick — but that's not necessarily good as players want to avoid taking cards with prince charmings, who each bring one marriage proposal, aside from the enchanted frog who brings five proposals. The player with the fewest marriage proposals after five rounds wins.

Importantly, each player assumes the role of a different fairy tale princess and has a special ability that they can use once per round.

Compared to the original edition, Rebel Princess Deluxe Edition features:

Two new Princesses and new new Round cards
Princess cards upgraded to thick punchboard tiles
Round cards upgraded to Tarot-sized cards with rules text on each card
Balance tweaks to existing rules, rounds, and princesses
A new "Rebel of the Ball" mechanism to allow players to catch up if they are falling too far behind
mechanics: Events, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Ee Chee Wa Maa! Squad Pack
description:
The smallest rebels achieve victory against all odds! During the decisive Battle of Endor, the power of the Empire was tested by the Ewoks of the Bright Tree Village and their rebel allies.

Accepting into his tribe the rebel assault team sent to destroy the Imperial shield generator, Ewok chief Chirpa organized bands of warriors to combat the stormtroopers. In these bands fought the skilled explorer Paploo and numerous Ewok warriors armed with simple bows and spears, who demonstrated that there is no small enemy...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Медова пригода (Honey Adventure)
description:
As a bear, try to collect as much honey as possible, but hurry up - as soon as the bees notice the loss, you have to run home with what you have managed to collect.

On your turn, take the top card from any pile lying on the hive card. Check it secretly and take one of the following actions:

Put the card to your can. Choose any card from your can discard it. Place the acquired card instead of the discarded one.
Play an action card. Apply the effect of the action card, then discard it.
Discard the taken card. If you don't want to put a card to the can or play an action card, just put the card you took in the discard pile.


You then end your turn and pass it to the next player clockwise.

During the game, you cannot look at the cards in the cans, pass them to each other or exchange them. This can only be done through the effects of some action cards.

Action cards and their effects

Binoculars allow you to check any two cards in cans.
Magic mirror copies the value of the adjacent card.
Exchange allows to swap a card from your can and someone else.
The Umbrella will protect the card in your can.
An Interesting Find will allow you to swap a card from any can with the top discard card.
The Dance of the bees will make everyone exchange a pair of cards!


End of the game
When any player takes the last card from the pile on any hive card, players continue to take turns until they reach the first player. After that, the game ends - all players turn over the cards in their cans and start counting points. The player with the most points wins!

A more interactive game mode is also available for advanced players.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Take That

name: Doomtown: Too Tough To Die
description:
Too Tough to Die is the first expansion for Doomtown to follow There Comes a Reckoning and begins the Tombstone Trilogy. Featuring four copies of 56 new cards, this expansion expands Doomtown to Tombstone, Arizona during the legendary conflict between the Cowboys and the Earps. In Death’s domain, tensions are high and the body count is higher. Whose fight will you join in this high-stakes battle for the soul of the town that’s Too Tough to Die?

Doomtown is a fast‑paced expandable card game set in the Deadlands™ universe of gun slingin’, spell slingin’, and mud-slingin’!

With 56 new cards, Too Tough to Die gives you new ways to customize your Doomtown decks. Whether your style is shootin’, spell castin’, or just trying to show that you have more money and influence than the next person, Too Tough to Die expands your options in Tombstone!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Pine Box Entertainment, Pinnacle Entertainment Group

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Umber Greataxes
description:
A trait that is often undervalued in war is flexibility. Sure, an army needs its specialists. Ones who can lead a charge, or hold back an assault, but a Unit that can do a little bit of everything is priceless when they step onto the field. The Umber Greataxes are that Unit for House Stark.

The warriors in the Umber Greataxes Unit Box for A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game are fiercely loyal to the Starks. They combine mobility, defense, and fearsome weaponry to make them one of the most versatile and deadly forces in the game. Many of the more traditional Commanders will find themselves unprepared for the Greataxes’ tactics, and the longer the battle goes… the stronger they become.

Contents:
12 Miniatures
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray

-description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Conclave Editora, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Battle Lance
description: The Inner Sphere Battle Lance includes the much-loved Warhammer, Rifleman, Phoenix Hawk, and Wasp - no assembly required - along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Follow Me!: Mission #3 – Toll Bridge
description:
"Follow Me! Mission #3: Toll Bridge": produced by "BOA Publishing", this unofficial expansion of the Ambush! family of wargames requires both Ambush! and a map from Ambush! Purple Heart to play. This stand-alone mission is the third installment of a planned 4 part series.

Toll Bridge is an airborne mission. Your squad has been handpicked for a night drop into a lightly guarded area containing three bridges. You must secure at least one bridge, all three if possible, and hold until dawn when reinforcements supported by tanks will cross. The bridge garrison is small and reported to be staffed by old men and boys. As long as surprise is on your side your men shouldn’t have a problem...

You may take your Medic (from Follow Me! - Mission #2) along for the ride. You also receive two Engineers to help with any explosives placed to blow the bridges. You'll even get some heavy weapons to aid you along the way.

In addition to Ambush!, this mission requires half map B from the Ambush! Purple Heart module

This mission includes the following:
- 4 new vehicle summary cards
- 21 new soldier cards printed on hard card stock (these must be cut out)
- 10 pages of new paragraphs
- 2 mission cartridges with 3 conditions
- 6 page mission summary with several special rules
- 1 wooden building overlay counter printed on hard card stock to be placed on the map.

This mission is the most complex of the series to date and it was designed so that it could be enjoyably replayed many times. There are several small events that probably won't occur on every playing and some activations create random placements of enemy forces on the map. (In this way no replay of the mission should be exactly the same and your forces won’t be able to set up ambushes for the Germans as you replay the scenario.) There are even a number of optional objectives that can be achieved in various ways.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: BattleTech: Clan Striker Star
description: The Clan Striker Star is a collection of five plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides five dry-erase cards, which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay, and five new Clan Pilot Cards. The line-up of 'Mechs in this pack are the Conjurer, Horned Owl, Incubus, Piranha and Vapor Eagle.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Water - The Palace of Puppets
description:
For many years the Mayamoto and Bashimon Clans have waged war on one another. Now, far behind the lines of embattled troops, Okko and his companions find themselves in possession of documents that could irrevocably change the course of the conflict.

But beware, the constant unrest serves to mask the schemes of the Oni of the Jigoku, who will stop at nothing to preserve the bloddy status quo.

This expansion offers:

2 new heroes, including Isako and Legendary Kubban
The rules to control a Bunraku
An epic campaign that follows Okko and his companions as they try to unravel the machinations of the Clan Ataku.


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Alliance – Dominion War Campaign: Part III
description:
The Romulans join the fight, as you become a starship captain, upgrade your ship, and take on the Dominion yourself or with friends. Star Trek Alliance is a cooperative miniatures experience, featuring starship battles in the Star Trek universe. This box contains components for 1-2 players to play the Dominion War Campaign: part III, including painted plastic ships, cards, tokens, and a 7-mission campaign book. With multiple copies of this set, up to 6 players can battle the Dominion together!

You can either jump in here, or continue your story for a truly epic adventure! Create new Romulan captains, or carry forward Federation or Klingon captains from the Star Trek Alliance: Dominion War Campaign Part II and play a series of campaign missions. During each mission, battle against Dominion ships controlled by the game in tactical space combat while completing objectives to earn experience points. Between missions, spend experience points to upgrade your ships and advance the campaign!

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Scharz
description:
This game consists of three separately saleable parts that can be combined to form a Scharz game (for 12 players):
Part I: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/344934/scharz-part-i
Part II: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/344935/scharz-part-ii
Part III: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/344939/scharz-part-iii
and a separately playable expansion (compatible with the original game) - Battle: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/401728/para-bellum-proel...

In this area control game, the player must master the management of their own empire, its development and conflict with other players. Time in each year, resources and human capacity are limited. Expanding the economic base, building more footholds, improving them, buying better livestock and soldiers, developing trade and fleets - all this is possible and beneficial, but it also requires expensive military protection. Because even those who feed their large army on the snowball principle from the resources of others can win.

Game time 15 - 40 minutes per player, recommended for ages 10 and up.

The original game, referred to as Complete, contains three separately sold parts, labeled Part I, Part II and Part III. Each part contains 2 unique maps and 4 unique player sets and 4 modes (Fast, Basic, Original, Extended). You can play one of four modes on one of six maps in 2-12 players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Automatic Resource Growth, Dice Rolling, Income, Market, Movement Points, Negotiation, Re-rolling and Locking, Trading, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Bite the Bullet: You are a legend
description:
In the gamebook Bite the Bullet, you try to survive a shootout, killing your opponents before they kill you. The game is conceived as a cut-and-play game. You must cut the maps, character sheets and counters from the book. After reading the rules, you have a short preparation time to start your first shootouts. This concept is eco-friendly (as the book is printed on demand via Amazon KDP publishing) and cheap (compared to a similar boxed game).

The game is designed to play in three games modes: solo, co-op, and competitive. In solo mode, you play alone against an NPC opponent. In co-op mode, you play together against an NPC opponent, and in competitive mode you play with four characters against four.

At the start of the game, the opponent starts concealed and is approaching you. You must first try to find out where the enemy is. On your turn, you roll a die to determine how many action points you have to spend during your turn. Each NPC opponent has their own action table and reacts in a unique way. Shooting is resolved by rolling two dice and applying modifiers.

The game contains eight scenarios, each with their own victory conditions, that you can play in a random order. Additionally, you can play the game as a campaign, either as lawmen or as outlaws. By winning several scenarios in succession, you try to become a living legend.

There is also an expansion available with more scenarios and enlarged game maps.

The gamebook is sold, printed and delivered via Amazon.

The pdf-files for the game maps and counters can also be acquired separately via Wargamevault.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: The Aztec Market: 'Ayudarjugando' expansion
description:
Expansion for the base game 'The Aztec Market'.

In November 2010, NESTORGAMES ran a contest on boardgamegeek.com, where the participants had to create new tiles for the original game "The Aztec Market". All of the profits derived from the sales of this expansion will be donated to www.ayudarjugando.org. Ten tiles where selected by Néstor Romeral Andrés (producer) and Victor Melo Barbero (base game designer) to conform this expansion.

NESTORGAMES wants to thank all the participants of this contest. A wonderful group of altruist designers.

The Aztec Market: "Ayudarjugando" expansion includes 10 tiles of the same size as the ones in the original game, and an orange counter.

The tiles:


The Hairdresser, by Joan Ribera.
The Astronomer, by Mark Gerrits.
The Black Market, by Diego Ibañez.
The Pyramids (4 tiles), by Lee Valentine.
The thief, by Lee Valentine.
El trocador, by Sergio Camina.
The Gambler, by Mark Gerrits.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Shadows of Brimstone: The Scafford Gang Enemy Supplement #3
description:
The Scafford Gang are one of the most dangerous bands of outlaws in the West! Ruthless Mutants led by Colonel Scafford and his trusty Lieutenants, the Scafford Gang robs trains and towns across the countryside, making their hideouts in the caves and abandoned mines up in the hills. Former Confederates in the Civil War, they despise the law and use their hideous mutations to fill their pockets with gold and Dark Stone.

This set adds new large Enemy Record Sheets for two of the dangerous Scafford Lieutenants: 'Stone Face' McCoy and ‘Silver Back’ Pa Scafford, making them full Enemy mini-bosses. ‘Silver Back’ Pa Scafford is the patriarch of the family and is a new Scafford Lieutenant that did not appear in the Scafford Gang Deluxe Enemy Pack—he debuts in this new Supplement and a new Scafford Lieutenants game card is included for him. This supplement also includes the new 'Old Blunderbuss' Artifact card, as well as a set of new Threat cards that combine various Scafford themed Enemies together, and even Epic Threats to face off against a more dangerous version of each of these Lieutenants with their gang.

This game supplement enhances the Shadows of Brimstone: The Scafford Gang Deluxe Enemy Pack and Shadows of Brimstone: Dark Stone Brutes Enemy Pack, as well as the Resin Enemy Figures for 'Stone Face' McCoy and ‘Silver Back’ Pa Scafford. Those Enemy Packs and resin Miniatures are NOT INCLUDED.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing

name: Dragons Down
description:
Dragons Down is inspired by the classic board game, Magic Realm.

I thought they were crazy, rebuilding civilization on the exact place where the dragons had come down from the sky. Even if it had been over 200 years, everyone knows a dragon's lifetime can be far longer than that. Yet, here I am like all the other fools. Driven by my thirst for fame and to fill my satchel with coin, I arrived in the village at the same time as the other adventurers...

Dragons Down is an adventure game inspired by the classic game, Magic Realm. The game is set in Western fantasy where players act as adventurers seeking fame and glory seeking hidden treasure sites, looting great treasures and epic artifacts, fighting monsters... and perhaps each other, all while attempting to become a legend.

Each turn, players can hide from monsters and other players, move around the realm, search for treasure sites and hidden paths, loot found treasure sites, stay alert for trouble, prepare magic, enchant the realm, and/or rest from their wounds. By slaying monsters, looting epic treasures, completing quests, or even hunting down your fellow adventurers, players accumulate fame and fortune. Although a winner is crowned for collecting the most fame and retiring (or dying), the game is a very large sandbox that can be played with your own goals in mind.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Alliances, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up
publishers: Active Magic Games, Mr. B Games

name: Warhammer: The Horus Heresy – Age of Darkness
description:
An Age of Darkness has descended upon the galaxy. Horus Lupercal, Warmaster of the Emperor's armies, has turned against his gene-father and sent the Imperium spiralling into bloody civil war. Of the eighteen great Space Marine Legions, finest of all humanity's soldiers, fully half have sided with the traitorous Warmaster, while the remainder stand staunchly loyal to the Emperor. It is a war of brother against brother, Space Marine against Space Marine, which has seen the might of the Imperium's vast armies turned upon itself in a cataclysm of fire and blood.

In Warhammer: The Horus Heresy you will pit mighty armies of superhuman warriors against each other in apocalyptic tabletop battles. Choose your favoured Legion, from the knightly Dark Angels to the duplicitous Alpha Legion, build your own army from a range of spectacular Citadel and Forge World miniatures, and clash with fellow players in wargames of staggering tactical depth. The tale of the Horus Heresy is the bedrock of Warhammer 40,000's rich history, and this boxed game is the perfect first step to joining the epic conflicts that reshaped the galaxy.

The titanic Warhammer: The Horus Heresy – Age of Darkness boxed set contains a treasure trove of content, from a massive rulebook detailing the setting and stories of the Horus Heresy, as well as gorgeous photography and art, and all the core rules you need to play the game. The box also contains 54 Citadel miniatures – including a massive Spartan Assault Tank and a host of MKVI 'Corvus Armour' Tactical Marines – allowing you to build two opposing forces for out-of-the-box play, or construct a huge Legion force all your own. Alongside all of this, you'll get all the game accessories and rules reference materials you need to immerse yourself in the worlds of the Age of Darkness.

—description from the publisher
categories: Civil War, Collectible Components, Dice, Miniatures, Mythology, Novel-based, Religious, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Bias, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Events, Force Commitment, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Order Counters, Physical Removal, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Post Mortem LA: Lights... Camera... Murder!
description:
Lights, Camera, Murder! is a Narrative mystery game inspired by SHCD.

Set in 1940’s Los Angeles, you will take on the role of probationary cautionary auxiliary investigator at the Global Detective Agency and assist them on the case. All the files you need will be sent to your door, including a map of your jurisdiction and pertinent evidence. It will be yours to investigate, follow leads, interrogate suspects, study the clues, and solve the murder. Once you think you have the answers, you can write them on the Final Report included in the box, then break the seal to read the resolution and find out if you were successful in your investigation.

The case centers around the murder of movie-star Clara Rose and her estranged husband Joe Fletcher. They were found shot to death on the dusty backlot of Orpheum Pictures. Classic murder-suicide? Hollywood rivalries that became too real? Mob debts unpaid? Or perhaps something far more sinister... As the Global Detective Agency’s newest recruit, it is up to you to find the truth.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: La Bataille de Dölitz 1813
description:
La Bataille de Leipzig 1813 - La Bataille de Dölitz 1813

The Battle of Leipzig, fought in 1813, is one of the largest conflicts ever and involved many countries / kingdoms fighting against each other. This included a coalition of Russia, Prussia and Austria committed to defeat France and its allies, forging a domination of Europe that would lead to the Nationalism of Germany. While historians have drawn a myriad of contrary opinions about who were the good guys and bad guys, the battle encircles the city of Leipzig with 500,000 man armies facing each other.

La Bataille de Dölitz 1813 occured on October 16h, when forces under Général de Division Kaminieki (Polish) and General Lefol (French) defended the line along the Pleisse River. The river was murky and swollen from previous weeks of rainfall. Men and horses could cross the river only in a few places. These crossings were at Connewitz and Dölitz. Part of the 26e Polish division defended the intact bridge at Dölitz with its manor house guarding the entrance.

This is the area that Schwarzenberg choose to lead an assault to outflank Napoleon’s army. Therefore Schwarzenberg committed substantial Austrian troops to this assault.While outnumbering the French and Polish forces, General der Kavallerie Graf Merveldt’s 2nd Army Abteilung found forcing either crossing a major problem. Unable to deploy his artillery because of the swampy ground, his infantry fought a battle of attrition with an enemy in built-up areas or on the other side of a major river.

Merveldt has been assigned one thing however that may assist him in getting across. He has the two army pontoon and two pioneer companies. They can be used to throw a bridge across the Pleisse or repair the bridge at Connewitz. The player will note immediately the differences in the different formations and how each must be managed to achieve success.

Each 20 minute turn starts with a Command Phase for both sides followed by the French Player sequence and then by the Coalitian Player sequence. The sequence includes movement, cavalry charges, fire and melee. During each, morale plays a decisive role. This is a great one player on one player game but will also accommodate two players on a side also.

The original rules have been updated, but not expanded to any extent. The original designers of the La Bataille Series believe the Premier Rules facilitate / expedite the most accurate and competitive play. The new Premier Rules are an update of the original rules but make it easier to find specific topics and includes some user requested rules such as command control.

This game was initially offered as print and play by Marshal Enterprises; it is now removed and available as part of the commercial La Bataille de Leipzig.

The scale is standard "La Bat":

100 meters per hex.
100 men per infantry strength point/ 50 men per cavalry strength point/ 2 to 4 guns per strength point for artillery.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: A Touch of Evil: Hero Upgrades Game Supplement
description:
As the Heroes close in on the Villain that has been terrorizing Shadowbrook, they will need to keep their wits about them and use every strength they can muster to overcome the evil that stalks them. There can be no turning back now, and no holding back in their fight for survival!

This 24 card Game Supplement for A Touch of Evil adds a new dimension to the game and an entirely new mechanic in the form of Hero Upgrade cards. Now Heroes can use the Investigation and Event cards they've found on their hunt for the creature to 'Level Up', unlocking stat bonuses and a new Ability. Each of the 24 cards in this set is unique and applies to a specific Hero, covering all of the Heroes released to date from the base game, Something Wicked, The Coast, Hero Pack 1 and Hero Pack 2.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Russia Besieged: Deluxe Edition – Finnish Expansion
description:
The Finnish Expansion is an extensive package expands and complements Russia Besieged Deluxe Edition (ownership of this game is required), the finest Corps/Army level treatments of the fighting on the Eastern Front in World War II.

This expansion completes the entire Eastern Front experience by adding a map that covers Finland from Helsinki, Leningrad, Archangel, Petsamo and Murmansk. As an added bonus, included in this package is an historical Battle of Kursk scenario.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Necromolds: Monster Battles – Monster Pack 4: Sigurath & Ankropora
description:
This Monster Pack expansion for Necromolds: Monster Battles contains two new spellbooks.

Ankropora: Bring ruin to your rivals by spewing forth a cascade of anemone quills, starfish fingers, and shark's teeth from the vile Ankropora!

Sigurath: Flip the crimson-eyed golem upside down to radically change its powers and strategically stomp-out your enemies on the map!

—description from the designer
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Movement Template, Re-rolling and Locking, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Nautilùs
description:
Nautilùs illustrates an old sailor game from the 18th century, which was popular to play amongst sailors during the crossings of the pacific. The game combines old myths and yarns of the sea.

The goal of Nautilùs is to bring 4 sailors, illustrated by marbles, from the vortex in 60 steps to the safe harbor. Inspired by the game concepts from "Mensch Ärger dich nicht", "Tac" and "Dog", the game is being played in teams(2 against 2). During the ride, the sailors have to face several threats and challenges such as wrong compasses, pirate trips and the legendary white whale Moby Dick. Moby Dick is powerful and merciless - protect yourself from him in a cave in order to reach the save Harbor!

No matter if it´s storm or sunshine - Nautilùs is a must on your next navy!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Team-Based Game

name: Table Air Combat: C.200 Saetta
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.

A player uses a flight of four aircraft represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This ruleset comes with the Italian C.200 Saetta and two scenarios that refer to other aircraft:

Malta: RAF Hurricanes come under attack by C.200 Saetta fighters.

Gazala: Italian C.200 fighters escort Luftwaffe Ju-87 Stuka dive-bombers, while RAF Tomahawks intercept.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Trasteros Locos: Crazy Auctions
description:
“Trasteros Locos. Crazy Auctions” is a game in which players become collectors of amazing collections of a specific theme. Every collection consists of 10 different items with different values and the player´s goal is to obtain the most valuable collection of their type. Their role will be secret during the game-play and they will simulate going to the storage facility to bid for abandoned storage rooms or access to the public storage room.

They will also need to use wisely their resources to allow them getting cards or increase their number of cubes and their value. The game includes six different collectors with their respective collections. On their turn a player can make one action of seven different ones.

At the end of the game the player with most points will be the winner of the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hidden Movement, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simulation, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Market Works
description:
Market Works is an engaging card game that immerses players in the world of finance and investment through strategic gameplay. Designed for 2-4 players, this game combines the thrill of competition with the intricacies of managing finances, making it a captivating experience for both casual gamers and those with an interest in the financial markets.

In Market Works, players start with a set amount of money and a goal to be the first to accumulate $50,000 without incurring debt, or to be the last one standing after all other players have either gone bankrupt or been unable to manage their debts. The game is played with a deck of cards divided into three main types: Action, Market, and Expense cards, each playing a crucial role in the game's dynamics.

The gameplay revolves around investing money, handling unexpected expenses, and navigating the volatile market to maximize returns. Players can invest their money during their turn, locking it up until a Market card is played, which will determine the return on their investments based on market conditions represented by the Bull and Bear cards. Bull cards double the investments of all players, while Bear cards halve them, adding a layer of risk and strategy to the investment decisions.

Action cards offer players opportunities to directly influence their own financial standing or interfere with their opponents' strategies. These include the Spy card, allowing a player to view another's hand; the Rob card, which lets a player steal a card from an opponent; and the Loan card, providing a quick cash boost at the risk of incurring debt.

Expense cards introduce an element of unpredictability, simulating real-life financial challenges that require players to pay specified sums to the bank. These expenses must be paid with savings, adding a strategic layer to managing invested and uninvested funds.

Market Works is not just a game of chance; it requires strategic thinking, careful planning, and a bit of cunning to navigate the financial challenges and opportunities that arise. With its mix of competitive gameplay, financial strategy, and a dash of luck, Market Works offers high replay value, ensuring that no two games are ever the same. Players will need to adapt their strategies in response to the dynamic market conditions and the actions of their opponents to emerge victorious.

Whether you're looking for a fun way to spend an evening with friends or family or you're a budding financier eager to test your investment strategies in a risk-free environment, Market Works promises a compelling and enjoyable experience that will keep you coming back for more.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Economic, Educational
mechanics: Income, Investment, Stock Holding

name: Tallywood Rally
description:
In Tallywood Rally, you will be in charge of your own halfling political campaign. Leverage the plans up your sleeve into clever plays: send assistants to rally and fundraise—increasing your popularity and treasury, pander to voters directly, build public works, and work with celebrities to get out the vote.

To take their turns, players will be using an innovative card mechanism which allows them to control the actions of their workers. Cards are played into one of four action columns, each with three possible spaces. Each unique space connects the icons on the cards in a different way, potentially revealing bonuses on the board itself. These action include:

Secure Funding: Construct a Public Works tile in this district to attract voters and increase your influence.
Celebrity Endorsement: Attract a celebrity endorsement to help get out the vote, increasing your polling in that district, and attracting new voters.
Research: Reveal the effects of a Celebrity of Public Work tile in a district, gaining support in the process.
Appeal: Spend your Popularity (credibility) to make a direct appeal to the voters of a District, increasing your polling and your vote share at game’s end.


After four weeks of campaigning the final vote is held! Voters are assigned to districts, players total up their vote shares in each district, and the player with the most votes wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Track Movement, Worker Placement

name: Exceed: Carl Swangee Solo Fighter
description:
This box contains one complete Fighter for Exceed.

Carl joins the fight from the world of Penny Arcade’s Automata webcomic. Utilizing a powerful new Overload mechanic, Carl can strike with inhuman strength and speed. This well-rounded normal-focused fighter offers a whole new style of play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: Modern Expansion #49 – Fallujah
description:
Warfighter Modern Expansion - #49 Fajullah adds 56 cards to your Warfighter Modern Missions!

The Second Battle of Fallujah, code-named Operation Phantom Fury, was a Coalition-led effort against the Iraqi insurgency which was rooted in the stronghold city of Fallujah. It was the first major battle fought by regular US and UK troops, with regular Iraqi troops, against the Islamic Army of Iraq, Al-Qaeda in Iraq, and several other insurgent groups, to capture and secure the city. Over six weeks from November to December 2004, Coalition forces became involved in some of the fiercest urban combat against Islamist forces, pushing them back house by house, street by street, frequently encountering prepared obstacles and improvised explosives, with heavy casualties on both sides, as well as civilians.

This expansion captures the high-intensity conflict faced by US and UK forces, with challenging new built-up missions and locations, and introducing Service Records into the Warfighter Modern era. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


4 Player Soldiers (2 US, 2 UK)
5 Non-Player Soldiers (3 US, 2 UK)
4 Squad Soldiers (3 US, 1 UK)
3 Weapons
6 Missions
6 Objectives
13 Locations
15 Hostiles


—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Skytear: Stormsear
description:
An Alliance forged by the fire of Kaeno and tempered by the winds of Utsesh, born to face the twin threats of Xotlan and Grialth.

Princess of a besieged land, KUMAYA, Ashen Maiden, fights to free her dominion once and for all. By using powers learnt from the Nuptians, she can imprison foes inside her mind palace.

SHAIDRUS, Last Light, defends its allies tirelessly using the sacred relic it used to protect. A statue animated by Divine will, all Utsesh and Kaeno has faith in its determinations.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Trederran MK IIs 'Lightning' Scout Tank XXL Enemy
description:
Feared across the battlefields of Trederra, the Mk IIs "Lightning' Scout Tank rolls over trenches and rumbles down burnt out streets in search of the enemy. Grinding gears and plumes of black smoke bellow from the steel beast as it scouts ahead of an armored column, or lends its deadly firepower as infantry support to the Legionnaires. Though smaller than most of the massive tanks of Trederra, the Lightning is more maneuverable, and fueled by Dark Stone, it still packs a punch. It is one of the only Tanks routinely used for excursions into OtherWorlds when the mission calls for overwhelming fire support.

And with it, 2 extra Tank themed Missions have also been added to the Kickstarter-Exclusive Trederran Strike Team Expansion, allowing your Strike Team to go on a Mission to escort the Tank into hostile territory, or attempt to fight your way to the location of a Tank that is pinned down to help secure it, or at least rescue the crew!

Includes 1 XXL Enemy, Cards, Rules, and 2 new Missions.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Godtear: Helena, Inspiration of Hope & Rallied Peasants
description:
Raise your banner with Helena, the Inspiration of Hope.

Pure of heart, beloved Helena strides into battle with a message not of conquest, but of unity. Wherever this sacred quest takes her, Rallied Peasants flock to her standard in hope of a better world.

Introducing the ONLY Guardian champion without a banner! So devoted is she to her cause that Helena embodies her own banner—her presence alone is enough to stake her claim on the battlefield.

Inside this box is everything you need to add this inspiring champion to your Godtear warband. Use this expansion with any Godtear starter set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness – Awakenings
description:
A box containing the various stretch goals from the Gamefound campaign, containing:

1 Soul Harvester Boss Miniature
32 Monster Miniatures
4 Hero Miniatures
4 Deluxe Hero Boards
4 Hero Boards
5 Deluxe Dungeon Role Boards
209 Cards
24 Unique Maps
15 Folded Doors
4 Standees
More than 80 Game Tokens
1 Campaign Notepad
1 Book
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Springsign
description:
