Groups of survivors have their own safe areas under their control. They are self-sufficient and doing okay. Not great, but okay. And they like their new found freedom and look forward to finding like-minded recruits. They’re making the best of a bad situation.

But they’re not alone. Gangs of lawless people have their own areas under control. These gangs patrol the highways looking for loot, prey, and in some cases new recruits. They like things just the way they are. In Nowhere Nevada you have three options –

MILITARY - We allow you to command military units by introducing you to better weapons, new equipment, and a list of missions for you to play. It’s time to kill some Zombies and pacify the area.

SURVIVOR - We provide you with Nowhere Nevada, a self-sufficient community that you can explore, trade, and perhaps recruit from.

GANGER – We give you a ready-made gang, place to live, and opportunities to grow your power.
It’s all up to you…
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Role Playing

name: Danger Suit
description:
Danger Suit is a multiplayer strategy game designed to pit one player as the Villain against a team of up to five Heroes who must work together to build mechanical superhero suits. While the Heroes build their suits, the Villain incrementally destroys the 25 city hex tiles that make up the game board. This gives the Villain special powers, fuels mutations, and helps him collect energy cubes to power his death ray. Heroes must battle the Villain to gain control of the energy cubes in an attempt to save the city.

Players start each turn with two Action Points (AP) which they may use on various actions. Heroes can use their AP to move around the board, fight the Villain, conduct research to build their suits, or charge up to gain energy cubes. The Villain uses his AP to move around the board, fight the Heroes, or destroy the city. Each Hero has unique powers that give them advantages in combat or suit building.

Heroes build their Danger Suits by entering laboratory tiles where they get to draw three cards from the Danger Suit deck. These cards can include parts for their suit (helmets, arms, torsos, or legs), Civil Defense Forces which help the Heroes, or event cards, which will hinder the Heroes with various setbacks. As their suits get more powerful, they can travel to power stations to draw energy cubes from the pool. Meanwhile, the Villain moves to city tiles and destroys them by flipping them over to reveal negative actions for the Heroes. As he does this he draws three cards from the mutation deck which change his evolving form and add armies of minions which he can attack the Heroes with.

The game ends when either the Heroes collect all the energy cubes denying the Villain any power, or when the Villain destroys the city. This can be done by charging the death ray in his fortress or by destroying all of two different city tile types.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: EOKA
description:
EOKA is a simulation game for two players of the 1955-59 conflict between the terrorist group EOKA (Ethnikí Orgánosis Kipriakoú Agónos, or National Organisation of Cypriot Struggle) and the security forces of the United Kingdom and the Government of Cyprus.

EOKA is meant to be played by two players. One, the EOKA player, plays the role of General George Grivas, the military leader of EOKA. The other player, the Empire player, plays the role of the Governor of Cyprus (which at the time was a British colony). A third faction, representing Turkish Cypriot non-state militia and British expatriates who acted as vigilantes, is not played by a human player but will perform in accordance with a set of "automatic" rules.

The currency of victory in this game is a player's Political Support Level (PSL), which is measured in Political Support Points (PSP) and changes constantly during the game. If either player's PSL reaches 0 at any point in the game, the game will end.

If the Empire PSL reaches zero, it means something along the lines of a negotiated settlement has been reached among the British, Greek and Turkish governments on the future status of Cyprus. Historically, one was reached at the beginning of 1959 which decided that Cyprus would be an independent country, without ethnic partitions, and that the British would be allowed to maintain several military bases on the island.

If the EOKA PSL reaches zero, it means something like a collapse of the viability of the organization has occurred - the Greek government decides it should no longer be supported, the population of Cyprus turns against what EOKA proposes, the security forces manage to round up or eliminate much of EOKA's field units, etc..

This game is the latest addition to a family of broadly similar games by Brian Train, including Tupamaro, Shining Path, Algeria, Andartes and Kandahar. New concepts added in this game include Civic Levels, the lasting effects of violent kinetic operations, and some simple solitaire rules (if a lone player wants to oppose an automated Empire).
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Lords of Spell and Stone
description: Lords of Spell and Stone is a worker placement game set in medieval times. Players train their people, dig moats, build towers and walls, buy herbal components, and cast spells in an attempt to earn the most victory points at the end.
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Frogdog Expansion
description:
The Frogdog expansion, is filled with a ton of great early campaign content.If you've fought your share of white lions, this is an excellent expansion to mix things up. The monster has two armor sets, making it a both a great early game and late game target. Just don't forget your noseplugs!

Includes:

1 x Frogdog miniature (100mm base)
2 x Cess Pond survivor miniatures
2 x Pond Scum narrative armor sculpts
2 x Frogdog armor narrative sculpts
4 x Cesspond board game tiles
120 x game cards
2 x settlement locations
2 x settlement events
16-page rulebook
60 x gear cards
....and more!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Dust Tactics: M7D Heavy Assault Walker – "Devastator"
description:
Phaser technology was created by the Allies in response to the lasers developed by the Axis. Powerful VK generators concentrate heat waves into small tungsten cylinders around the actual barrel and then release them, projecting a phased discharge of raw energy. How Allied scientists managed to develop such a complex weapon in such a short amount of time is still puzzling for spy agencies around the world - almost as puzzling as how it actually works. The whole project is still shrouded in mystery.

When the scientists combined several phaser systems into one massive phaser gun with a nominal initiator power of 480 Watts (twice as powerful as any previous system) they needed a huge vehicle to carry it. The resulting M7D Devastator is built around the largest phaser energy generator ever built. Unfortunately, this VK generator occupies the space originally used as a passenger compartment, so it is impossible to transport any troops inside.

There is nothing on the planet that can survive a direct hit from a Devastator. The temperature at the core of the blast is believed to be as hot as the Sun, but since there are no practical ways to measure the heat effectively, no one can be sure. So far no known material has been able to survive a hit from this formidable weapon.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Wild In The Streets
description: Wild In The Streets is a fast paced miniatures game of straight-edgers, crust punks, goths and more fighting in the streets. With skirmish level, low miniature count gangs and easy to learn rules brutal street brawls can be played in an hour. Unique scenarios like Record Store Day let the gangs fight it out to get the other guys' precious vinyl. Or it could be a simple turf war with punks fighting over control of the local half-pipe. Card-driven alternating activation keeps the combats fresh and cuts out the down time. This game is fast and bloody. With a bottle in one hand and a axe in the other unleash your inner brawler with Wild In The Streets.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Vinland
description:
In the darkness of the winternight the young men gathered around the fire, listening to the old man's tale. He claimed to be one of the men, who once discovered the fabled lands of Vinland. But was it true? Even as the old man left, his stories remained, took root in the dreams and desires of men. Most of them kept dreaming but some brave or foolish enought were ready to leave their lifes behind and become legends, or die trying.
This is their Story.

In Vinland, the Players take the role of two of four characters from the Vinland Saga, the merchant brothers Helgi and Finnbogi, the fierce shieldmaiden Freydís and her brother Leif Eiríksson, children of Erik the Red and in their shadow, Eyiolf Thorgestsson seeking revenge for a blood depth. Adventures and fame will welcome the brave, if they survive the sea of storms and blood, entangled in a net of betrayal and ambition.
The first version of Vinland will follow the characters on their travel across Greenland, past the frozen island of bears and beyond the deep forests of Markland. The Game can be either played as a racing game, to reach Vinland first, or as a co-op game on a shared expedition. Vinland will be a 18 Cards game and tries to merge the dense historical references with a light encountersystem.

Coop Game:
The theme resolves around the fabled Continent of Vinland (America) discovered by Vikings way ahead of Columbus. The player have to play two members of an expedition into the unknown West. Its a coop game in which they have to survive Weather on land and sea, encounter Wild Animals and rediscover lost settlements, ruins and gravesides of former expeditions.

The Game ends, when they cross the last of the seven sea(card)s and may reach Vinland. Its not about the arrival in Vinland, but about the Journey of the Vikings to that fabled place.
categories: Card Game, Medieval, Nautical, Novel-based, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement
publishers: (Self-Published), Arcanum Game Studio, Tin Raven Press

name: Crabs?! Escape the Island!
description:
User summary:

Crabs?! Escape the Island is a competitive card game where each player is stranded on a "deserted" island. The object of the game is to escape the island by building a raft out of Trees and Vines you can find in the Materials Deck, and collecting the required Rations. An alternate win condition is available if you think you can "hack" it. But, it's not so easy to win, as you'll be bombarded with various Crabs from the other players in an attempt to sabotage you so that they can be the first to Escape the Island.

These Crabs can steal your rations and materials, sneak a peak at your hand, cause you to lose an action, and take various other actions to hinder your success. While you may decide to smash a Crabs with your Shovel, capture them with a Crab Cage, or worse, turn them into extra Rations by boiling them in a pot of water, every action/reaction you take will likely expose you to a worse outcome. So, choose wisely!

Gameplay:

Each player is dealt 5 cards, and can take various Actions during their turn. The number of actions you take per turn can change during gameplay, based upon what's in your Campsite, or play area. You may play a card in your Campsite, play a Crab on another player, draw Rations, or attempt to collect Materials once you have the required tools. There's a significant amount of decisions to be made in this game, as each Crab can be reacted to in some way. You might choose to destroy the crab in numerous ways, capture it, redirect it to another player, or you might just deal with the punishment.

Once you've fought you way through all the Crabs and have collected the required Materials and Rations, you may triumphantly take your last action and Escape the Island by raft. Alternatively, if you have managed to locate a special tool, ration, and enough rations for the journey, you may be in position to locate the Resort on the island and Win the Game that way. But beware, if you make a break for it, you can bet all the other players will be looking to attack you.

Various Gameplay modes

Outside of normal gameplay which was developed for everyone to enjoy, we've included a few methods of gameplay to keep things interesting. Rules have been altered to account for younger players, so this really is a game for the entire family. But, for the more avid and hardcore gamers, there are Scenarios to play out, which will affect you in different ways each time you play, or Day/Night effects of the island that are designed to keep you guessing literally every round as to what might happen next to keep you from escaping. Are you up to the challenge of Expert Mode?
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Take That

name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Chobei's Renegades
description:
Hero to the common man, Banzuiin Chōbei leads a ragtag band of renegades against all those who intimidate and steal from the weak.

Chōbei is historical character, remembered as a Robin Hood-type figure who protected the oppressed common-folk from the uncaring samurai and other threats.

Chōbei's rag-tag band is represented with mixed-weapon groups, bringing you some interesting new tactical choices.

The set includes 10 metal heads and 18 brand new cards including 'Lead from the Front' and 'Ultimate Sacrifice', which boost the prowess of your commoners.

Chōbei was eventually cornered by his enemies while visiting a bath house. A great swordsman with amazing stamina, he defeated every attacker and was only killed when they set fire to the building.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Realms of Etherium
description:
From the Portal they came, Mages wielding great power, able to shape and forge reality to their will. Gathering the fuel of Etherium, they use these immense energies to battle for control of the ever expanding, ever changing Realms. Those who dominate the most Realms claim victory over all!

In Realms of Etherium, 2-6 players will each control a small group of Mages that start together at the center of an ever expanding, ever changing board. Each Round their Mages will take turns activating, moving to existing Realms, or expanding the board by summoning new Realms either randomly drawn or chosen from an existing pool. Each Realm has a different power to gather resources, gain Mage abilities, alter elements, affect other Mages, and even alter the layout of the board itself!

When a player has gained enough resources they can begin to take control of the Victory Point Realms to gain victory points in order to win. All the scoring is based on the layout of the board relative to these Victory Point Realms, so points can be gained or lost every time the spaces are shifted or swapped, making for a tense, dynamic game that’s different every time you play!
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Voxel Raiders
description:
Description from the publisher (English):
In the world of Pixelia, Voxels are the key to an unknown dimension. The struggle for the control of these artifacts started with a war across the three main nations: the Redistan Rally, the Greenland Gathering, and the Bluelonia Brotherhood. Soon it escalated into a fratricidal war where loyalties lost their meaning.

Super Voxel Raiders is a cardgame that reproduces japanese role playing videogame battles (JRPGs) from the 90s. Players first recruit pixellated characters into three different territories, then a battle is fought in each of those territories, using plenty of fancy special powers. The first player to conquer two territories will gain control over the Voxels and win the game.

Description from the publisher (Spanish):
En el mundo de Pixelia, los Voxels son capaces de abrir la puerta a una dimensión desconocida. La pugna por el control de estos artefactos comenzó con una guerra entre las tres principales naciones: la República de Rojistán, el Virreinato de Verderia y la Alianza de Azulonia. Pronto desembocó en una lucha fratricida que no respeta lealtades.

Super Voxel Raiders es un juego de cartas que recrea batallas de videojuegos de rol japoneses (JRPG) de los años 90. Los jugadores se dedican a reclutar personajes pixelados en tres territorios distintos, para luego resolver en cada territorio una batalla llena de poderes especiales. El primer jugador en conquistar dos Territorios se hará con el control de los Voxels y será declarado ganador.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Wargame The Spanish Armada 1588
description:
A series of books that provide wargame rules and colour photocopiable figures or models for miniatures battles.

Each book tackles a specific time period of history. This book covers the Spanish Armada that sailed to attack Britain in the Sixteenth Century. Simple rules are provided written by Andy Callan, noted designer. The rules can be used with other miniatures.

The miniatures are drawn and coloured by Peter Dennis, the well known face behind Osprey books, many illustrations and Martin Wallace's games. The buyer photocopies or scans the images provided, folds and cuts them out to make armies and navies.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Wargame The American Civil War
description:
One of a series of books that provide wargame rules and colour photocopiable figures for miniatures battles.

Each book tackles a specific time period of history. This book covers the American Civil War of the Nineteenth Century. Simple rules are provided written by Andy Callan, noted historical designer. The rules can be used with other miniatures.

The miniatures are drawn and coloured by Peter Dennis, the well known face behind Osprey books, many illustrations and Martin Wallace's games. The buyer photocopies or scans the images provided, folds and cuts them out to make armies.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Bandits & Brigands Swordsmen
description:
Found in the bad section of town, these are the notorious villains that'll keep any samurai wary when travelling down a dark path...

This is a set of 3 figures to expand on the basic box set of Bandits and Brigands Infantry.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling

name: Kings of War 2nd Edition: Edge of the Abyss – Summer Campaign Book
description:
Edge of the Abyss is a global campaign that will see the map of Mantica change, depending upon whether good or evil triumphs on the battlefield. Throughout the summer of 2017 we will be collecting the results from battles around the world, which means that you can decide the fate of Mantica. You’ll also find brand new heroes, new units, formations and more to bring your games of Kings of War to life.

New Heroes

Rules and background for 14 new Living Legends from factions all over Mantica, from Artakl the Gekkotah Clutch Warden to Dravek, the Abyssal Dwarf Iron Caster, these heroes can be included in your forces during the campaign.

New Formations

Combine certain units in battle for a bonus on the tabletop. These formations were created by the Kings of War Rules Committee and are built upon the existing background for each race.

New Scenarios

Fight in different battlefields across Mantica, from the Elven Twilight Glades to the Edge of the the Abyss itself! These specialised scenarios set the stage for the most pivotal battles of the campaign.

New World

You can record your results during the campaign through Beasts of War . Based on those results, the world of Mantica will change!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Party Battle
description:
Super Party Battle is a college-themed card battle game in which players try to throw the best party on campus. It’s an age-old campus battle between the Jocks, the Greeks, the Hipsters, the Nerds, the Freshman, and the Evil Faculty? Yeah, we're intimately familiar with that. But this time, we're putting our gaming skills to work, and keeping score!

At Super Party Battle University, you and your friends will battle it out to see who's really the coolest and the most fun clique on campus. Put your party skills to the ultimate test as you fight, drink, brawl, dance, use trivia, and even sing to gain total domination over the other groups. Play wacky combos, one-off classes, and expand your party into other campus buildings to take over and throw the most epic party this school has ever seen. The game includes 4 shot glass counter cups to help you keep score, and waterproof cards so you don't have to worry about your partying ruining the party. Party on!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Skënderbeu
description:
English:
In November 1443, George Kastrioti Skanderbeg, at the head of 300 warriors, abandons the Ottoman army during the Battle of Niš. This is the beginning of an epic quarter-century struggle for freedom, where the principalities of Albania become the shield of the old continent against the incursions of the Ottoman Empire.

Be a part of this historical, strategic board game. Relive this age whose greatness has echoed through the centuries. The age of Skanderbeg!

The focus of this board game is precisely this period in history, filled with the struggles of the empires, kingdoms, and principalities of that time to politically survive and thrive.

Command the economic and military forces of a country. Display your skills as a brilliant strategist by planning moves and conflicts in different territories. Take over castles via diplomacy or strength, which will ensure your victory against your rivals. Change the course of history in just a short time!

We’ve tried to faithfully portray the facts and historical characters of that period without influencing the balance of the game, but have also tried to allow enough freedom for different fun strategies.

It is our hope and aspiration as creators of the game to bring about a friendly atmosphere, because we believe that games serve to bond us with each other.

Shqip (Albanian):
Në nëntor të vitit 1443, Gjergj Kastrioti Skënderbeu në krye të 300 luftëtarëve, e lë ushtrinë otomane në mëshirë të fatit gjatë betejës së Nishit. Ky është fillimi i një epopeje çerek shekullore ku principata e arbërit i bëhet mburojë kontinentit të vjetër.

Bëhuni pjesë e kësaj loje historiko-strategjike, të epokës së artë, madheshtia e së cilës jehoi ndër shekuj. Epokës së Skënderbeut!

Fokusi i kësaj loje strategjike është pikërisht kjo periudhë e historisë, e mbushur me përpjekjet e principatës së arbërit, perandorisë Otomane, mbretërisë së Hungarisë dhe republikës së Venecias për të mbijetuar dhe përparuar politikisht.

Komando ekonominë dhe forcat ushtarake të një vendi. Shpalos vlerat e tua si një strateg i shkëlqyer duke planifikuar lëvizjet dhe konfliktet në territore të ndryshme.

Zotëro me diplomaci ose me forcë kështjella, që do të sigurojnë fitoren kundër rivalëve. Ndrysho kursin e historisë në një kohë të shkurtër!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Forager: The Napoleonic Skirmish Game
description:
Forager is a fast fun, skirmish level wargame where deeds straight out of a Sharpe novel can come to life. Think of famous episodes portrayed on TV and in the written word, all those feats can be performed whilst playing a game of Forager, hiding, climbing, jumping, diving for cover to name a few.
Forager is set out in a very similar way to Stand to Game’s Napoleonic ruleset Over the Hills, in that there is a basic rules section where you will find a few pages that once digested will allow you to play the game with confidence. The Optional rules are crammed packed with other rules that players can use to enhance their games of Forager, you will find rules for national characteristics for all the main players in the Napoleonic Wars, the United States, Canada and the Ottoman Empire. Rules for mounted characters, fighting duals, giving orders and character advancement to name a few.

The appendices contain lists and details of the 75 character traits as well as a quick play sheet and several scenarios for you to get to grips with. Finally, to get you started there are two sets of character cards, one French command and one British command. These commands allow you to that you can get straight into the game with.

The basics of the game are as follows:

Each force is called a command and is led by an officer/NCO and has several other soldiers, all being named characters.
Each character has a Skill level and Combat Statistic, Field Craft and Fatigue Score.
Characters can also be given Character Traits that shape how they fight during a game of Forager.
Characters can also be given Equipment that aids them during a game of Forager.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue

name: Congress: The Board Game
description:
As a member of Congress, your sworn duty is to serve your constituents. Serve them well and they may re-elect you for another term. But a higher prize awaits: the presidency of the United States! The American government is built upon a system of checks and balances. Things get done only when everyone works together. At the same time, only one can rise to the highest office in the U.S. Will it be you? Only time - and the American people - will decide! God bless America!

In Congress: The Board Game, you and your fellow senators compete to earn the most nomination points (“NP”) in order to secure the nomination for the U.S. presidency. This is accomplished by passing bills that reflect your interests and agendas over three terms. You must also support the interests of your state’s residents or risk defeat in your midterm elections, harming your chances in the presidential race. The game is over at the end of the third term and the winner is the player with the most NP.

Each session consists of four phases:

Committee Phase - players bid for 'speakership' and select a bill.

Amendment Phase - everyone takes turns adding riders and/or playing action cards.

Voting Phase - the bill is either voted through in simple majority or killed.

Election Phase - if this is the final session of the term, players receive campaign donations and roll for their election.

After the third term and final election, secret agendas are revealed and NP is counted. The most NP wins, and in case of a tie, richest senator wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Take That, Voting

name: Shadowfist: Throne War
description: Throne War is a booster-only expansion set released by Z-Man Games in August 2000 along with Year of the Dragon. It's an 80-card set that contains 69 new cards, with rarities divided into Common, Uncommon, and Rare. The other 11 cards are reprints of Daedalus cards, or appear in Year of the Dragon as well.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: FASISAC
description:
Five A Side International Soccer Association Championships (FASISAC) is a card and dice game simulating the management of five-a-side football.

The game is set in a fictional five-a-side league made up of players from all over the world who have been plucked from futsal, the 11-a-side game and freestyle exhibitions.

Play begins with managers drafting a squad of 8 players, they then select from one of 6 tactics drawing on the skills of their team but also trying to combat the opposition's expected tactic. A line up of 5 players is chosen and the tactics result in a number of attacks and boost cards used to play out the first half.

Attacks are carried out by rolling a custom 8 sided dice to see which player is attacking, the defending player rolls a different custom d8 to see which player defends - strikers are more likely to attack, defenders are more likely to defend! Stats are compared - dice rolls and boost cards are added. If the defender wins the attack is over, if the attacker wins he has a shot on goal.

At half time managers can change their tactics and their playing line up before battling out the rest of the game.

After careful selection of squads and tactics the matches play out quickly with a net full of drama, personality and goals a plenty.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simulation

name: Rio 1808
description:
"In the year 1808, amidst Napoleon's European conquests, Prince Regent D. João VI relocates the Portuguese court to Brazil, specifically Rio de Janeiro. In 'Rio 1808,' players step into the shoes of leaders from influential families, vying for nobility during this pivotal historical shift.

Set against a backdrop of intrigue and opportunities, players dispatch their workers—represented as upgradable dice—to fulfill the wishes of royalty, construct iconic monuments, and sway both the church and society. Resource management is critical, with strategic delays in resource acquisition and a labor market where training workers enhances efficiency but also raises demands.

As influence with the court grows, so does income, but the social complexities among workers intensify. The 'jealousy' mechanic among nobles, coupled with the constant need for gifts, adds a layer of challenge to societal ascent.

At the game's conclusion, nobility is earned through the cumulative impact of influence, wealth, and achieved objectives. 'Rio 1808' delivers a eurogame experience set in colonial Brazil, featuring worker placement, influence control, and set collection mechanics. It provides a unique immersion into a crucial period in Brazilian history, where strategy and cunning are key to attaining the coveted nobility."
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Contracts, Delayed Purchase, Income, Set Collection, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Swords & Souls
description:
Swords & Souls is a quick combat card game with deck-building elements for 3-6 players. After you and your fellow adventurers fall in battle and are cast down to the Underworld, Hades approaches you with a deal: entertain him with one last battle, and the most aggressive among you may return to life.

You and your opponents will take turns drawing and playing attack cards against each other. If your opponent can block or dodge your attack with a card of their own, they're safe... for now. If not, they'll take damage and you'll earn obols, the silver currency of the dead, which you can use to buy more powerful cards from Hades' arsenal of weapons, magic, and other tricks.

Finish an opponent and you'll take a fragment of their soul. But even death is no comfort, as the souls of the defeated quickly rise again to continue the fight. Earn 3 soul fragments to become Hades' chosen champion and return in glory to the life you once lost.

Blood will be shed. Legends will be born. Feelings will be hurt.

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragonfire: Dragonborn Wizard Promo Card
description: Dragonborn Wizard demo/purchase promo from Origins 2017, front and back. Has pureblood printed graphic feature and breath weapon ability.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing

name: The Deck of Justice
description:
The Deck of Justice is a ridiculously frantic, yet highly tactical, hand-drawn card game for 2-5 players. Players take turns striking one another (with fully loaded heroes, armored vehicles and bulging biceps) in a series of quick cowboy standoffs until there is only one survivor.

It is basically a parody of all the (weird) stuff we love about Japanese cartoon...with a Tarantino-ish homage style to the 70s (and 80s)...encapsulated in an outrageously fast-paced & novel (with a touch of retro) game mechanics. The game takes less than 2-minutes to learn and each round takes 15-30 minutes to play.

The deck is on sale now:
https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/deck-of-justice

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Verge Of War
description:
"Verge Of War" is a Sci-Fi wargame with 28mm resin miniatures set in the original VergeOfWar Universe.

The opening campaign is dedicated to the first clash of Human forces and Seit, the race of mighty psionics and insidious intriguers, at the edge of human-inhabited space. The forces of the Human fleet conducted a routine raid against pirates in the sector but discovered that they were not alone in the universe.

In total, there are 10 factions in the game – Human Empire, The Seit Civilization,
Pirates, The Asgar, The Kja Kingdoms, Eltofa, Rungars, Skrags, Triclons, Arachnids.
Each faction has its own history, political structure, physiological characteristics,
hierarchy.

Verge Of War is a classical wargame with RPG elements. The game uses
six-sided dice, D6. Before the battle begins, your commander chooses skills from
three sets that reflect different strategies, doctrines or military specialties. Each set
is divided into 10 levels, which reflect the experience and expertise of your
commander. A typical game consists of 6 game rounds and takes about 30-120
minutes depending on the size of the armies.

The game has flexible mechanics and balanced rules that are easy to learn.
Build your army, conquer the galaxy and make your commander hero famous all over the world!
Achieve immortality!

THE FUTURE IS UNCERTAIN...YOU SHAPE IT!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Legends of the Ancient World: Echoes of the Old Ones
description:
Once, the Old Ones ruled the earth. Today, they are mostly forgotten, aside from a few die-hard cults and scattered passages in moldy tomes. But suddenly, there is a rise in the activities of those who remember... a ripple in reality...

Echoes of the Old Ones is a three-part adventure. Each part can be played in an evening, and may be played separately or as part of the whole mini-campaign.

Echoes of the Old Ones is a complete programmed fantasy adventure for solitaire or group play. This game includes the adventure booklet, game rules, playing pieces and game map. It is suitable for ages 12 and up and can be played with either the included Legends of the Ancient World game system by Dark City Games, or other hex-based tactical combat game systems such as Metagaming's Melee.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Exceed: Pooky Solo Fighter
description:
This box contains one complete Fighter for Exceed.

Pooky takes a break from the excitement of Red Dragon Inn to join the battle in Exceed!

The Good: With wild magic and extreme mobility on his side, Pooky can surprise opponents and get the upper hand in nearly any situation.

The Bad: Umm... do those teeth look bigger than they were a moment ago?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Batman: The Animated Series – Gotham City Under Siege: Devious Plot Promo Card
description:
"While active, villains must be defeated in rank order on each battlefield, starting with rank 1.

No higher rank may be targeted while lesser ranks remain."

Distributed by IDW Games at GenCon 2018
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragonfire: Assassin Kobold Promo Card
description:
2018 GAMA convention promo character screen. This screen has the same art as the Rogue Kobold found in the character pack expansion "Heroes of the Wild", however this character is classed as an Assassin and comes with a pre-printed feature found only on this promo. Also, it is important to note the "Pack Hunters" ability is different from the Rogue Kobold:

Assassin Kobold promo "Pack Hunters" reads: "Once per scene when another character attacks an encounter facing you, you may play any one card as an Assist against that encounter"
Rogue Kobold "Pack Hunters" reads: "Once per scene when another character attacks an encounter facing you, you may play any number of Basic cards as Assists against that encounter"

This character screen is also sized slightly different than all other screens to date.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: FLAUTZ!: Voodoo
description:
The Voodoo expansion comes with two new apprentices that have some special rules and can cast a Voodoo FLAUTZ! With these two new apprentices you might even play games of up to 12 players. In addition, they have brought their voodoo dolls with them. These act as jokers and will help all players casting their spells. Lastly the arena has been turned into a voodoo den and offers new layouts and a new mechanism.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Mr. Jack Pocket: Extension
description:
Mr. Jack Pocket: Extension, the first expansion for Mr. Jack Pocket, features three new characters and a new detective: Mycroft Holmes with a special ability.

With three new alibis, the game will be played on a large London consisting of twelve areas (street tiles) instead of nine as in the base game. More suspects? The investigation looks harder... Fortunately a new detective comes to lend us a hand: Mycroft, the famous brother of Sherlock Holmes!

—description from publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Post-Napoleonic
mechanics: Modular Board

name: Rail Roads & Robber Barons
description:
Rail Roads & Robber Barons is a board/card game inspired by the 18XX series of games. All the fun and strategy of trains, stocks, delivery's, profits, and hand management, in about a fifth of the time!

The game is designed for 1 to 6 players. Solo play is handled by the use of AI decks to represent other players. There are standard AI decks, which are a challenge all by themselves, or you can chose to play against other legendary Barons, each with their own strengths and play styles.

Players take on the roles of Rail Roads and Robber Barons of the mid to late 1800's as rail lines grew to cover the United States and immense profits were there for the taking... with the right moves. The choice of which Baron and which Company to take at the beginning is very important, as each gives a player unique advantages.

The game is driven by Action cards, which the players use to guide their turn. Once an Action card is used, it can't be used again until you step back for a turn and retrieve them, so you have to plan ahead and pay attention to what your fellow Barons are doing. Don't get caught with that vital Action card you need unavailable to you!

As players place down their trains and complete the available contracts, they earn money that can be used to upgrade their trains or buy stock in theirs or other player's companies. Balance is required, because if you invest heavily in the stock market early, you may be caught short when your train is too slow to fulfill the remaining contracts. As a Baron completes contracts and upgrades their train, their stock becomes more and more valuable and it much more expensive for you to buy into. Stocks also pay out dividends when their Baron completes a contract, giving a player much needed cash, but careful decisions are required to manage the best use of a player's money.

Buying more powerful Engines is the key to making more money, but even here many choices face each Baron. The first train purchased in each strength is a prototype that comes with a special ability that allows the player to modify or even break the game rules, however these Engines are more expensive then the standard ones. A player can also pay extra when they purchase a train to skip a level or two and dramatically increase their engine power, but doing so costs much needed capitol. As stronger Engines are purchased, the price of the weaker engines becomes reduced. So, a player can be patient if they want, let others pay heavily to upgrade and then swoop in and buy that slower train at a hefty discount, then use their extra funds to buy stock or save to upgrade to faster Engine themselves at a later time. Both strategies, and many in between, can win the game, but the player has to adapt to what the other Barons are doing and flexibility is the key.

Even the completing of contracts requires decisions. Do you place one of your trains to claim the payout, or do you invest even more in the delivery and place one of your few City Station tiles instead. As you complete Routes, you will be placing cargo in the Depot, and your Routes with Cities in them give you even more crates in the Depot, which will result in larger payouts at the end of the game.... but if you spend too many resources on your Cities, you may lose valuable time while you replenish your hand, time other Barons are surely using to make more money.

In the end, players cash out their stock, count their funds on hand, receive bonuses for the trains they've purchased and the cargo they have waiting in the Depot. The Baron with the most money wins and becomes a legendary Tycoon!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Stock Holding, Variable Player Powers

name: All About Cubes
description:
All About Cubes is a placement game that uses temporary alliances, strategy, and board actions to screw over who you think is in first. Discussion, deals, persuasion, and even temporary treaties to take down first place are allowed and encouraged, but no deal is ever binding. Turns are fast in this game, but there is still strategic depth. Players will attempt to take control of tiles to gain special abilities, which will either help themselves or hurt their opponents.

Victory Condition: Be the first player to remove all the cubes from your box!

Game-play: The game consists of two phases:

placing cubes on one of many tiles in order to take majority control over the tile.
Activating the tiles. Each one has a special ability that either helps yourself, or hurts one of your opponents. But because the scoring is hidden no one knows for sure who is winning, therefor deflection and manipulation to change who to attack is an open table discussion.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area-Impulse

name: Ruins Raiders
description:
Imagine a cooperative exploration game in the tradition of Indiana Jones with a "lite" blend of a good ol' fashioned dungeon crawl using modular tiles and deadly traps.

It even has a light battle mechanic, so players can choose whether to work together or to betray their friends in their quest to escape alive with the master treasure chest. Players will take turns moving through the dungeon, building it as they go, and using up to 3 actions each turn. Traps spring up randomly, as do monsters... and glorious treasure. Treasure cards reveal bonuses to movement and combat. At any point a player may decide to attack another player and escape alone with the treasure, becoming the only winner at the table.

And the best part is, all the mechanics work well either in large groups, small groups, or even solo.

It's a "lite" tabletop roleplaying game with a very basic dungeon crawl that can be done co-op, solo, or even versus.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Schwarze Sau
description:
Swiss trick-taking card game in which you can "lie" about following suit.

The game is played with 2 decks of regular cards, but only using 8-A or 7-A depending on number of players. Like some other Swiss card games, the descending rank of cards is A-10-K-Q etc. In this particular game J's are both Trump and their own suit, so that a lead of a Jack must be followed by another Jack. Jacks are ranked by their suits to determine which is highest. The Qs of spades are the Schwarze Sau's (= Black Sow), which are 150 points for the first and 250 for the second taken. All points are bad; best possible score is to stay at zero. If you can't follow suit then you can play anything you like. However, you can "Lie" and not follow suit if you prefer. Winner of the trick may challenge any one player who has not followed suit. If the challenge is successful, then the liar takes the trick and 50 points for lying. If unsuccessful, then the original winner of the trick takes the trick and 50 points for challenging incorrectly. Players are not allowed to lie when challenged; they must tell the truth. Trick-winner leads next hand. Winner of last trick gets 100 points.

—user summary
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Tropicano
description:
Far out in the ocean is a small, mysterious island where people say a treasure is hidden. However, the young pirates can’t approach the island directly by boat, because the surrounding sea is too rough and dangerous – and they would all get seasick! Then they have the idea of building a bridge. This will help them reach their goal in safety, even though the big waves make building difficult. Keep a cool head and use your building skills, and your pirate may be the first to make a stable bridge which he can cross to reach the island and find the treasure.

The players take turns to throw the symbol dice and gradually construct a bridge with the pieces thrown. The first player to finish building a complete bridge to the small island is allowed to cross it straight away and dig up the treasure.

The parent/teacher takes a “treasure” (e.g. a couple jelly bears, or a little treasure chest) and hides it under the palm tree.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fire of Eidolon: Beauko Ummbird Promo Card
description:
A promotional Hero for Fire of Eidolon available during the Overworld Kickstarter Campaign, featuring a character from the world of Overworld.

The promo card is an additional option for a player’s character from the start of the game.

Noble Steed: 0 AP (passive) When you begin your turn in the same chamber as another hero, you may choose to carry that hero with you when using MOVE actions until the end of your turn. Only one hero may be carried per turn.

Door Discovery (3 AP Once per Game): you may place a dungeon door meeple over any unconnected doorway at your current location and another over any other unconnected doorway on a different chamber tile, regardless of location. Any hero may MOVE between these two chamber whiles they remain in play, as if they were adjacent and connected.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Ascension: Deliverance – Vezra'Tull, The Voidwyrm Promo
description:
Pre-Order promo card for Ascension: Deliverence

Name: Verza’Tull, The Voidwyrm
Cost: 8 Runes
Type: Void Hero
You may spend power instead of runes to acquire this.
Gain one power for each Monster in the Void.
5 Honor

mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Deep Madness: Omega Ravenous Epic Monster
description:
Epic monster pack for Deep Madness.

1 Omega Ravenous miniature
1 Monster Card (in five languages)
2 Spawn Cards (in five languages)
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's SSD Pack
description:
This package of SSDs is intended for those players who purchased the Captain's Rulebook product and now wish to obtain the new edition Ship System Displays. If you purchased the Basic Set, Advanced Missions, C1, and/or C2, you do not need these SSDs unless you want extra copies.

Contents:
Basic Set SSD Book (64 pages)
Advanced Missions SSD Book (144 pages)
New Words I: Module C1 SSD Book (64 pages)
New Words II: Module CC SSD Book (48 pages)
Damage Allocation and Impulse Movement Charts
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Secret Agent
description:
Secret Agent is a deduction trick-taking game for 2-4 players. The game is played over a series of missions. For each mission, one player is the Director of Intelligence, selecting the identity of the Secret Agent. The other players are Infiltrators from opposing agencies, trying to deduce the identity of the Secret Agent for themselves. Players “make contact” with the Secret Agent by playing Agents that share a similar color and rank. The player who is able to get the most Agents through to the Secret Agent wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Wings of Glory: Tripods & Triplanes – MK. IV “Cuttlefish” Tripod Pack
description:
In Wings of Glory — Tripods & Triplanes, the knights of the air of WW1 battle against colossal fighting machines sent by the Martians to invade Earth.
The MK. IV “Cuttlefish” tripod seems to be the ultimate weapon of the invaders; but it is also possible that this monstrous achievement of alien technology is only the forerunner of even worse things to come. Whatever the case, the “Cuttlefish” displays a terrifying combination of speed, maneuverability, and weaponry: powerful energy shields, long–range heat ray, multiple black smoke launchers. It is, as yet, undefeated on the battlefield — but the bravest “Knights of the Air” are trying to find out who will be the first to destroy one!
Each Tripod Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Good Old Cause
description:
Area based wargame on The English Civil War covering the financial, trade and political basis of the war, and the political operations. Cards are used to control activating commanders.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence

name: Steer to Glory
description:
Steer to Glory is a resource management racing board game for 1-8 players simulating a Grand Prix around the racetrack. Holding your steering wheel you rely on the resources of your racecar or use your tactical cards and pilot abilities driving on the edge while your goal is certain: victory.

Grab your steering wheel as if you were jumping into your cockpit. Set up your own assembled racing car, choose a pilot whose abilities fits best your strategy, qualify with your tactical cards, or save them for the racestart and the race itself. Shift into 1st gear, avoid wheelspin and race for victory pushing the limits while using your pilot awereness and abilities along with tactical cards and your resources!

The Grand Prix takes place on one track of the two-sided gameboard. By literally shifting gears you gain movement points to spend during your turn. However, using the resources of your racecar - such as engine, fuel, tires etc. - you can gain extra speed. Along straights there's an opportunity to use slipstream or try to take over the car in front with a bold move from a certain distance. There are strict rules for cornering (based on gears and car setup), but using your resources wisely you can violate them and get further. Resources can be gained back during a pit stop.

Rulesystem is created so, that players get to know more and more functions of the elements as they approach advanced level.

'AI' drivers lets you fill up the grid when playing with a small amount of players or solo.

‚Team orders’ game mod lets you control two cars between wich you have to share your initial income evenly or favorizing one of them for victory.

You can also compete against an AI driver on your friends’ side in ‚Co-operative’ game mod during a four-round championship relying on each others’ developments while racing for 1st.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Automatic Resource Growth, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Movement Points, Race, Resource to Move, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Black Seas: L'Orient
description:
Orient was of the Océan-class of ships. These were a series of 118-gun three-decker ships of the line of the French Navy, designed by engineer Jacques-Noël Sané. Launched on July 20, 1791, she was originally named the Dauphin Royal, but having come into service during a time of great political upheaval, she was promptly renamed. As a tribute to a political movement, she was dubbed the Sans-Culotte. She retained this name for three years before it also became contentious.

In the Game

Orient is an extremely powerful 1st Rate Flagship on the tabletop. Woe betides the enemy that suffers the full brunt of her broadside. Remember that you can only take a limited number of 1st rate ships in a Black Seas fleet, therefore Orient provides an impressive and powerful centrepiece for your French fleet.

She also receives a very characterful set of special rules in the game, gaining a combat bonus when facing British ships, and if should she ever catch fire, she will immediately explode as per her famous historical demise.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Flip Bet
description:
Flip Bet is a bidding and press your luck game played on the Blinks System

SETUP:
Flip Bet is played using Widgets. Place your Blinks together in a cluster, and set them all to the Coin Flip widget. Assign Gold to one player and Silver to the other.

GAMEPLAY
Each turn, both players predict how many coins will flip to their color by speaking it aloud, ie "5 Gold" or "3 Silver". Press a Blink to flip all the coins.

If a player's prediction is lower than the amount of their color shown, they receive that many points. If their guess was higher than the amount shown, they receive no points. If a player is perfectly accurate, they receive that number of points, and their opponent cannot receive points that turn, even if they would have normally. In the event that both players guess perfectly, both receive their points.

WIN CONDITION:
Play continues until one player has scored an agreed upon number of points. The recommended point target is double the number of Blinks in play, but can be adjusted for longer or shorter games.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck

name: La Guerre Navale: The French Fleet in World War II (2012 Standard)
description:
La Guerre Navale tells the story of the French Navy in WW II, a major fleet with first-class ships and well-trained crews that was robbed of its chance to defend France by the German Blitzkrieg of May 1940, its ordered destruction at Mers-El-Kebir by the British leadership, and its scuttling at Toulon in defiance of the Nazis.

Twenty-two scenarios provide historical battles and hypothetical engagements that explore alternate paths of WW II naval history.
This 128-page booklet also includes sidebars and other historical text that places each battle in context, as well as complete Admiralty Trilogy annex specifications for the French, Italian, Siamese (Thai) and US ships that are needed to fight the battles. Several hypothetical units are also included in the annexes.

The foreword is by noted French historian Alexandre Sheldon-Duplaix.

The information in this booklet is not only compatible with Command At Sea 4th edition, the data is now in the same format and uses the same standards as 'Dawn of the Battleship, Fear God & Dread Nought, and Harpoon, the other core games in the Admiralty Trilogy.

La Guerre Navale has been updated to use the 2012 Standard, an improved formula to calculate a ship’s damage points.

Please make sure that all ships on both sides in a scenario are using either the older 2006 Standard, or the new 2012 Standard.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: Warfighter: Modern Expansion #51 – France
description:
This expansion gives you the Soldiers, Weapons, Skills, and Gear to deploy French Warfighters!

This expansion offers 12 Player Soldiers, 7 Non-Player Soldiers, and 6 Squad Soldiers. It also contains 21 Weapons (including the P90!), 5 Equipment, and 5 Skills. Some of the new Equipment includes a Hybrid Scope, Variable Scope, and a Compensator. Also, there are 3 unique Skills, not featured in any current expansion.

This expansion offers 56 cards including:


12 Player Soldiers
7 Non-Player Soldiers
6 Squad Soldiers
21 Weapons
5 Equipment
5 Skills


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Russo-Japanese War: February 1904 - September 1905 – Data Annexes
description:
Dawn of the Rising Sun Annexes

This 28-page booklet provides information on all the ships and weapons needed to play the scenarios in Dawn of the Rising Sun scenario supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Godtear: Blackjaw, The Sweeping Flame & Unburnt Reavers
description:
"Blackjaw surges forward as a brazen destructive force, threatening to destroy all before him in a bright inferno. In the Sweeping Flame’s wake come the Unburnt Reavers, vicious orc followers that can withstand the blistering heat emanating from their leader, each racing headlong like wildfire."

This set includes Blackjaw, 5 Unburnt Reavers, Blackjaw's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Raiders Wave Expansion Card Pack
description:
Wave 2 arrives with a new faction in the Raiders, as well as new profiles for Creatures and Robots to allow players to further increase their forces. Joining them are the Mysterious Stranger and notable equipment like the X01 armour suit and the Gauss Rifle.
This card pack contains 203 cards containing new profiles, AI cards, items, quests, mods , perks and more to allow players to use the new models in wave 2 and customise their Fallout: Wasteland Warfare miniatures.

Contents
57 x Poker Cards
146 x Euro Mini Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Beta Cards from Arkham Night 2019
description:
These Beta Cards were designed at Arkham Nights, 2019.
Purifying Corruption was included in The Lair of Dagon mythos pack.

Includes two cards:

Purifying Corruption (Asset: Neutral)
When you draw a non-weakness treachery, take 1 damage and 1 horror: Cancel that card's revelation effect and place 1 resource on this card, as corruption. If there is 3 corruption in this card, remove it from the game.
~ Draw the top card of the encounter deck: Either heal 1 damage and 1 horror, or remove 1 corruption from this card.
Card design by The Impure at Arkham Nights 2019.

*Shrine of the Moirai (Asset: Survivor)
Attach to your location. Uses (3 offerings).
Attached location gains: "~ Draw the top card of the encounter deck, exhaust Shrine of the Moirai, and spend 1 offering: Return up to 2 cards with a total combined level of 5 or less from your discard pile to your hand."
Card design by The Moirai at Arkham Nights 2019.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: TROSS!: Viking Chess
description:
OBJECTIVE
Capture your opponent's throne space (or) trap them on their throne space without removing the majority of their pieces from the game.
Gameplay is like checkers except that the objective is not to eliminate your opponent's pieces but instead to capture their throne space or trap them on their throne space.

This is a tournament ranked game. The more of your opponent's pieces left on the board by the end, the higher your rank. To see the ranks, go to twicealivegames.com.

HOW TO WIN
(OCCUPY or TRAP)
-Occupy your opponent’s throne after they have vacated their throne.
-Trap your opponent on their throne. See pictures.
Note: Eliminating all of your opponent's pieces or causing a stalemate is considered a loss for the person who caused one or both of these outcomes. A stalemate is achieved when no more moves are possible or if you stall by moving one piece back and forth three times in a row.

PIECES
Pawns & Barricades
Pawns start on the board and move forward or side to side, never backwards retreating. They may also jump much like checkers, jumping your opponent or yourself to sacrifice your piece. (See illustration below)
Barricades start off the board one per player. It serves to funnel your opponent's pieces. On your turn, as your turn place the barricade anywhere on the board except a throne. If a barricade gets jumped it is permanently removed from the board for the remainder of the game.

NOTE:THRONES CANNOT BE BARRICADED!

MYTHOS
The Níðhöggr (NīdHogg) is known in Viking legend as the dragon who
dishonors while eating at the roots of worlds, the world eater.
TROSS is Norwegian meaning “to spite”. You
must cleverly outwit your opponent without completely eliminating
their pieces. You might have to spite your own pieces to do so.

Take heed of Isaiah 5:13-15

TOURNAMENT SCORING
Count the number of your opponent’s pieces left after you have defeated them.
You are expected to humiliate many opponents.

9 - Warlord
8 - Chieftain
7 - Militant
6 - Noble
5 - Oathtaker
4 - Freeman
3 - Workhorse
2 - Bondman
1 - Thrall
0 - Nīd (Nyde) You Lose!

Good luck savages!
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture, Sudden Death Ending

name: Wish You Were Here: Kickstarter Promo Card
description: This Kickstarter-exclusive 6th postcard was available on the first Wish You Were Here Kickstarter campaign. It provides an epilogue narrative to the story while leading into Blowback: Wish You Were Here Part II. It isn't required to understand the whole story and was made as a thank you to backers of the first Enigma Emporium campaign.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mean Gene's Match-up Football
description: MGMF is a Pro and College American football play-by-play statistical simulation/replay game that uses two different double sided fast action decks of 100 cards each. The game also uses team cards with ratings for all position players in conjunction with the fast action cards to give the results of nearly everything that can happen in a football game.
mechanics: Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution

name: Memoir '28: Campaign book – Rush to Victory
description:
Rush to Victory are 28mm Wargame rules for North Africa.

This is a Campaign system.
The actual game rules are based on the Memoir'44 boardgame.

You will need a copy of the boardgame in order to play.

These rules enables you to take the boardgame to the tabletop.
Rush to Victory is a campaign system that enables 2 players or 2 teams of players to play a series of 9 games and counter-attacks to determine the fate of the free world.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: A Hot Dry Season: Operation Attleboro in War Zone C
description:
A Hot Dry Season: Operation Attleboro in War Zone C (AHDS) is an operational-level game dealing with the National Liberation Front (NLF) Dry Season Offensive in the III Corps Tactical Zone (III CTZ) in November 1966 and the subsequent counterattack by forces under the command of Military Assistance Command, Vietnam (MACV). From the designer’s website:

"To Military Assistance Command-Vietnam (MACV), Operation Attleboro was a meeting engagement in War Zone C that grew into the largest operation involving US Forces conducted in South Vietnam at that time. To the Central Office for South Vietnam (COSVN), Operation Attleboro was unexpected early contact by a force attempting to conduct an offensive that snowballed into a desperate defense and fighting withdrawal to protect precious logistic and command capabilities essential to their future operations in III Corps Tactical Zone (III CTZ).

MACV grossly underestimated the National Liberation Front’s (NLF) capability to supply their own forces, tactically maneuver them, and evade detection in order to threaten US/Army of the Republic of Vietnam (ARVN) infrastructure and units when operating in close proximity to Peoples’ Liberation Forces of South Vietnam (PLAF – what are popularly known as “Viet Cong Main Force”) base areas in Cambodia. COSVN grossly underestimated the US’s capability to rapidly reinforce an area of operations using strategic mobility and rapidly employ such reinforcements almost immediately in the field.

MACV underestimated the proclivity of COSVN to use PLAF forces confront and destroy threats to its logistics and supply system. COSVN erroneously expected US Forces to respond to tactical and operational dilemmas like the ARVN. To wit, responding to “Ambush and Bait” with dispersed pursuits of the ambushers on multiple axis, thus leaving some pursuing units vulnerable to destruction via “One Slow, Four Quick”. Both sides were unaware of flaws and gaps in their respective intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR) networks, and the murky picture of active operations that would result from a clash of this magnitude, in the trying terrain of War Zone C. Neither side gained any lasting advantage from Operation Attleboro, though both sides missed opportunities to secure them."

The game’s scale is Company as the primary unit size, day turns and a mile per hex. AHDS uses a concealed information/movement mechanism for NLF units and a limited information availability mechanism for both sides, and heavily emphasizes Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) capabilities and their impact on revealing concealed/limited information units. The game uses a movement point system and combat result table mechanisms fires, air defense fire and ground combat. AHDS has an asymmetric component to its turns, as an Initiative player determines the order of resolution of Fires attacks and missions and then Operations (movement and combat). Within Operations, interactivity and reactions to phasing player action; reaction moves and hasty attacks may be performed by the non-phasing player as the phasing player’s turn is resolved. Uncertainty is added to victory and even game end in the campaign by the use of Operational Guidance chits which are selected before set up – neither side may be exactly certain what the other’s priorities are, which impacts victory conditions and player strategy as the game progresses.

AHDS contains 7 scenarios: Introductory, Basic, and Intermediate, ranging from 3 to 10 game turns. The campaign is 25 turns long, but may, through Operational Guidance chit play referred to above, last 30 turns.

AHDS is the first entry in a new series, Campaigns in Vietnam, which features a “Ground-Up Build” system. While sharing core concepts and “DNA” in resolution of play and movement/combat mechanisms, each title is built from the “Ground-Up” allowing specific tailoring of concepts and rules mechanisms in an attempt to accurately evoke the very different Campaigns fought during the Vietnam War from 1965-1975 and faithfully incorporate the dynamic changes in force structure and composition, weapons and ISR capabilities, specific operational goals and difficulties, and terrain and regional variances unique to Vietnam and the Vietnam War.

Basic Information
Map Scale: 1 mile per Hex
Unit Size: Companies
Time Scale: One day per Turn.
Players: 2
Complexity: Medium-High
Solitaire Suitability: Medium
Play by Email Components: Vassal Module completed, available upon game release.

Game Components and Specifications
Game Map: 22” x 34”
Game Counters: 840 each .5” Counters (Three Countersheets)
Rulebook: 50 Pages (Color)
Playbook: 50 Pages; contains Scenarios and Campaign, Examples of Play, Designers' Notes, Historical Notes and Tips on Play and Strategy (Color).
Player Aids and Charts: 6 x Double-Sided (Color), 4 x Single Sided (color)
Scenarios and Campaign: Seven Introductory, Basic and Intermediate Scenarios; One Campaign.
Dice: One Ten-Sided Die and Two Six-Sided Dice.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Secret Unit Deployment, Zone of Control

name: Shadow Gates
description:
Presentation on Essen Spiel 2021

Shadow Gates is an asymmetrical card-based boardgame for 2 to 4 players.

The action takes place in an age of constant clan wars in an alternative-history 16th century Japan.
Aiming to make their warriors invincible, ambitious warlords turn to forbidden magic: shadow gates. The gates lend unhuman strength to the warlords and their armies, while distorting their bodies and their minds. The corruption streams forth from the gates, consuming more and more provinces.
The few remaining clans have to unite to make a stand against the forces of darkness.

The players will side with one of the warring factions: the Keepers of the Gates or the Free Clans.
The game is utilizing the following features: hidden agenda, territory control and hand management. Each side has its own unique asymmetrical card-based mechanics for performing actions: moving forces, conducting rituals, initiating battles, building defences etc. The objective of the game is carrying out personal hidden agendas. The game uses highly detailed miniatures and a large playing board.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Warfighter: Expansion #58 – Fierce: Female Soldiers!
description:
This expansion recognizes the increasing numbers of women in the Military, and includes female soldiers from various nations. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


12 Player Soldiers*
12 Non-Player Soldiers*
12 Squad Soldiers*
12 Weapons*
8 Skills


*comprising one from each nation: Australia, Israel, Germany, Mexico, Italy. South Korea. France. Russia. Poland, Canada, UK, US

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Victory at Sea: Yamato
description:
Yamato (大和, "Great Harmony") and her sister ship, Musashi, were constructed shortly before the outbreak of World War II. They were the heaviest and most powerfully armed battleships ever constructed; armed with nine 18.1” Type 94 main guns – the largest guns ever mounted on a warship.

The battleship’s design was an answer to the numerically dominant US Navy – Imperial Japan’s primary threat in the Pacific. Though laid down in 1937 the battleship was not actually commissioned until late 1941, a week after fated attack on Pearl Harbour. She served as the flagship of the Combined Fleet. It was from her bridge that Admiral Isoroku Yamamoto directed the fleet at Midway in June 1942, though this proved a disastrous defeat for the Japanese. She was thereafter replaced by the Musashi as flagship and spent the larger part of 1943 and 44 moving between ports in a responsive role.

October 1944 was the only occasion on which Yamato fired her main guns in anger, at the Battle of Leyte Gulf. Yamato had been tasked with repelling American forces invading the Phillipines. Though success lay within Japanese grasp, such was the ferocity of a counterattack of a light escort carrier group of the U.S. Navy’s Task Force 77 that the Japanese enacted a retreat, falsely believing they faced a much larger carrier force.

By early in 1945, Naval superiority in the Pacific belonged firmly to the US Navy. In an effort to delay the Allies’ advance, Yamato was dispatched to Okinawa in April 1945, with no expectation to ever return. Her orders were to beach herself and fight until destroyed. This was not allowed to occur when, on 7 April 1945 when she was sunk by US carrier-based bombers and torpedo bombers, with the loss of the majority of her complement.

Contents:
1 Model Ship
‣ Yamato
1 Ship Card
Damage Sliders

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Victory at Sea: Bismarck
description:
Two Bismarck-class battleships were built for the Kriegsmarine. Bismarck was the first, named for the Chancellor (Otto von Bismarck). The battleship was laid down in July 1936 and launched February 1939. She and her sister ship, Tirpitz, were two of the largest battleships built by any European power, and certainly the largest built by Germany. Whilst the physical power they held was tremendous, they also wreaked psychological havoc amongst the allies. Churchill was determined that the two battleships not be let loose upon the Atlantic.

Bismarck's career, however, was woefully short, spanning just eight months under a single Captain, Ernst Lindeman. During this time, she only took part in a single offensive action that lasted just eight days in May 1941. This operation, codenamed Rheinübung, was to attempt what the Allies feared, a breakthrough to the Atlantic and raid allied shipping efforts between Britain and North America (along with the heavy cruiser Prinz Eugen).

The two vessels were detected multiple times off Scandinavia, prompting Britain to initiate naval blocking maneuvers. The resultant battle, the Battle of the Denmark Strait, saw the British vessels HMS Hood and HMS Prince of Wales engage the two vessels. Hood was destroyed for her efforts and Prince of Wales suffered damage, forcing a retreat. However, Bismarck had suffered damage significant enough to put an end to her raiding mission.

Limping for occupied France for repairs, Bismarck was pursued by a Royal Navy set on retribution for the sinking of HMS Hood. She was attacked by 16 Fairey Swordfish biplane torpedo bombers deployed by HMS Ark Royal. A direct hit rendered Bismarck's steering gear inoperable. The following morning, she suffered crippling damage in a battle against two British battleships and two cruisers. She was subsequently, on 27 May 1941, scuttled by her crew and sank with many lives lost.

Contents:
1 Model Ship
‣ Bismarck
1 Ship Card
Damage Sliders

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Atomic Fleet:  Modern Naval Combat in the Northwest Pacific
description: Based on the Victory Games (and now Compass Games) 'Fleet' series of modern naval warfare games, this game focuses on Pacific Northwest area of operations, specifically in the Alaskan waters, the Bering Strait, and the Sea of Okhotsk. The latter was an important underwater staging area for the Soviet (and now Russian) Navy's ballistic missile submarines. The US Navy and Japanese Maritime Self-Defense Force engage the Russian Naval Surface, Submarine and Air Forces over these disputed waters and bases, with their modern navies, guided by internal and external political forces.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Chit-Pull System, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Force Commitment, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Minimap Resolution, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Zone of Control

name: Conspired
description:
You are a Leader! Your Conspiracy Theory is The Truth! Reveal it to the world! Break the Mainstream Narrative! Gather your Followers! Go Mainstream! You must build your Area of Influence so that you can share your theory on mainstream media. The world needs to know!
​
Build an Area of Influence of 8 tiles to WIN the game, but make sure no one else steals your limelight!

​Play as the leader of a conspiracy theory in this disarmingly simple abstract strategy game. Complexity grows from a base of 4 simple actions:

Spread distrust in the mainstream narrative (flip over sheeple tiles)
Convert the susceptible to your theory (replace a tile with one of your colour)
Infiltrate a neighboring community (swap the location of two tiles)
Jump Ship to another theory (change player colour)
​
You'll have to plan ahead to grow your area of influence, and sabotage others from growing theirs.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Square Grid

name: Slam Wars: Wrestling Legends of Michigan
description:
Slam Wars is a card battle game that celebrates the various wrestling territories that existed from the 1940's until the 1990's. It captures the unique flavor of the territory by using historical wrestlers, tag teams, managers, promoters, announcers and referees. Each Slam Wars set is a standalone game, but can be seamlessly integrated with any other Slam Wars set to form a larger playing pool.

Slam Wars: Wrestling Legends of Michigan comes in a 2-piece full-color dual deck poker box and includes a 20-page full-color instruction guide. There are a total of 90 playing cards:

44 solo wrestlers
16 tag teams
13 stat boosters
