10 common match stipulations
6 special grudge match stipulations
1 championship


A round of play is called an "event" and consists of 7 matches (4 solo and 3 tag team). Seven match stipulation cards will be exposed, one for each match of the event. Each wrestler and tag team card is rated in 5 different categories (represented by symbols that match the stipulation cards). The objective is to strategically place the cards you were dealt in matches where they can perform the best (i.e. have high ratings). Like a good wrestling booker, you are trying to maximize your wrestler's strengths and minimize their weaknesses. After comparing the stats in that particular category, the card with the higher rating wins the match-up. Whichever player wins a majority of the 7 matches wins the event and is awarded the championship card. The holder of the championship card has an advantage heading into the next round of play. Much like poker, the rounds can continue until the participants decide to end it.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Planet 28: Death on the Periphery – Solo and Co-op Rules
description:
Death on the periphery is an expansion for Planet 28 that allows you to play solo and cooperative games with warbands made up of custom characters.

Inside this book you'll find all the rules for making solo warbands, enemy activation, cooperative play, secret agendas for your characters and even an illustrated 3 part micro campaign Escape from Lychester VII, in which you'll battle through revolution and mutation to get to safety.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Star Breach: Hunters
description:
Hunters is a cooperative miniatures tabletop game, set in the sci-fi multiverse of Star Breach. While Hunters is a standalone game, the rules for the game expand upon the core mechanics and settings of the Star Breach tabletop game ruleset. Thus, the Star Breach core rules will be often referenced throughout this expansion. The main difference between this expansion and the original game is that Hunters shifts the gaming action of Star Breach from “player vs player” to “players vs game” in a cooperative (co-op) environment. In this rulebook, you will find rules and mission based scenarios for solo play, co-op play up to four players, a campaign system, and a “GM” alternate mode where one of the players—or a 5th additional player—may play as the “game master” against their peers.

As with Star Breach, Hunters is a free ruleset allowing players to creatively play with any sci-fi models and within any scifi setting of their choosing. The industry standard of 28-32mm height models and gaming accessories are recommended for play, but the game will do just as well in any other popular gaming scale (such as 15mm). However you choose to use this expansion and the contained rules, I hope you and your gaming group have an absolute blast doing so! Enjoy, and keep your eye on the stars!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Red Skies: Mitsubishi J2M Raiden Squadron
description:
After a year correcting serious engine problems, the Mitsubishi J2M Raiden (“Thunderbolt”) known by the Allied forces as “Jack”, finally arrived in front line squadrons February 1944.

Primarily designed to defend against the Boeing B-29 Superfortress, and still handicapped by poor engine performance, pilots would use its four-cannon armament and dive and zoom tactics to great effect.

J2Ms operated from Guam and Saipan and a small number of aircraft were deployed to the Philippines. Some Raiden’s were based in Chosen airfields, Genzan (Wonsan), Ranan (Nanam), Funei (Nuren), Rashin (Najin)to fight against Soviet Naval Aviation units.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Blood Red Skies: Lavochkin La-5 Squadron
description:
Able to fight German fighters on an equal footing the LA5 was developed and refined from the LaGG-3, it became one of the Soviet Air Force's most capable types of Fighter aircraft of WWII.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Blood Red Skies: Soviet Ace Pilot – Ivan Kozhedub
description:
Ivan Kozhedub fought in both WWII and later in Korea. His first combat mission was on 26 March 1943.

His first victory came in July over the Kursk battlefields and his record would soon climb.

With a natural gift for deflection shooting (aiming ahead of a moving target at the time of firing), his total claims would reach 62 enemy aircraft shot down, including one Me 262 jet fighter, plus a possible unconfirmed 2 USAAF P-51 Mustang fighters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Judge Dredd: Block Gang
description:
With unemployment and boredom rife in Mega-City One, many citizens, especially juves, join gangs. Many gangs identify with and recruit solely from a single block, whilst others pull in members from all across the city, attracted to the gang’s philosophy, colours, or charismatic leader.

Many gangs will simply protect their own territory and try to take control of the local ‘black economy’ of illegal drugs and other banned substances such as tobacco, sugar, Umpty Candy and 20th-century comic books. Other gangs identify with causes or crazes, including the many anti-robot and anti-mutant outfits such as the ‘Neon Knights’ and ‘Purity First’ or anti-Judge and pro-democracy terrorism like the ‘Total War’ group. Others go on to specialise in organised crime such as body-sharking, organ-legging, alien- and perp-running.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game
publishers: 2000 AD Comic, Rebellion Developments (Rebellion), Warlord Games

name: Deus Lo Vult: Outremer
description: Outremer Add-On presents the army of the Jerusalem Kingdom. The only Crusader army that uses mounted archers, Outremer also employs battle-hardened sergeants instead of regular, unprotected pilgrims, as well as fierce gasmoulloi mercenaries who are second to knights by their battlefield virtues. But having so many strong units of the silver tier, on the other hand, will cost you all your cheap copper soldiers - life is quite expensive overseas.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Deus Lo Vult: Popular Crusade
description: 924 years ago October 21, 1096 AD, the Battle of Civetot occurred and brought an end to the People's Crusade, and we believe we won't find a better occasion to present you the Popular Crusade Add-On and its army, definitely the most peculiar and yet most abominable of all! It offers its commander the unique (and very annoying) "locust tactic," employing the countless swarms of ill-equipped, low-cost, ragtag and bobtail units with greatly emphasized looting and carrying abilities.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Deus Lo Vult: Knights Templar
description:
Adds Knights Templar Army
-"Gonfanon Baussant" - Templar Game board corner camp
-2 Knights
-4 Sergeants
-2 Cavalry (special units)
-2 Archers
-4 Pavesiers
-2 Belfries
-2 Trebuchets
-2 Chaplains (special units)
-1 Grand Master (special unit)
-Immune to Capitularius Divine Will Card effects
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Strontium Dog: The Stix Brothers
description:
The Stix brothers come from an unknown number of apparently identical mutants, all of whom are contracted to the Search/ Destroy agency. They are on the whole utterly mercenary and without scruples – ice-hearted killers who affect the look of gunfighters from Earth’s Old West, with an unflinching and laconic demeanour to match.

Nobody is sure how many Stixes there are. There seem to be an endless supply to take up the family feud and cause trouble across the galaxy. On the planet Freedonia there is a town called Stixville full of Stixes, including Stix women and children.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game
publishers: 2000 AD Comic, Rebellion Developments (Rebellion), Warlord Games

name: Los Cazapedidos
description:
Los Cazapedidos is a card game where up to four players face off to see who is the chef who gets the most points at the end of the game.
To win you must be the fastest to gather and combine ingredients to complete orders with references from pop culture elements like movies, TV series and video games; use the chef cards to gain advantage or annoy your opponents; and be careful with event cards that change the rules of the game.
A easy-to-learn game to play with family and friends.
So, if you've got 15 minutes to spare and you want to have fun playing in company, who you gonna call? Los Cazapedidos!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Set Collection

name: La Bataille de Hagelberg 1813
description:
La Bataille de Hagelberg, 1813 recreates a neglected but key battle in, what was then considered, Brandenburg during the opening of the fall German campaign in 1813. The French commander, General Jean-Baptiste Girard, was commanding the Magdeburg Garrison and had been asked to support Marshal Oudinot in his drive towards Berlin. He was faced by a mainly Landwehr force commanded by Prussian General Karl Friedrich von Hirschfeld and supported by the Cossack General Alexandr Chernyshev. The Prussians and the Russians were given the task of stopping Girard’s French from joining Oudinot’s army.

The Battle of Hagelberg was a bitter battle, held on the same day as the Battle of Dresden. Though the casualties were high on both sides, the Coalition prevailed and stopped Girard from affecting a union of the French forces approaching Berlin.

Notes:
1. Use the Premier Rules, with combat and fire charts, and markers from previous ME releases.
2. First available on Marshal enterprise website as Print and Play. Printed map and counters later contained in La Bataille de Berlin 1813.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Gem Hunt
description:
Theme:

Gem Hunt is an open-world, adventure tabletop board game for 1-4 players. Set out on your trek as one of 12 unique Gem Hunters. You travel across the board which contains a diverse number of regions and locations that have unique opportunities and dangers as you set out to complete your quests and become the Master Gem Hunter!

Quests are unique jeweled items that contain specific numbers and types of faceted gems and pearls and have a monetary value once all the components are collected and turned in at the jeweler’s. There are 50 unique quest cards that can consist of diamonds, rubies, emeralds, sapphires, topaz, opals, and various pearls.

Rough gems and pearls are obtained on unique locations on the board. Rough gems need to be cut into faceted gems to count toward completing your quest. There are some other opportunities to acquire gems and pearls in the game which gives players the opportunity to take a chance on finding an alternate means towards their goal.

Gem Town is the central hub of the island nation of Pacifica, which contains various locations visited throughout the game. The island also has a mountain region, jungle region, and desert region; which are interconnected and accessible via rope bridges. Each movement space visited requires the player to draw a fate card which can be beneficial to the player or a dire challenge. There are 100 unique fates and 240 fate cards in total.

Goal:

At the beginning of each game the players decide whether to play a game based on completing the most quest cards in a specific time frame (first to achieve a specific total value in completed quest cards) or a speed round, which is the first player to complete one quest card.

Gameplay:

Gem Hunt uses a turn-based, card drawing, and die rolling game system. Every turn has a movement phase and an action phase. The movement phase can consist of crossing a rope bridge, taking a ferry, taking the underground railway, taking a ride on a zip line, or moving on the board on one of the regional movement spaces. The action phase can consist of mining for gems, digging for oysters, cutting rough gems into faceted gems, performing transactions in the appropriate location, turning in completed quest cards, playing one of the mini games, or drawing a fate card after landing on a regional movement space. There are certain situations where additional movement or actions can be taken on your turn but those are detailed within the instructions.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting

name: Five Parsecs: Salvage Jobs Expansion
description:
This expansion adds Salvage Jobs to the Five Parsecs From Home game system.

With these rules you can obtain a license, dig around old starship wrecks and get in a shoot-out over the loot.

Updated, tweaked and improved from the original version, this expansion includes all the extra detail needed to work in the current version of the Five Parsecs rules set, letting your crew take on a quest one day, a salvage job the next and fight off alien invaders on Thursday!

If you are familiar with the original version, now salvage jobs are simply another mission type you can get involved with in the game, using the same crew. It also benefits from the many improvements to Five Parsecs such as the massively increased Enemy table


Note that this is an expansion to Five Parsecs From Home. It is NOT a stand-alone title.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Judge Dredd: The Graveyard Shift
description:
The Graveyard Shift is a set of solo play rules, scenarios and a campaign for the Judge Dredd Miniatures Game.

It follows the same format as the standard ruleset in terms of combat dice, however, the perps’ actions are found by rolling 3 combat dice and consulting a results sheet. which in combination with their current demeanor, dictates their actions.

Another cool addition is you randomly select perps to play against and which incidents and scenarios you play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: 2000 AD Comic, Rebellion Developments (Rebellion), Warlord Games

name: Shewsheep Shameless Buffet
description:
You and your friends are at THE famous multinational buffet place. The chef cooks food from all over the world, but sends out only five dishes a time, and the chef might not cook the same food for quite some time, so if you want to eat it, you have to snatch it before everybody else. Today you have to choose between friendship and good food.

The take-that card game Shewsheep Shameless Buffet lets you compete with your friends over food. You want to be the first to reach 25 points, and eating food in a combo results in a bonus score, so grab what you need to fill the plate. Many trick cards allow you score extra points or play tricks on your friends.

The owner of Shewsheep and friends characters — Sumit Simargool — is also the co-creator of this game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Take That

name: No Pasaran! The Battle of La Coruña Road, January 3-16, 1937
description:
Following the successful stand by the Republicans at Madrid Nationalist Generalissimo, Francisco Franco ordered an attack northwest of the city to cut off its water supply from the south. Other Nationalist forces attacked from the north and east to surround the capital and lay siege. In mid-December 1936 the Nationalists launched their offensives, but these soon bogged down at the end of the month due to inclement weather and a lack of fuel. During the respite both sides rushed reinforcements to the front along the road from Madrid to La Coruña. Besides additional troops and aircraft, tanks were sent in large numbers by both sides. For the Nationalists, new Panzer I tanks from Germany were deployed for the first time in the war, along with more CV-33 tanks from Italy. The Republicans dispatched T-26 tanks and BA-6 armored cars that had just arrived from the Soviet Union. One of the largest battles of the war was about to be fought for control of Spain’s capital.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts? Learn and enjoy!

Each copy of No Pasaran! is composed of the following:

• Two 11 by 17 inch map sections with Turn and Game Record tracks.
• 77 un-mounted, double sided units.
• 7 pages of rules.

Players will also need a standard deck of playing cards and a six-sided die (D6) to play the game.

Units represent regiments or brigades or regiments (infantry, cavalry and garrison infantry) and companies (armor). Each turn represents two days of time. A map hex is a little less than 1.5 miles across.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Insert Point
description:
The arcade machine you've been waiting for has finally arrived at your house. The definitive arcade. Play with your friends until they ask for mercy. Challenge the machine ... will you be able to reach the last level? Get your friends together, and show them who has the lucky face. Has arrived…. Insert point.

Objective of the game:
Each player will choose a character with whom they will compete in the "world tournament of the art of martial fighting or not" in which there can only be one winner yes or yes. Your goal will be for your character to succeed, and if possible, fighting. If not, don't get frustrated. There will be more tournaments.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: A Long, Hard Road: The Battle of Dubno, June 23-27, 1941
description:
“If I’d known the Russians had so many tanks I would not have attacked!” --Adolf Hitler

A Long, Hard Road: The Battle of Dubno is a moderate complexity level wargame simulation of the first major clash of large armored formations on the East Front. After launching Operation Barbarossa, the invasion of the Soviet Union on June 22nd, the First Panzer Group of the German Sixth Army led the offensive into the Ukraine. Critical to the German success in the opening days was taking the main road leading to Kiev and Kharkov, and the bridges spanning the Ikva and Styr rivers. Any delays or setbacks here could have severe repercussions as the other German Army Groups and panzer formations drove deeper along Sixth Army’s flanks. Desperate to stop the German blitzkrieg, Joseph Stalin, over the objections of General Zhukov, ordered an immediate counter-attack. The largest tank battle of the war to that date was the result. Can you do as well or better?

A complete game of A Long, Hard Road is composed of the following:

• Two 11 by 17 inch map sections
• 279 double-sided, un-mounted counters.
• One players’ aide sheet
• 8 pages of rules

Players will also need one six (D6) and one ten-sided (D10) dice to play the game. Each day turn of the game represents 8 hours of time. Units are mostly brigades and regiments. Each hex is approximately 1.25 miles across.

—description from designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: World War III: Team Yankee – American Starter Force: Armoured Cavalry Troop
description:
The United States has the most powerful armed forces in the world.

Three army corps stand ready to defend Western Europe from the red horde poised across the Iron Curtain.

Armoured troops’ powerful M60 Patton tanks or state of the art M1 or IPM1 Abrams tanks, mechanized infantry mounted in reliable M113 personnel carriers, and light infantry of the 82nd Airborne all stand ready to stop the red tide.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Any Emotion
description:
A game to learn to distinguish and know the primary emotions.
Includes several game modes.

Game mode: EmoVeloz
Objective of the game:
Get the highest number of cards at the end of the game.

Game preparation:
All the cards are shuffled and stacked face down. A player takes a card and separates it from the rest and indicates what data must be located as indicated by the rocket pencil on the back of the removed card.
How to play:
When all the players are ready, one player turns over the top card of the deck. All players at the same time and without touching the card will have to search for the data. The first to say it out loud and cover the letter will get the letter set aside as a point.
The letter that was face up is left to one side, but in this case face down in order to see what the rocket pencil indicates.
The data to look for in the charts are the following:
Red (number): the emotion that is repeated the number of times indicated by the card (joy, sadness, surprise or anger)
Purple (sex): the largest group represented on the card (boy-girl). In the event of a tie, “tie” must be indicated.
Blue (hair): it will be necessary to discover which hair color is the most numerous in the group of boys and girls on the chart.

When there is only one letter left, it will be turned over to check what data to look for (what the rocket pencil marks). When everyone is ready, it is turned around again and the players try to be the fastest to discover the data.

Game over:
When the deck of cards is finished the players will count the cards obtained. The participant who has collected the most cards will be the winner. In case of a tie, all are winners! Shall we play another?
RECOMMENDATIONS: It is highly advisable to play the first few times with a single data to search, that is, it is always the same data for the entire game. You can start looking in the cards for hair color, the next game look for the majority in sex and in the third look for the coincidence in the number of repetitions of the same emotion that indicates the back of the card.

Un juego para conocer y reconocer las principales emociones con diversos modos de juego
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Creatures: Wasteland Vermin
description:
Description from the publisher:

The first sign of a mole rat attack is usually vicious biting and ripping at your face and body. Erupting from earth below your feet to snap and scratch, they can easily overwhelm even the most experienced wastelander with the fury and surprise of their attacks. Observant wanderers may notice their burrows and avoid them, but attempts to eradicate them when burrowed are almost always fruitless. They are expert diggers and their sharp claws are just at good as shoving dirt as they are at slicing the unwary.

While mole rats burrow and erupt from the ground, Radroaches will stay hidden and attack weak, wounded things. Their preferred habitats are cool, dank cellars and sheds, or underground sewers and train stations. Irradiated and swollen versions of their pre-war namesakes, Radroaches thrive in these inhospitable environments, sustained by refuse, decay and even (when necessary) each other. Despite the squalid nature of such places they often hide diamonds in the rough such as pre-war loot, energy sources, military bunkers or even entire vaults. Anyone daring enough to delve for these treasures should beware; more than a few wasteland wanders have met their ends via the incessant chittering bites and infected slashes of a wave of sullied Radroaches.

Contents:

6x Radroaches
3x Mole Rats

Please note does not include cards, unit and weapon cards are available to download for free, or get everything including their AI cards in the Raiders Wave Expansion Card Pack
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Cultivate
description:
Plot, Draft and Plant. Make your garden thrive!
Cultivate is a spatial card-laying game for 1-4 players in which you will draft succulents, house plants, and cacti, then arrange them in your garden.

During the game, you’ll create your personal garden by laying and tucking cards, buying and placing trinkets, and covering all those pesky bugs. Score points by creating sets of plants with similar growing conditions and by carefully arranging your plot. The player whose garden thrives the most (earns the most points) wins!

This is the 2nd Game in the Quarks Series by XYZ Game Labs.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: The Golden Age of Piracy: 1718
description:
The Golden Age of Piracy - 1718 is an old-school style Tactical level Solitaire board-wargame of action and adventure, with a bit of wargame and RPG elements mixed in. An open-ended sandbox style game where the pirate captain may choose his own path.

Set in the Caribbean Islands during the year 1718, as a pirate captain, you will attempt to build your wealth by attacking merchant ships and selling their goods, by attacking and pillaging towns, kidnapping or assassinating a town governor or his daughter, gambling in a tavern, and by recovering buried treasure from acquired maps.

Game components include navigation maps, various mats, a tables book, and a counter sheet representing individual ships, etc.

The player moves his pirate ship's game counter across the Caribbean map, traveling around and searching for merchant ships to take attack, visiting the pirate town of Nassau to buy and sell goods, plus repair the ship. The player may also construct a hidden pirate haven where he may store stolen goods and booty, plus repair his ship at no cost.

The ultimate goal of the game is to save up enough booty in order to buy your pardon before the Royal Navy invades Nassau. Will you succeed, or be hanged for piracy?

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Coast (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Your influence can be extended to the coasts with new coast tiles, river mouths to the seas.
This expansion is base for several beautiful coast expansions.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Operation Jubilee: The Raid on Dieppe August 19, 1942
description:
By 1942 the British Admiralty was increasingly fearful of losing control in the skies over the English Channel. Earlier in February the German’s Operation Cerberus saw the battlecruisers Scharnhorst and Gniesenau, as well as the heavy cruiser Prinz Eugen sail up the channel to ports in Germany, beneath the very noses of the RAF and Royal Navy. New German radar and anti-aircraft and shore batteries installed along the north coast of France were making life more dangerous for Allied shipping as well as increasingly dangerous for their bombers crossing the channel to conduct bombing raids in occupied France, Belgium as well as Nazi Germany.

In May it was decided to conduct a raid on the channel port of Dieppe. Vice-Admiral Lord Louis Mountbattan, commander of the British Combined Operations Center, was charged with planning the raid. It was hoped the raid could cause serious damage to the German’s defenses, demonstrate to the Soviets that the Allies were earnest in their desire to quickly take the war to the Germans on the European continent, as well as demonstrating the feasibility of large scale amphibious operations. The RAF was counting on the Luftwaffe also rising up to aggressively defend the skies above Dieppe in a battle the RAF leadership was confident they could win. It was also hoped that intelligence agents, that would land with the 5,000 Canadian and 1,000 British assault troops (along with 50 US Rangers), could perform “pinch” operations to capture German code books, samples of their new radar technology, and perhaps an Enigma code machine (this aspect of the raid was overseen by Ian Fleming, the future author of the James Bond novels). An earlier raid to be launched in July, dubbed Operation Rutter, was cancelled but the raid was resurrected in the first week of August and called Operation Jubilee.

Can you do as well or better than your opponents? Learn and enjoy!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Monster Marathon
description:
Imagine a raceway that begins in the woodlands. Typhon, Angrboda, Arachne, Tiamat, Grendel, and Qilin are lined up and ready to compete in a marathon to the volcano. The breeze seems to rot and die from the festering tension, sensing the oncoming rampage that will shake the world. Typhon bursts from the forest with his hundred dragon heads scrambling over each other, creating havoc to disrupt his competitors. Angrboda wields her frost giantess magic to freeze the others with Fimbulwinter cold. Arachne, ever patient, takes her time to weave and scatter web traps far in the distance, beyond the sight of those without eight eyes. Tiamat, unwilling to risk another defeat, unleashes her ten monstrous children throughout the battlefield to ambush her foes and help her when she needs them most. Grendel, the living dreadnought, bashes his way past the others, refusing to be slowed. And the Qilin, well…this dragon deer doesn’t care about the violence, opting to prance ahead, helping whoever they feel like, swaying the tide of the race with benevolent magic. Who wins? What do they do at the end? That’s up to you to decide.

Now imagine that with any combination of 100 monsters from all across the globe.

Monster Marathon is the wild 2-6 player race to set back your friends. Each character has 6 abilities that match your dice roll, so you’ll have to use what you get to survive the 40 spaces to the end. (My original intent for the game was for each player from 3-6 to control one monster, but over the course of playtesting, I've discovered that it also plays quite well at two if both players each pick 2-3 characters on a team.)

Here’s a glance at the basic rules:

All players can select the monster they want. Then, choose a lane to start in.

Pick a monster figure and the matching color of tokens. Some abilities will give you tokens for wards, curses, or traps. When you use an ability that gives you a token, select one with a number that matches the ability.

During each turn, you will have two separate rolls of a six-sided die. You roll a die for an ability at the beginning of each turn. The number you roll determines the ability you get to use. After you’ve used your ability, you roll a die to move on the board.

First to the finish wins!

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Minarett: La caída de Darkófenes
description:
Minarett, The Fall of Darkófenes, is a board game for 2 to 4 players. Each player will represent one of the great guilds of the city where they must use their heroes to gain influence or sabotage their rivals in the race to ascend to the throne of Minarett.

The players control 3 heroes in order to obtain the necessary influence to win. Every turns the heroes can move through the city and perform dangerous missions or face fearsome threats. The heroes can even assassinate other rivals and equip themselves with legendary items.

At the end of the game, the player who has the most influence will wear the crown of Minarett.
-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: La détanque mini
description:
La détanque is a game of pétanque, dice and square balls at the same time!

It's the same principle as pétanque, you throw the cochodé (the jack dice) and then each team tries to position their dice as close as possible to the cochodé.

Where détanque brings an additional playful aspect is that one side of each of the dice represents a super power. Swap the place of a dice, multiply the points by two or divide them ... We are not at the end of our surprises!

Added to this are the different sides of the cochodé which can make you play a whole game on one foot, throwing with 2 hands or throwing with your left hand if you are right-handed and vice versa ... A lot of fun!

The first team to reach 30 points win

La détanque mini weighs about 700 g with 43mm diameter dice and easier to carry around or play inside.
La détanque weighs about 3.5 kg with 75mm diameter dice and let you play outside
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: The Scafford Gang Enemy Supplement #2
description:
The Scafford Gang are one of the most dangerous bands of outlaws in the West! Ruthless Mutants lead by Colonel Scafford and his trusty Lieutenants, the Scafford Gang robs trains and towns across the countryside, making their hideouts in the caves and abandoned mines up in the hills. Former Confederates in the Civil War, they despise the law and use their hideous mutations to fill their pockets with gold and Dark Stone.

This set adds new large Enemy Record Sheets for 2 of the dangerous Scafford Lieutenants –Captain Burns and 'Ol’ One Eye' Jackson, making them full Enemy mini-bosses. It also includes new outlaw-themed Gear and Artifact cards, as well as a set of new Threat cards that combine various Scafford themed Enemies together, and even Epic Threats to face off against a more dangerous version of each of these Lieutenants with their gang.

This game supplement enhances the Scafford Gang Deluxe Enemy Pack and Dark Stone Brutes Enemy Pack, as well as the Resin Enemy Figures for Captain Burns and 'Ol’ One Eye' Jackson. Those Enemy Packs and resin Miniatures are NOT INCLUDED.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Defense Grid: Reclamation of Atavio
description:
In Defense Grid: The Board Game, a co-operative deck-building game based on the Defense Grid video game franchise, you and your fellow players must face off against waves and waves of aliens as you try to #ProtectTheCores. How you construct your deck for each mission is just as important as where you place your towers and which ones you choose to power each round.

Reclamation of Atavio is a Defense Grid: The Board Game campaign expansion consisting of 24 individual scenarios that are narratively and mechanically linked. The scenarios feature a couple of new mechanisms, such as tower unlocks, individual card rewards, Boss-Aliens, and specific map rules, in addition to narration from iconic characters of the computer game such as Fletcher, Cai, Rissler, and others in a novel (non-canon) tale within the lore of Defense Grid.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Harvesters Otherworld Threat Cards
description:
Available from the promotional box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2020.

- Harvesters - Belly of the Beast Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 488
- Harvesters - Forest of the Dead Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 489
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Trederran Raiders Otherworld Threat Cards
description:
Available from the promotional box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2020.

- Trederran Raiders - Belly of the Beast Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 490
- Trederran Raiders - Forest of the Dead Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 491
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Friendship Game
description:
Friends are at the heart of a good life – and what we want when we get together with them is an opportunity to share what is really going on inside us as well as the chance to hear about what has touched, moved or preoccupied them.

This is a game designed to get the very best out of our friendships. Played on a board with a dice and cards, it invites us to ask one another a series of kind but searching questions about our lives. The more honestly and clearly we answer, the faster we advance around the board. The winner of the game is the person who has best demonstrated that bedrock of true friendship: the capacity for sincere, kindly self-disclosure. The game is guaranteed to bring out new facets of our friends and will allow for a series of fascinating moments of revelation and mutual discovery.

The cards cover four categories:

Love
Work
Self
Family


Questions cover topics such as:

Have you ever been secretly a bit attracted to someone you probably shouldn’t have been? (Light)
Have you ever acted on this attraction? (Heavy)
Do you have a strong sense of right and wrong? (Light)
Have you ever violated your own moral code? (Heavy)
Have you ever complained about a colleague’s behaviour? (Light)
Has anyone complained about your own behaviour in the workplace? (Heavy)


—description from the publisher

In The Friendship Game, players score points by giving out information about themselves. Each turn, a player will roll the dice and move their pawn forward. Then, they get a question based on the location they landed on. They can choose to answer the light version of the question, the heavy version of the question, or neither. If they choose to answer the question, the other players will judge if the player has shared fully; if they feel this is the case, the player scores points.

The game ends when a player has reached the end of the track; the player who has scored the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Contains Game Board, 4 Sets of 24 Cards, 6 Wooden Counters, 1 Wooden Dice | 197 x 197 x 35mm | Instructions included | 3 - 6 Players | Suitable for 15 years +
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Chris, Leader of the Hunters
description:
The 2019 Event Exclusive for The Walking Dead is Chris, leader of the Hunters. Under Chris’ leadership, the Hunters have survived the horror of the new world by hunting the easiest prey — humans.

The 2019 The Walking Dead: All Out War Event Exclusive includes:

1 plastic miniature,
2 resin objectives
Chris Survivor Card
Webley WG army model, Gator Pro, Ka-bar combat knife, Flashlight, PCPs, Climbing gloves, Camo paint, and Jerry can Equipment Cards
"Stab" and "Dirty fighter" Veteran skill cards
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Fleet Battles: The Tholian Will – Rulebook: Captain's Module R4T
description:
Even more Tholian ships for you to use!

This 48-page rulebook includes dozens of new Tholian ships, some from their Home Galaxy M81 and some designed and built in this galaxy.

There are three broad categories:

First, there are Home Galaxy variants of ships you know and fear from the Milky Way versions seen in previous products.
Second, there is a full range of mission variants from two new hulls built in this galaxy: the Tholian destroyer (two police cutter hulls welded together side by side) and the Tholian War destroyer (one and a half police cutter hulls welded together end to end). These include carriers, escorts, commando ships, scouts, leaders, transports, and so many more.
Third, there are the ships the Tholians always wanted but had to do without until now! Now available is their legendary battleship in multiple refits, including carriers and stellar domination types. Find their long-missing heavy war destroyer with all of its modular variants. Also included are the fast raider variants of their cruisers and destroyer.


And there are many more!

It also has the following scenarios:

On the Holdfast Beat (Tholian and Klingon),
Recovery (Tholian and Orion pirates),
Wrong Enemy (Tholian and Andromedan), and
Reclamation (Tholian and Romulan).


Of course, it also has the section of the Master Ship Chart that pertains to the ships included.

This product describes additional ships for use in Star Fleet Battles.
To fly the ships, you will need the SFB Module R4T SSD Book in either B&W or color.
You must have the SFB Basic Set to utilize this material.
Some of the ships require the Advanced Missions set or the SFB Master Rulebook.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: VenomStrike Ballista XL Enemy
description:
Deadly artillery of the Serpentmen armies, the Venomstrike Ballista fires heavy bolts of wood, feather, and bone to skewer the opponents of the tribe!

1 XL Enemy, Cards and Rules.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Replantica
description:
A casual family game of spatial strategy, tree planting and animal rescue for all ages above 6.

In Replantica, you restore lost forest and rescue displaced animals. Players start by planting saplings, then water them to grow large trees. Special planting configurations on the playmat yield various bonuses for the players. Throughout the game, players must populate the new forest with animals and can win through a combination of clever strategy and lucky dice. The goal of the game is to be the first player to plant all your large trees and rehome all your rescued animals, one of which should be in your home habitat.

Replantica is produced entirely of natural materials (glass pebbles, wooden dice, canvas playmat, cotton drawstring bag for storage, cardboard and paper).

Every box of Replantica that is sold includes a donation to plant 10 real trees through reforestation charities.

—description from the publications
mechanics: Advantage Token, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Grid Coverage, Semi-Cooperative Game, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Aventuria: Begleiter #2 – Katzen Promopack
description:
This promo pack contains four cat companion cards and a rules card for companions:
Aranier
Cah ay Zhamorrah
Nuala
Scheunenkatz
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Aventuria: Alrik Immerdar Promopack
description: This promo pack contains the hero card, skill card, life point card, action card ("Magischer Flügelhelm") and deck construction card for Alrik.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Starframe: Event Horizon
description:
Starframe: Event Horizon combines resource management with tableau-building in this family-friendly Sci-Fi strategy game for 1-5 players.

While entrapped by a Black Hole, players will assemble and upgrade their own Starframe spaceship and enlist the help of cheat Droids to strategically combo time-critical actions that gather Hyper-Matter so that they may escape. But, be warned, until banked, Hyper-Matter is not safe from your thieving opponents.

Will you escape the Black Hole?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hexagon Grid

name: Hexenwood
description:
Deep in the Hexenwood, four powerful tree spirits fight an endless war to control the forest. Take control of one of these spirits, then engage in a strategic, turn based battle. By the end, one tree will come to dominate the forest - are you wise enough to prevail?

SETUP
First, build the forest with however many Blinks you’d like, and in any shape you want. The larger the forest, the longer the game will take. Below are some examples of typical setups for 12, 18, and 24 Blinks.

Once you’re happy with your setup, click any Blink to plant your starting Trees. Single click a Tree to change its species. Each player should choose a different species of Tree and a unique starting position on opposite ends of the forest. There are four species of tree, each with a unique color and leaf pattern.

Hexenwood is a very flexible game, and can be set up in many different ways. For instance, you can begin a game with each player having multiple starting Trees, or even with some players having more than others. This can be helpful for players with mismatched skill levels.

After you plant your starting trees, double-click any Blink to start the game. When mapping is complete, the game begins.

GAMEPLAY
Hexenwood is a turn-based game. The board will show which player’s turn it is by pulsing their Trees. If it is your turn, single-click one of your Trees to activate it. Only trees that can make valid moves can be activated.

When a Tree is activated, the board will display all of the moves it can make. There are two ways of moving: Spreading and Jumping.

SPREADING
Unclaimed positions adjacent to your Tree will be fully illuminated. If you click it, you will plant a Tree in that spot, and you will capture any neighboring Trees controlled by other players. This is the safest way to expand your territory.

JUMPING
Unclaimed positions that are one space away from your tree will show a bright pattern. If you click one of these Blinks, you can Jump to that spot. The Tree you jumped from will uproot itself and take over the new area, also capturing any neighboring Trees controlled by other players. This is a slightly risky way to expand because it leaves holes in your territory.

Once you’ve made your move, the game will automatically move to the next player’s turn. If a player has no Trees that can make a valid move, their turn will be skipped and the game will move to the next player immediately.

Importantly, you cannot rearrange the board during gameplay. If a Blink is removed from the field, the game will pause and the faces that are missing neighbors will flash. You must return them to their original positions to resume the game.

If at any point during the game you wish to restart and go back to setup, triple-click any Blink.

WIN CONDITION
When no players can make a valid move, or if there is only one player remaining with Trees in the forest, the game ends. The entire forest will flash white, then reveal the winning player. All Trees controlled by the winning player will flash rapidly, and all other Blinks will revert to an empty forest floor.
mechanics: Modular Board

name: Monster Bash
description:
Monster Bash is a light hearted card game where players try to be the first to play all their cards!

This classic monster themed game is a family friendly game that provides fun competition and simple mathematics!

Monster Bash is a simple game, the player who received the Slime Ball card is the first player and must play the Slime Ball card.

Each subsequent player, in clock-wise order, must play any number of cards equal to the next numerical value; 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and so on. Play continues until either one player has no cards left in their hand or a player cannot play the required numerical value. You cannot play more cards then what is needed to meet the required numerical value.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching

name: HEXplore It: The Sands of Shurax – Encounter Deck
description:
This Encounter Deck adds a new way to play The Sands of Shurax. All previously existing encounters from the Core Box, the Expansion, and the Living Card deck are reprinted with epic new art!

These decks add a new way to play the game by separating the Encounters into their own deck. Additionally, these encounters are not restricted to the volume they originally appeared in, allowing you to add and customize what encounters will appear in any volume you play.

Contents include:

Rules insert describing this new playstyle

33 Full art encounters

Boons offer new and increased rewards on the next Encounter you face!

Game Difficulty increase cards. Each deck will come with 3 Game Difficulty increase cards.

Conditions/Keyword list: Add conditions that appeared exclusively in certain volumes to any game.

Role variations: updated rules for the Roles who Summon Encounters

How do Boons work exactly?
Boons are newly introduced in Domain of Mirza Noctis. When you draw one of these from the Encounter deck, you’ll draw another card. If it is another Boon, you keep drawing. If the last card drawn is an Encounter, you’ll gain extra rewards after battle. If the card is not an Encounter(a difficulty increase for instance), you’ll shuffle the Boons back into the Encounter deck. Boons offer new and increased rewards!

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Ironmakers
description:
The heavily armored men of House Ironmaker often serve as the main center of an Ironborn force where a dedicated line is called for. Their thick scale armor over boiled leather allows them to withstand strong assaults and even cavalry charges. That said, their "heavy armor" is equivalent to the medium infantry of most landbound forces. But the Ironborn have always been a mobile force, and even this heavier version of their signature scale mail offers superior mobility. Used intelligently, the Ironmakers can even the odds against even the strongest enemies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: The Battle of the Denmark Strait: Fire at Sea – A WWII Naval Combat Game
description:
The Battle of the Denmark Strait is played for as many turns as it takes one side to win.

Each turn is divided into the following four phases:

Movement Phase: British first then German.
Shooting Phase: German shoots first then British. However shooting are considered to be simultaneous.
Damage Control Phase: damage ships attempt to repair.
Morale Phase: Ships that sustained hits on the current turn check morale. Broken morale ships try to recover.


Once the Morale Phase is completed, return to the Movement Phase and begin a new turn.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Simulation

name: Stellar Empire: Skirmish
description:
Stellar Empire is a 15 minute 2 player strategic card game, requiring critical thinking and clever bluffing.

You take the role of a fleet admiral, and your goal is to capture as many planets along your stellar border as you can with the expedition fleet at your disposal. Some planets along the border are more ideal than others, but even a barren rock can be mined for resources. You will lead either the Royal Expedition Force of the Wami Kingdom, or the 3rd Fleet of the Neupert Prefecture.

Each turn, the opposing fleets engage over one of the contested planets, and players select a vessel to engage. As the more powerful ship prevails, the system will join the victors stellar empire. If the ships fight to a draw, as they skulk away to lick their wounds, the following battles become more important, as the victor of the next battle will be able to lay claim to each system where combat was unresolved.

Once both players have exhausted their entire fleet, cooler heads will prevail and an armistice will be signed.

While both stellar empires may have made territorial claims, only the empire with the more worthwhile conquest can justify the skirmish and be called the victor!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: War Room: Nano-Expansion 'Take Her Down'
description:
20 chipboard tokens with 2 new rule systems:

DIVED SUBMARINES

The Dived Submarine side is used to mark Submarines that escaped combat by diving after they are returned to the World Map. These escaped dived subs can then avoid pinning and immediately move to an adjacent sea region.

CONVOY CASUALTIES

The Convoy Casualty side is used to mark sunk convoy ships on the Morale Board. Each sunk convoy is worth 6 casualty points.

—user summary
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Criminal and Chivatos
description:
Murder has occurred! The victim is inspected by a medical examiner while the National Police are called to the crime scene. The police do not know that the Criminal and the Guaremate "accomplice" is among them.

Someone saw the Criminal and the Guaremate at the crime scene. There is a snitch. You and your teammate must work together to reveal the identity of the imposters.

The theme of the game is about investigators and assassins. Where the murderers pose as police but there is a person who knows who the real criminals are.

The game is set in the daily life of the Dominican Republic. Where the weapons have names that the locals assign to them. The game has a heavy jargon used by the Dominicans.

There is a medical examiner who is on the side of the investigators and who can give clues to the investigators. The medical examiner can mark, in a folder, the state of the body, how hard the blow was, where the body suffered the attack, how quickly it died, what was the cause of death.

A player can accuse another player by selecting the weapon and place that the player think are correct. If the player fail then he lost he badge (and cannot accuse any other player).

The game can end in two ways, the first way is after three turns of accusation have passed. Second way is when Investigators find the weapon and the place where the murder occurred.

There are two teams, the team of police officers and investigators and the team of the murderer, his accomplice. The team of investigators wins if they find the weapon and the location of the murder. The teams of the murderer and accomplice win if after three rounds of accusations the investigator does not find the weapon and the place. Another winning condition for the killer team is if the killer finds out who the snitch is.
mechanics: Deduction, Traitor Game

name: Le storie della famiglia Emozioni
description:
The Emotions family loves to tell stories. Every night, little Joy and her sister Sadness get together with uncle Anger, uncle Fear and their cousin Disgust and tell each other wonderful stories: can you guess which story each of them is telling? Beware: if you attribute the story to the wrong narrator, the Emotions family may take offence and... make you lose the game!

A game for the whole family, who have to work together to guess which of the tales depicted on the playing cards is being told by a different member of the Emotions family.
The active player draws an Emotion card and must decide which of the five Fairy Tale cards in play best represents it, voting for it in secret. The other players confront each other and try to guess which card has been chosen.
The aim of the game is to finish all the Emotion cards without ever choosing a Fairy Tale card marked with a Flame.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Robot Boxing League
description:
An arena fighting deck builder in a world where robots have replaced human boxers. Choose one of six characters each with unqiue themes, abilities, and starting decks. When you pick your fighter select one of 5 game modes to play in ranging from solo up to a three vs three mode.

The game is divided into two phases the battle and market phases. During the battle phase you play cars at the same time as your opponent. These can range from dealing damage, moving your robot, or blocking your opponent. Once each player has no more cards to play it goes to the Market Phase.

During the market phase you gain credits used to buy from or alter the market. Use your credits to add more cards to your deck, Upgrade your robot, or clean the market.

During gameplay you can earn titles to gain more credits or other bonuses. Don't fret if you get to zero health. Each robot can reboot and continue the fight. Be wary though each reboot has negative consequences on your robot.

Will you be the next RBL Champion?
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Great Decisive Battle: The Campaign of Huaihai, 1948-1949
description:
Xuzhou. This city has always been a battleground for strategists. In the past two thousand years, 158 bloody battles have been recorded in history.

In November 1948, a decisive battle of unprecedented scale was about to break out. The number of troops participating in the war exceeded that at any time in the past. The total number of troops invested by the Kuomintang and the Communist Party reached 1.4 million. Compared with other wars in history, it is really not worth it.

With regard to this decisive battle, the strategic objectives of the two sides are different, and they also have two different names. The Kuomintang's expectation of the campaign was that the whole army would guarantee the lifeline of the railway from Xuzhou to Bengbu on the Jinpu line, so it was named "Xubeng battle". Su Yu's plan is to attack Haizhou first and then win the two criteria. Therefore, our side is called "Huaihai Campaign".

In this decisive battle to determine the fate of a country and a nation, the Kuomintang army invested more than 800000 people and the people's Liberation Army invested 600000 people. In the end, 600 thousand destroyed the 800 thousand. Over the years, the war history textbooks of military academies in various countries have called this campaign a "classic war example" and studied it as a major topic. Generation after generation of professional soldiers of different nationalities, different skin colors and different political beliefs are no strangers to this war case. What makes people deeply interested is its process. How did the 600000 people with inferior military strength and equipment defeat the 800000 people with superior military strength and equipment.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Revolution & Reaction: The Spanish Civil War, 1930-39
description:
Revolution & Reaction: The Spanish Civil War, 1930-39 is a two-player wargame, depicting the political and military conflicts in Spain between 1930 and 1939. In the game, one player controls the Republican forces (consisting of liberals, socialists, communists and anarchists), and the other controls the Nationalists (consisting of the Falangist and Carlist factions).

Players not only fight each other, but must manage and coordinate their own political and military factions. The loyalty of your factions to the cause is never certain!

The game system adapts the key mechanics of Matt Calkin's Sekigahara game (2011, GMT). Players receive a hand of cards each turn which are used to play for the actions, and to deploy game pieces into battle. In Revolution & Reaction, there is a political phase, in which players try to gain political control of the various areas of Spain by placing influence blocks; in the military phase, players move their units and start combats in locations on the board (towns cities). Blocks and cards are hidden from the other player, so the opponent's true political and military strength is only know in struggle.

The game includes diplomacy and elections, special units (such as the International Brigades), and rules to simulate the outbreak of war, giving the game a strong connection to the real history of the Spanish Civil War.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Vilitum
description:
“Ah, Vilitum! Of my discoveries in the strange land that is Camria, this has been my most treasured! An elegant game of strategy and wit. A game of kings and peasants alike."

Vilitum is an abstract strategy game for 2 players. Each player controls an army of 5 unique units. If you defeat all of your opponent's units, or if they surrender, you win!

On each turn a player may move and/or attack with 1 piece. If a piece receives enough damage, it is removed from the board. Each unit has a unique combination of movement, attack range, and special ability.

For younger players, or for your first game, a simplified rule set gets players use to the basics, and adding in the advance rules opens the DEEP strategy of Vilitum.

Adding in the Soldier Expansion gives each player a new unit. Each player now has a pair of soldiers, that while having the lowest life, are tough, and if they are adjacent, deal extra damage.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Variable Set-up

name: ALFA-TAU
description:
This volume presents the rules of one of the first real wargames developed in Italy. At first it was played at the A.R.G.O. (Roman Association of Operative Games) and then, in the '70s, it was slowly presented, piece by piece, on the defense magazine Esercito e Armi - Interconair. At last it was published as a book by the Italian editor Mursia that had a series of book dedicated to adult gaming.
The game reproduces, at operational level, the clashes for the control of a sea zone. The players control ships and planes that are clearly the transposition of the class of planes that were available in the '70s. By reading the rules it is clear that the creator was a navy staff officer, you don't have any real nation but you lead hypothetical nations. With the book was supplied a map representing the contended sea zone.

—user summary

Il presente volume costituisce la prima trattazione organica e completa apparsa sinora in Italia sulla simulazione dei conflitti aeronavali di epoca contemporanea, in ambiente prevalentemente strategico.
Il testo affronta praticamente tutti gli aspetti di una guerra aeronavale sia dal punto di vista strategico sia da quello tattico ambientando gli avvenimenti in un'area geografica ipotetica, in modo da non conferire eccessiva complicazione al gioco: ciò, peraltro, non ne riduce la validità per quanto riguarda gli aspetti tecnico-dottrinali relativi all'inpiego delle forze aeronavali e delle risorse dei belligeranti.
L'opera - per la sua struttura, per la complessità e la varietà delle situazioni che possono essere riprodotte, per la maturità e le conoscenze richieste ai giocatori - si rivolge essenzialmente al pubblico degli adulti; tuttavia, con un minimo di guida iniziale, è possibile effettuarne un'adeguata reinterpretazione e un adattamento che lo rendano agevole e gradevole anche al pubblico dei giovani.

—description from the cover
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Simulation, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Impro Tuhmat K18-kortit
description:
Outrageous party game for adults.
In the IMPRO® 18+ card game, the players dive into the naughty minds of themselves and their friends in four categories. In addition of the card deck, paper and pens for all players are needed. Game is prepared by mixing the cards and placing the deck on the table.

Player in turn picks up the top card of the deck and proceeds according to the category rules. The category depicts how the player will execute the card: verbally, artistically, using their body language, facial expressions, or their wild imagination.

Winner is the one who reaches 15 points first. The game can be played in teams also.

This game can be integrated with Impro: hullunhauska seurapeli.

—description from publisher (translated)


Hävyttömän hauska seurapeli aikuisille.
IMPRO® K18-korttipelissä sukelletaan neljän kategorian kautta oman ja kavereiden tuhman mielen syövereihin. Korttien lisäksi tarvitset kynän ja paperia jokaiselle pelaajalle sekä ajastimen. Peli valmistellaan sekoittamalla korttipakka ja asettamalla korttipakka pöydälle.

Pelin aloittaa nuorin pelaaja, minkä jälkeen vuoro vaihtuu myötäpäivään kiertäen. Pelivuorossa oleva pelaaja valitsee korttipakan päällimmäisen kortin ja toimii kategorian määrittämien ohjeiden mukaisesti. Riippuen kategoriasta, pelaaja suorittaa kortin verbaaliikan, taiteellisuuden, kehonkielen, kasvojen ilmeiden tai villin mielikuvituksen avulla.

Pelin voittaa se, joka saa ensimmäisenä 15 pistettä. Peliä voidaan pelata myös joukkuepelinä.

Tämä peli voidaan integroida lautapeliin Impro: hullunhauska seurapeli.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Communication Limits, Line Drawing, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Storytelling, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Undergrowth: A Tunnel Crawling Quest
description:
Undergrowth: A Tunnel Crawling Quest is a Euro-inspired American-style strategy game for 2-4 players set underground in an old woodland. Players assemble a gang of local Dwellers with different talents (your gang tableau) and move through ancient tunnels hunting treasures and other rare finds. Treasures can be stashed for victory points or used to boost capabilities (movement, carrying load, health, dueling skill and gang recruitment) and activate tools. Treasure also hires you Dwellers for your gang. As your gang grows your capabilities also grow. As you travel deeper into the tunnel labyrinth, the going gets harder. Blessings from the Green Man God aid your quest, but the murderous Weasels will stop at nothing to prevent you getting your hands on treasure.

Undergrowth is a tableau building game with mixed, interacting mechanics where the aim is to assemble the most skillful, most renowned and wealthiest treasure hunting gang. The winning player has the highest value card tableau and the most stashed gold at the end of 12 rounds. The game combines point to point movement, resource management, tableau building, dice combat and a hint of push your luck to produce a fun, adventurous and interactive tunnel crawling treasure hunt. Players have thinky dilemmas and interesting tactical choices. Deploy your tunnellers, move them through the tunnels, seek and find different treasures, avoid obstacles, interact with opponents, build your gang and grow your wealth and local reputation. Recruit new gang members from the local Inn and pay their cost to add them to your gang, then use their immediate or ongoing skills to become the dominant treasure hunting gang.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Income, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Command Lance
description: The Inner Sphere Command Lance includes the iconic Marauder, Archer, Valkyrie, and Stinger - no assembly required! - along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike Action!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: BattleTech: Alpine/Grasslands Battlemat
description:
Each map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes a never-before published map for one of the following terrain:


Desert
Lunar
Alpine
Savannah


The secondary side also includes brand-new maps—designed to be used together—as featured in the soon-to-release BattleTech Map Pack: Grasslands. Each of the four BattleMast displays a unique Grasslands map on the back.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Rafty Ride
description:
You wake up on a desolate island, your clothes are soaked & the last thing you remember is looking out your ships’ deck as a storm tossed it about in the ocean. Far to the east of the island, you see your cargo of colourful rafts gently nudging the shore. The adventurer in you awakens!

On your turn each player gets 3 actions: Dice Roll, Path Bending and Movement. Based on the colours rolled on the first action the player can choose rafts for the next action where they place and remove rafts from anyones path. The player can either move free to a raft of the same colour or roll a Draft to move to a raft of another colour. Attack other players by rolling any colour doubles and skip a raft on double draft.

Create your own path by building, breaking & jumping across the colourful rafts to make your way back to the Shore. The first player to reach shore wins the game!

Roll the dice to test your luck in this sweet and brutal game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Generic Board "Square" Set
description: A set of a board and pieces for unspecified abstract strategy games. The board is printed on both sides and corresponds to the six sizes common in classic abstract games. As appendixes, it comes with the rules for five games in the public domain, Konane, Fox and Hounds, Tafl, Halma, Turkish Checkers, and author's original game Mabi, which can be played on this board.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Pandemonium Estate
description:
Pandemonium Estate is an Otherworldly, Thematic Adventure board game for 2-5 players. Pandemonium Estate takes place in an interdimensional mansion that exists between world and time. The heart of the mansion, the Verge Portal, consumes objects and people from the many worlds it visits, trapping them in the mansion against their will.

Players can choose to play one of three full-length, replayable thematic Storyline modes as one of eight playable characters with their own unique Traits. Regardless of the chosen Storyline, players must complete various tasks in order to gain enough Essence (Victory Points) to return to their home world.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Take That, Victory Points as a Resource

name: BattleTech: Strana Mechty Battlemat
description:
Every Warrior can make the pilgrimage back to the Clan Homeworlds to fight on sacred land. This neoprene map is a double-sized 22" x 36" battlefield. One half of a giant "Circle of Equals" for Grand Melee battles on the first side, while the reverse side is the Bloody Basin, Lechenka District (from the Battletech novel Prince of Havoc). A rules booklet for the maps is also included.

Strana Mechty Battlemat was an unlockable stretch goal for the 2019 Clan Invasion crowdfunding campaign, which ran from 18 July 2019 to 18 August 2019.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition

name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Uncle Al's Upgrade Pack
description: This expansion for Car Wars (Sixth Edition) adds 186 cards; 45 per player color, plus 6 checkpoint cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race

name: Spellcaster: The Frostgrave Magazine #7
description:
Spellcaster: The Frostgrave Magazine exists to bring new rules, scenarios, and gaming ideas for players of Frostgrave and Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago.
This issue contains:

The Diamonds of Elias Skull, a 3-scenario campaign for Ghost Archipelago.
The Maze of Malcor Outtakes, including 1 scenario and 10 weird events.
The Floating Hulk, a solo scenario for Ghost Archipelago.
The Great Wyrm, a Frostgrave ‘big game’ campaign by Brent Sinclair, 3-scenarios leading to an encounter with a dragon!
Rules for a new character, the Archer, in Barbarian Hack.
Casting Roll Criticals in Frostgrave for Second Edition.
16 Ulterior Motive Cards for Ghost Archipelago.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress – XL Living Statue Miniature + Exclusive EPIC Threat
description:
These can be used for the different types of Living Statue (Stone, Wood, and Metal) and can allow you to fight Epic battles against multiple Living Statues.

This expansion contains:
- 1 XL Living Statue Miniature
- 1 Epic Threat Card - Temple Guardians (2 Living Statues) - Promo 409

Card Text:
Draw an Enemy Trait card for both Living Statues
Fighting Pair: While either of these Statues has less than 10 wounds on it, both Statues are +1 combat
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Red Dragon Inn: One Thousand Cranes Promo Card
description:
SlugFest Games promo prize card for donation to Extra Life 2020!

Text on the card:

One Thousand Cranes
Prize
The next time you ante, add this card to the Prize Bin. You may reveal any number of Gambling and/or Cheating Cards from your hand. For each card you reveal in this way, gain 1 Fortitude.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel Battleworld: Treachery at Twilight Talon Fighter
description: This expansion adds a new playable character, Black Panther 2099, and the Talon Fighter, a game piece that moves around the board and changes the way characters perform battles.
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: La Sagrada Familia (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
This is a fan expansion created by the non-profit association Carcassonne.cat. It was created with the purpose of having a seal inside the Carcassonne’s community and was given as a gift in the 2018-2019 catalan’s league of Carcassonne.

The expansion consists of a tile of the ‘Sagrada Familia’. When it appears in the game, should be played normally placing it where the player wants. Since from that moment on, the enlarged city with the Sagrada Familia tile no may be closed throughout the game, but it will be possible to expand with more city ​​tiles while never closing the city ​​with the Sagrada Familia.

Exception 1: In the case that the placement of the Sagrada Familia tile closes a city, that city will have 0 points and the meeples will return to the corresponding players.

Exception 2: In the case that the Sagrada Familia tile can’t be validly placed anywhere on the board, this tile will be returned to the box and will not come into play again during this game. The player in turn takes another tile from the pile in order to do his turn normally.

At the end of the game, the city with the Sagrada Familia tile will be counted as an incomplete city following the usual scoring rules.
If any other tile taken during the game can only be placed in the city with the Sagrada Familia tile closed, this tile is removed from the game and the player in turn takes another tile in order to do his turn normally.

Variant: In this variant the city that contains the tile of the Sagrada Familia yes can be closed normally but in this case it will count 0 points and the meeples will remain blocked until the end of the game. So be careful not to close the city if you have meeples inside and try to make it as big as possible to avoid it
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: The Warp: Culpa Bookmakers
description:
The Culpa Bookmakers were selected by the Kickstarter backers as an exclusive alien for the campaign.

They can be used in 3 different ways:

Player alien
Exiled forces
Warp Guardian


Their power introduces betting on the result of any combat during the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Civilization, Miniatures, Negotiation, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Grimspire, Intrafin Games, Jumping Turtle Games

name: Titan: The E-Team
description:
Expand your operations with this 5th player expansion which takes Titan’s levels of player interaction even further. The race intensifies with the arrival of an additional competitor as you compete to be the first to complete Objectives, fulfil Planetary Orders, exploit Rigs and reach Titan’s treasure filled core…

Includes everything you need to play with a 5th player!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Shhnable Wabble
description:
Shhnable Wabble is a 3-10+ player, family-friendly acting game, made for ages 8 and up, bringing up to ten players together acting in a series of fun scenes from all across the galaxy.

In Shhnable Wabble players earn points by both acting if guessed correctly, while non-acting players attempt to deduce their hidden cards acted in scene for points too.
Bonus points are spontaneously on offer by playing Director’s Cut cards on to a live scene delivering outrageous demands mid-scene making, Shhnable Wabble the most excellent acting game in the galaxy.

With more voting time than acting, Shhnable Wabble creates the night’s experience by offering points for all players in every single scene. The player with the most points at the ends wins Dr Shhnable challenge and is the next rising star of the galaxy.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Voting

name: Panzer Dice 2: Last Battle
description:
Second part of the succesful solitaire Roll and Write game, Panzer Dice: Eastern Front, Panzer Dice 2: Last battle! takes you to the battle of Berlin. You no longer have to fight in the Russian steppe but in the streets of a burning city.

Berlin, summer of 1945. The Red Army are at the gates of the city. It’s the last battle. Streets are yet full of Wehrmacht soldiers and SS fanatics defending each building, resisting in each corner with their last artillery units.

You are a Squad of a T-34 Tank and nine Infantry soldiers with on a special mission delivered by Gueorgui Zhùkov in person. If your Squad reaches the goal with at least one alive Infantry soldier you have completed the mission.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Batman Who Laughs Rising: Bobo Promo Card
description:
This promo replaced the Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle promo in the Pack E for the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

The card powers read as follows:

Bobo: If you are in The Batman Who Laughs' location you may remove one counter from the Dark Knights Track.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Batman Who Laughs Rising: Raven Promo Card
description:
This promo replaced the Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle promo in the Pack E for the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

The card powers read as follows:

Raven: If you are in The Batman Who Laughs' location you may remove two damage from 1 Hero.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Hack Attack Wooden Edition
description:
