With Hack Attack you will think again and again before placing a tile. A game with various strategies to connect or separate paths.

Depending on the role you get, your mission will be to connect or prevent the connection between the hacker computer and the internet. Will you be able to handle such a simple yet complicated task?
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: War of Conquest
description:
The Seven Years' War on a global scale in two volumes. An operational level hex & counter wargame. The first volume, "War of Conquest", covers central Europe. The second volume, "War of Conquest: The Wider World", expands the game to the rest of the world. This is a two player wargame, but if you wish to play in two teams you can, dividing your assets as you see fit. The game can also be played solitaire because, although it uses cards, it is not ‘card driven’ as such.

The base game includes an A1 map of Middle Europe and features unit counters for all those that fight in the main European theatre of war at a regiment or brigade scale. The Wider World expansion adds four more A2 sized maps for Maritime Europe, Latin America, North America, and India, plus extensive named naval units, and numerous colonial units. The Wider World expansion adds naval rules including rules for movement between theatres of war. For the most ambitious players the expansion also includes the Global Grand Campaign that stitches together all theatres of war providing the ultimate bird’s eye view of a world at war.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: My Best Chef
description:
My Best Chef is a multi-action card game that earns resources by efficiently working more than 50 types of staff working in restaurants.

As the restaurant manager, your goal is to gather the resources to hire staff, get more resources by working them, hire better staff and create a highly regarded restaurant.

The staff are all unique cards.
Cards that can be adopted range from cooking staff, including chefs who cook food at restaurants, to staff who provide the necessary customer service, purchasing, and recruitment for the store, and staff who manage disposal.

The main point of this game is to collect resources in cooperation with the staff of each department.

Another point is the "disposal token".

This represents the garbage (waste) of the ingredients that are generated when the staff works at the restaurant. Care must be taken as overworking and accumulating waste will damage the restaurant's reputation, resulting in loss of ratings and dismissal of staff.

In order to solve these problems, it is necessary to hire management staff to dispose of waste and keep the store clean.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ultimate Treehouse
description:
Ultimate Treehouse is a game of building and strategy for ages 7 and up.

Each player starts with a beautiful blank tree mat and builds a treehouse full of fun classics. The first one to have 6 elements in their treehouse wins. Player on player cards allow you to slow down your opponents, helper cards will allow you advantages and disaster cards may slow you down.

On your turn you draw cards and then can do one of three actions; build, play a card or draw again. To build you use material cards from your hand like lumber, nails and metal to build parts of the treehouse. The game ends when you have 6 elements in your treehouse- 3 required elements and any other three you choose.
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That

name: Monumental Consequence
description:
In the role-play-based negotiation game Monumental Consequence, players take the roles of townsfolk of La Ville, whose church has been taken over by an invading army. Do you risk your lives to attack the church to save the art — or bomb it?

Similar to social deduction games, each player has a designated role, with victory conditions associated with it. Players negotiate and vote to settle on a decision. If the vote is inconclusive, a dice-rolling mechanism is used to complicate the scenario and start a new round. Play continues until one side has enough votes, then a final die roll determines the winner and the consequences of that choice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Voting
publishers: Center for Learning Through Games and Simulations, Central Michigan University Press

name: Elerion: het bordspel
description: In this narrative adventure game, players must work together as they slog through cities, wilderness, dungeons and caves. However, watch out for the hidden agendas of fellow players. The characters that survive the game can come back in the next adventure and you can even string together a whole series of scenarios. There is even the option to write new screenplays yourself. The future is uncertain!
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Move Through Deck, Moving Multiple Units, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Txek Card Game
description:
Pronouce Txek as "check", a reference to our origins: Basque Country across France and Spain.

This is a card game where each player has cards they can - and can't see. The goal of the game is to be the first to discard all your cards by matching the cards on the discard pile. But other players can use special cards to stop you along the way.

Similar game play to UNO but you can't see all your hand at once.
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Take That

name: BattleTech: Interstellar Operations – Alternate Eras
description:
Primitive Units. QuadVees. Superheavy 'Mechs. Weapons of Mass Destruction. Robotic and Drone Systems. Land-Air BattleMechs.

As you delve into BattleTech lore, additional weapons, units and rules become available to you and your forces as you fight in the Dark Age, Jihad, or even the depths of the Star League Eras, and all the way back into the Age of War before the birth of the BattleMech.

Alternate Eras introduces a huge swath of rules for playing across the thousand years of BattleTech history, including weapons and equipment mostly unique to a given era.

Note: The original publication of Interstellar Operations had rules for large scale BattleTech play (Strategic BattleForce, Abstract Combat System, and Inner Sphere at War) which can now be found in the Interstellar Operations: BattleForce.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dragonborne
description:
Dragonborne is a solitaire fantasy wargame played with a narrative campaign. The player assumes the role of the titular Dragonborne: a person who is psychically bonded to an ancient biological war machine known as a Dragon. Together, the Dragon and rider confront a series of enemies human, mechanical and monstrous in tactical battles of resource and position management on their journey to fulfil their destiny.

This is a pure solitaire game. All enemy activity is regulated by an automata controlled by a single die roll per turn and answering a few questions. There are 29 different opponents included, each presenting their own strengths and weaknesses for the player to discover and overcome. Each battle is connected to the next by a story, and the player's resources are persistent from one fight to the next so thinking ahead is critical. Depending on the player's performance, they will end up playing one of three branching campaign paths, each with their own different opponents.

As the story progresses, the Dragon will evolve, gaining new powers and abilities randomly or as directed by the player along an evolutionary tree. There are 60 different evolutionary powers to choose from and combine, allowing for a huge range of strategies. You may end up with a massive, heavily-armoured Dragon able to absorb incoming attacks and retaliate using the attacker's own energy, a swift, nimble Dragon that outmaneuvers it's opponents before finishing them with precision attacks, an offensive powerhouse that rends it's enemies to pieces with jaw and tail, or a shamanistic monster that uses magic and the elements to overcome adversaries.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Obscure Battles 3: Drone Commander
description:
In Obscure Battles Volume 3 – Drone Commander, the player takes the role of a Drone Operator trying to locate and destroy enemy assets using one of the Drone Types available to player.

Unlike the other Obscure Battle Series this game is exclusively solitaire: you don’t need any other player to play the game.

Using the game rules and supplied drone, loadout, target and threat cards you can design your own drone missions !
When loading your drone, you can choose from the current set of available loadouts. Once you are airborne you also have to keep an eye on the important items such as fuel and comms and also making sure that you are not shot out of the sky.

Game comes with 2 Drones and their loadouts you can use. More drone types and loadouts are provided as part of the optional packs.

A Milk run Scenario and one U.N. peacekeeping action sample campaign is included and more is to be released along as Scenario Packs based on the current event).

Your targets are selected from a different decks of cards such VIPs figures such as Terror leaders, Warlords, Several Tank Types, Camoufledged Bunkers to take with earth penetrators, Trucks and SAMS to shoot with smart ammo using the option base and the optional extension packs provided.

Your drone will not be safe out there: there are several "well known figures" such as S400, Pantsir, Shilka, TOR, BUK, OSA SAMs, Igla and Stinger MANPADs, archaic ZU-23 Guns and even small arms (some of them are supplied on extension packs).

Your Drone can suffer malfunctions, or shot at by different threat vectors such as AA Guns,MANPADs, SAMs, Fighter Jets or even Laser guns such as Nazar...
mechanics: Movement Template

name: Blood Bowl: Norse Team – Norsca Rampagers
description:
Nordic teams love a good fight above all else - and that's certainly what they do best on the field! The Nordiques spend their entire lives in the cold north, which makes them very tough. These hardened players excel at scrimmaging, making blocks in all directions as they punch their way into the end zone - and presumably the tavern just beyond!

Of course, it's not just about causing a midfield brawl; there's also that crucial detail of scoring touchdowns. The Nordic teams work best when they can use their generous fighting skills to punch a hole in the opponent's defense, so that their Valkyries can use their impressive speed to get through and win.

This kit consists of 120 plastic pieces with which you can assemble the Norsca Rampagers, a Nordic team to use in your Blood Bowl matches. The team consists of 6 Norse Raider Linemen, 2 Beer Boar, 2 Norse Berserkers, 2 Ulfwereners and 2 Valkyries. It also includes 2 double-sided Blood Bowl pieces, 2 turn and raise counters, 4 balloons, and a sheet of 292 decals.

These figures come unpainted and require assembly.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Miao Bau Ciao
description:
Three discs representing cat, dog and child are placed on the table.

Then an arrow is turned and you have to be the fastest player to put your hand on the right puck and also say the corresponding word.

So if the arrow points to the dog, you need to say BAU and put your hand on the dog's disc. If the cat comes out you have to say HELLO and put your hand on the cat. Simple isn't it?

What if we told you that there are also bonuses and penances?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: How to Lose a Guy in One DM
description: Finally, a game that makes fun of all the cringiest, weirdest, most awful behavior soooo many of us have dealt with in online dating. It's simple and hilarious: a Judge reads aloud the dude's profile and then deals out 3 of his texts sliding into your DMs later and later at night getting angrier or more desperate or cringier.... and the other players "Clapback with their funniest response. Players can choose whether to share a creative defense of why their response is BEST or just read aloud their best reply in the sassiest voice possible!
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge
publishers: Flying Leap Games, Spite House Studios

name: The Lantern Issue One
description:
The Lantern, issue 1, is a zine for the Four Against Darkness solo RPG.

Issue 1 includes:

Tumbarr, the Curse of the Unliving ones (adventure)
The Lair of the Four-Headed Hydra (adventure)
Four Against the Goblin King (adventure)
Den of the Man-Wolves (adventure)
The Sea King's Orcas (faction)
Two new monsters, 1 new spells and 4 new magic items.

The first print run included two personalized pages by Four Against Darkness creator Andrea Sfiligoi. One included an ink sketch and another a personalized rule that the owner of the zine is allowed to use in the game. These were different in every copy, so no two copies of the zine were exactly the same.

Reprints, without the custom drawn pages, are available on the web.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tank Duel: Tank Pack #2
description:
Tank Duel Tank Pack #2: The Eastern Front adds a wide variety of German and Soviet vehicles to the acclaimed Tank Duel System, from the early war Panzer 38(t) to the monster ISU-122 M44 and Jagdpanther. In addition to new vehicles, Tank Pack #2 includes new scenarios covering the Battle of Brody, Stalingrad, Kursk, and more. Even better, Tank Pack #2 comes with a mini-campaign, where the outcome of each scenario affects the next. All scenarios follow the format from Tank Pack #1 and North Africa, so they are quick to set up and have streamlined scenario rules so you can play immediately. And of course, all the scenarios support true solitaire play with the Robata system.

Tank Pack #2 can be combined with Tank Duel: North Africa as well as Tank Pack #1, and multiple sets can be combined to create an endless variety of matchups.

The Scenarios in Tank Pack #2 use the new Infantry rules and AT Guns introduced in the North Africa expansion. To play these scenarios, you will need a copy of Tank Duel: Enemy in the Crosshairs with these new rules and guns integrated via one of the following:
Tank Duel Second Edition
Tank Duel Update Kit
Tank Duel North Africa
The Free Print and Play Update Kit

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cães POP
description:
In Cães POP - Battle for Likes players are gathering likes playing pop dogs card's as internet influencers to gain followers.

In the start of the game, players get 3 cards. In each turn, the player must discard a card to do an action, and take cards until reach 3 cards on hand.

Actions:


Receive a Like: If playing dogs cards that is on focus.
Change focus: If playing dogs card's that doesn't is on focus
Do some especial effect: If playing cat cards.


When you reach 5 likes Token or more, you can exchange immediately 5 likes Tokens to 1 Follower Token.

When one player reach 2 likes (3 in 4 players, 4 in 3 players, 5 in 2 players) this player win.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet - T34-85
description:
Wave 7

1:100 Scale

World of Tanks Miniatures Game is an easy to learn, quick play game, where you take command of a unit of tanks, seeking to destroy your opponent and secure victory! All the models in World of Tanks come ASSEMBLED, PAINTED, and BATTLE READY!

The Russian T-34-85 is a great all-rounder Medium tank with solid stats and Mobility 3, making it ideal for brawling it out with other tanks. Being a Medium Tank means it can re-roll a blank Attack die to ensure consistent damage. Keep the base Firepower 5 or pair it with the 122mm T-11 gun to give the T-34-85 High Explosive, this iconic tank is a force to be reckoned with on the tabletop. Additional upgrades include Extended Turret (+1 Initiative), Turbocharger (+3 Initiative during Movement Phase for Medium Tanks), Snap Shot (+2 Initiative during the Shooting Phase) and Commander Nikita Ovsyanniko.

Plastic components.

Contents:
1 Miniature
‣ T-34-85 Tank
1 Tank Card
5 Upgrade Cards
Online Bonus Code for New & Existing Players
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Set-up

name: O Grande Colecionador de Brinquedos
description:
You are a collector of toys from the 60s to the 90s, specialized in toys sold by Estrela in Brazil.
Each round you will acquire 2 new toys for your collection, one by draft and another by auction.
The auction takes place in several auction houses simultaneously, but each player can only bid once and only in one auction house.
After the bids are revealed, the winners receive their toys and the losers have to choose between the remaining toys.
After a certain amount of rounds, each player's collection is evaluated. Each toy scores points in a different way, enhancing combos between them.
The player with the most valuable collection is the winner.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Closed Drafting, Constrained Bidding, Set Collection

name: Malevaje
description:
Malevaje is a game for 1 to 4 players, where brave Malevos from the "hundred neighborhoods of Buenos Aires" face each other for prestige. Simple mechanics of fights through a Duel Deck from which the players will choose the Attack, Team or Action cards to use or discard, making the most of it. Fights full of adrenaline where with a lot of cunning and a little luck you will lead your Malevos to be the most respected and powerful.

During the game, you will confront your fighter against the opponent. Each fighter has strong and weak defense in 3 parts of the body (head, body and lower parts), health (measured in feathers) and a reputation that the player offers in the fight to the player who wins.

The player will also receive 5 "clever" tokens that can be used to avoid some of the cards during the game.

All players play on the same deck that has different attacks, actions and equipment. Then, during his turn, while drawing cards, will decide if to play an attack card, an action card or take equipment.

The game will be defined into rounds (those depend on the number of players) and will the one that wins the most "respect" summing up the rounds.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event

name: La Battaglia di Pavia
description:
One of the many wargames designed by Guido Crepax for his own pleasure, featuring his beautiful paper soldiers. Published in the pages of the Italian Linus magazine in 1967-1969. Unfortunately the publication was never finished and the complete game remains unpublished to this day.

This game takes a more frivolous approach than Waterloo and combines Crepax's passions in colorful uniforms and in beautiful women, as immediately apparent from the gorgeous game board.

Women play an important part, and vivandieres, courtesans and spies can influence the fates of the battle. Moreover, mercenaries are unreliable and at risk of switching sides.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Square Grid

name: Boston Massacre
description:
Boston Massacre is a 5-10 player game of deception, hidden identity and battle of wits. With cunning play, weapon mastery and influence, you will seek to win the Revolution either as a Patriot or Redcoat. Benedict Arnold, a spy for the Redcoats, may steal a victory from the Patriots if he can gain enough trust.

Summary of Gameplay: 1). Players are randomly given player cards (Patriot, Redcoat or Benedict). 2). Everyone closes their eyes and the Redcoats and Benedict open their eyes to see each other; 3). Then the game begins along with a full on war of deceit, persuasion and cunning weapon play. 4). The first team to win 5 battles wins the game. 5). Benedict should remain discreet through the process. If revealed to be a Redcoat spy they compromise their chance for an early Redcoat Victory!

—description from the designer
categories: American Revolutionary War, Deduction, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Tank Chess: Monster
description: Additional Monster pieces for Tank Chess. It comes with its own rules.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Godtear: Kailinn, The Fury of the Forest
description:
"Kailinn changed when she was Chosen. Imbued with the wild rage of nature, the fierce champion bears little resemblance to the demure acolyte she once was. A pair of Virtues follow her - druid warriors of her order, charged with protecting their tragic sister on her path to godhood."

Fast, furious, and fantastic at assassinating enemy followers before they can flee, Kailinn is a Maelstrom champion with a maelstrom attitude. No champion can match her speed as she canters across the battlefield with reckless abandon. Watch out for her wicked-sharp horn — it’s made for skewering followers of any size!

This expansion for Godtear adds 1 new maelstrom champion, along with its 2 large followers, 1 banner, and 3 cards with statistics and abilities.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Death Battletome – Nighthaunt
description:
From Shyish, the Realm of Death, come the ethereal Nighthaunt – terrifying spectres driven to murder by their bitter hatred for the living. These undead are the terror weapon of the Great Necromancer, united under the cruelest and most tortured rulers ever to die. Their cold grasp reaches across the Mortal Realms, spreading a paralysis of fear amongst the living souls they once called kin, a howling host that will leave only an endless landscape of corpses and wailing spirits remains.

Within these pages you’ll find everything you need to know to command the deathless hosts of the Nighthaunt in your games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar, and discover their place in the Mortal Realms. Read the abundant and sorrowful history of these tortured souls, explore the haunted empire of the amethyst underworlds, and delve into the spectral processions that drag souls into Nagash's iron grip.

This 96-page hardback book contains:


A musty catacomb of background information on the Nighthaunt, including their history, relationship with Nagash, and spectral culture
Sinister yet breathtaking artwork that conveys the grim majesty of the Nighthaunt
31 warscrolls and pitched battle profiles for ghostly warriors, from swarming Chainrasps to new heroes like the Scriptor Mortis and Awlrach the Drowner
Rules for 4 distinct Nighthaunt Processions, plus command traits, artefacts of power, spells, and battle traits like Aura of Dread and Frightful Touch
Path to Glory campaign rules that allow you to spread the pall of Death by haunting the Mortal Realms, plus 7 warscroll battalions for use in narrative play
Matched play content including 4 grand strategies and 6 battle tactics to unleash against your enemies
A showcase of morbid Nighthaunt miniatures assembled in the colours of their Processions, alongside guides on how to paint them yourself


Also included is a sheet of 28 tokens and a range ruler, used for tracking the effects of the Wave of Terror ability.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes of Normandie: Big Red One Edition – Battle for Caen: Operation Epsom, Charnwood & Goodwood
description:
July 1944, to liberate the city of Caen and its surroundings, the brave soldiers of His Majesty launched a series of operations which required 7 Infantry Divisions, 9 Armored Divisions and 4 Armored Brigades. They were fighting the biggest battle of the Normandy Campaign.

Relive those epic battles through the 6 scenarios of this campaign. From the hills south of Caen, to the heart of the city, fight house by house, grove by grove, until victory. Break through the German defense lines, destroy the tanks of the SS Panzer Divisions, and drive the Germans out of France! Long live the King!

You must have the Heroes of Normandie base game in order to use this Scenario Pack.

You can also combine this game with any Heroes System expansions.

This is Battle Pack #2, covering Operations Epsom - Charnwood - Goodwood.

— description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Lobotomy 2: Manhunt – Lobotomy 1 Monsters: From the Deep
description:
These miniature from the Lobotomy expansion "From the Deep" are now playable in Lobotomy 2 with the included Daily Nightmare cards! With this pack, you will be able to play two additional scenarios.

1 Dagon
4 Deep One
4 Siren
Miniatures in this set are the same as those in the original Lobotomy. If you already own these miniatures, check out the 'Lobotomy 1: Monster Conversion Set' add-on!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Movement Points, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Lobotomy 2: Manhunt – Lobotomy 1 Monsters: Cthulhu
description:
This Cthulhu miniature from Lobotomy 1 is now playable in Lobotomy 2 with the included Daily Nightmare card and the new monster card compatible with Lobotomy 2! With this pack, you will be able to play an additional Cthulhu scenario.

Miniature in this set is the same as those in the original Lobotomy. If you already own that miniature, check out the 'Lobotomy 1: Monster Conversion Set' add-on!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Movement Points, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Compendium
description:
Warcry: Compendium is your ultimate guide to assembling a Warcry warband to enter the depths of the Gnarlwood, accompanied by a powerful following of thralls, monsters, and allies. Within you will find a comprehensive list of rules for the second edition of Warcry, allowing you to command warriors from each of the Grand Alliances that dominate the Mortal Realms.

This 184-page softcover book is loaded with profiles and abilities for more than 40 existing warbands across all four Grand Alliances - the Sentinels of Order, Agents of Chaos, Bringers of Death, and Harbingers of Destruction - as well as the mighty allies, terrifying monsters, and bestial thralls that can be called upon to fight alongside them. These have all been updated for Warcry's second edition with balance adjustments, rules changes, and all-new Reactions to make your games even more dynamic and aggressive. It's everything you need to bring your existing collection into the Era of the Beast.

The warbands detailed in this book:

Sentinels of Order: Cities of Sigmar, Daughters of Khaine, Khainite Shadowstalkers, Fyreslayers, Idoneth Deepkin, Kharadron Overlords, Lumineth Realm-lords, Seraphon, Sylvaneth, Thunderstrike Stormcast, Stormcast Eternals (Sacrosanct Chamber, Vanguard Auxiliary Chamber, and Warrior Chamber)
Agents of Chaos: Blades of Khorne (Daemons and Bloodbound), Disciples of Tzeentch (Daemons and Arcanites), Maggotkin of Nurgle (Daemons and Rotbringers), Hedonites of Slaanesh (Daemons and Sybarites), Skaven, Slaves to Darkness, Iron Golems, Untamed Beasts, Corvus Cabal, Cypher Lords, The Unmade, Splintered Fang, Scions of the Flame, Spire Tyrants, Darkoath Savagers, and Tarantulos Brood
Bringers of Death: Flesh-eater Courts, Nighthaunt, Ossiarch Bonereapers, and Soulblight Gravelords
Harbingers of Destruction: Gloomspite Gitz, Gobbapalooza, Bonesplitterz, Ironjawz, Kruleboyz, and Ogor Mawtribes


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Quick-Draw Barstool
description:
This card is the participation promo of The Red Dragon Inn Organised Play Season 7 (2022).

The card is a Prize Card to be anted in a round of gambling when playing the Prize Variant. The winner of this round of gambling wins the Prize Card and follows its instructions:

"During your next Action Phase, you may not play an Action Card. Instead, add this card to the Prize Bin and pick another player. That player loses 3 Fortitude and you pay 1 Gold to the Inn."

The Organized Play Kits each contained 40 copies of this card (20 for each tournament) and 6 of the Bert's Half-Ass Ale (3 for each tournament).
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeon Universalis: Special Quest Book for Heroes
description:
Miniature Set + Special Quest Book & Cards

12 detailed resin miniatures (10 heroes + 2 bosses of the main campaigns: Raazbal & Edkard)

Special Quest Book for heroes in A5 size (a personalized quest for each hero: 10 quests)

20 cards (10x predesigned heroes + 10x background & items).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: ¡Extinción!: Dinosaurios de Película Dinosaurs from Movie
description:
Three new dinosaurs for the game Extinction, inspired by characters from the movie “Jurassic World Dominion”
It’s in a print and play format and it was released by the author of the game and 2D6 Magazine (a free Spanish games issue)

Tres nuevas cartas "print and play"

con tres personajes de película:
-"Blue" Velocirraptor
-Indominous Hybrid
-T-Rex Hybrid
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Volcanic Bird Enemy and the Voiced Concern
description:
"Volcanic Bird Enemy and the Voiced Concern" is a fantasy strategy wargame intended for 1-2 players designed by Lil Ugly Mane.

As Dennis, you must wander the board searching for keys which will unlock your memory. You will spend your turns moving, exploring hidden counters, eating, and entering the Duck cube Phase. When all memories have been unlocked, Dennis may exit the game board triumphant.

As Officer Beatrice, kill Dennis before he remembers stuff- Dennis must never remember stuff. You will spend your turns moving, exploring hidden counters, combating enemy creatures, Hunting Dennis, and entering the Duck cube Phase. You Once Dennis has been killed, Officer Beatrice may exit the board triumphant, yet remorseful.

'The night air feels frigid and wet, leaving it's brine on any traveler that dare wonder the city's streets. The steam rising out of the piss filled sewer dances with the low hanging fog, cobbling together a viscous wall of brume that paints the street lamps as rows of dreary giants, disdainfully permitting your passage.

Rising up in the distance, beyond the borders of the city, across the ruins and swamps, sits a lonely tower. It's foreboding spire piercing the hazy, tattered velvet of night like a beak. Through the hiss of the streets you hear a faint quacking...

"Dennis...is that you?..."'
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Rally Point Volume #19: ASL Starter Kit Special Study III
description:
Rally Point Volume 19: Starter Kit Special Study III is an ASL/ASL Starter Kit Compatible scenario pack that requires Starter Kits 1-4, Starter Kit Expansion Pack #1 and Starter Kit Bonus Pack #1. Each scenario is fully compatible with full ASL rules and ASL Starter Kit Rules. These 10 scenarios were playtested with consideration for both rules sets and are presented in the Schwerpunkt easy-to-read format on high-quality, collector grade cardstock.

RPT181 Changsha Chainsaw: CHANGSHA, China, 4 January 1942: A company sized element of the 10th Chinese Army with a supporting 70mm infantry gun defends the board k village against the 3rd Japanese Division which is attacking with 11 squads and a Type 92B light tank. Brook White designed this 5.5 turn scenario.

RPT182 The Horiuchi Hustle: LANGOAN, Celebes Island, The Netherlands East Indies, 11 January 1942: The Japanese 1st Company, 1st Yokosuka Special Naval Landing Force, 41st Brigade attacks to capture an airfield defended by three platoons of Dutch infantry with a 40mm AA gun from Tactical Command Kakas, Koninklijk Nederlands Indische Leger. This scenario uses boards q and t. Game Length is 4.5 turns.

RPT183 The Gotanda Gambit: BAKRI, Malaya, 18 January 1942: Three Type 95 Ha-Go tanks and a company of Japanese infantry from the Gotanda Tank Company and 5th Konoye Regiment, Imperial Guards Division attack to eliminate two Australian platoons of Company C, 2/29th Battalion, 45th Indian Infantry Brigade infantry and a 2-pounder AT gun that are defending a jungle road and village. This 4.5 turn scenario uses boards m and o.

RPT184 Cadets at the Crossroads: TOLHEK, Java, The Netherlands East Indies, 6 March 1942: A company of Japanese infantry from the Wakamatsu Battle Group attack a reinforced Dutch platoon from the Paardekoper “Improvised” Company, Koninklijk Nederlands Indische Leger (KNIL) that is defending a road junction and then launches a small Dutch counterattack. This 4.5 turn scenario is set on boards i and m.

RPT185 Sumatra Skirmish: PORSEA, Sumatra, The Netherlands East Indies, 14 March 1942: Group Van de Ploeg (consisting of two infantry platoons with two supporting Marmon Harrington armored cars) attempts to rescue the Porsea Garrison which is about to be surrounded by a Japanese infantry company from the Kokushi Detachment, Imperial Guards Division. Will Lieutenant Van de Ploeg rescue the garrison or will he have to stay and fight? This 5.5 turn scenario uses boards o and q.

RPT186 The Nut Lane Blockhouse: NAMUR, Kwajalein Atoll, The Marshall Islands, 2 February 1944: Medal of Honor recipient LTC Aquilla J. Dyess leads the 1st Battalion Landing Team and Company L, 24th Marines and Company B, 4th Tank Battalion, 4th Marine Division in an attack to clear fortified buildings defended by the Japanese 61st Guard Force Dispatched Force. This scenario uses board l. Game length is 4.5 turns.

RPT187 Herman’s Heater: Near LIMON, Leyte, Phillippines, 7 December 1944: Elements of 3rd Battalion, 127th Infantry Regiment, 32nd Infantry Division attacks with 19 squads to clear a ridge defended by a company of infantry from the Japanese 1st Division. Mike Augustine designed this 4.5 turn, action-packed demo charge and flamethrower thriller that uses boards m and n.

RPT188 Plugged By Vlug: South of LIMON, Leyte, Phillippines, 15 December 1944: Mike Augustine designed this 5-turn gem that honors Medal of Honor recipient PFC Dirk Vlug and uses boards n and o. It features a company of Japanese infantry from the 1st Division attacking with five supporting Type 95 Ha-Go tanks to clear a village defended by the American 1st Battalion, 126th Infantry Regiment, 32nd Infantry Division.

RPT189 Manila Madness: MANILA, near the Tondo District, 5 February 1945: The Tampa Group’s own Philippine scout, Hugh Downing designed this 5.5 turn gem. It features elements of the 145th Infantry, 37th Division (with two supporting M8 armored cars) attacking to clear the Japanese 1st Independent Naval Battalion from the town on boards j and k.

RPT190 Tenacious Takikawa: MUTANCHIANG, Manchuria, China, 16 January 1943: Mike Augustine designed this 4.5-turn action that features Russians from the 1st Red Banner Army attacking with two companies of infantry (and three supporting T-34 tanks) to clear elements of the 278th Infantry Regiment and the Takikawa Battalion from multi-hex stone buildings on boards m and u.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Space Race: Rally for Resources
description:
A space conglomerate-corporation is building a new Dyson Sphere in an uncharted galaxy. They're looking for a "go-to" crew of mercenaries and pioneers, so they've issued a galaxy-wide challenge... Bring them what they need in a timely manner and you'll be rewarded with a full-time contract(handsome salaries and benefits included).

Build a crew, mod your ship, and race against the other competing crews, to mine resources and battle your way to victory! This is an uncharted galaxy, so anything goes.

The game board is customizable and modular, so gameplay is different every time you play. Before you start the game, players will take turns placing game pieces for the session. You can play however you'd like!

A single mission card, showing which resources and how much of each are required, is drawn for the game session (all players will be racing to complete this). The first player to gather the requested resources and travels back to the space station wins the game. All players (given three random crew members) start at the space station at the beginning of the game, and roll dice to determine how far they can navigate that turn(crew skills can increase this roll).

Once a player has reached a planet or asteroid(each have their own unique resources) they can mine. You can mine a planet once per turn, for a max of two turns. Mining does not end your turn however, so its best to start it by mining every time.

You can also battle other players to steal their resources, eliminate crew members, or destroy any tech mods they may have. This requires you to be on the same spot as the opposing player however. Another way to use your turn is to spend any unneeded resources to upgrade your ship with tech mods or new crew members (max of 4).

Once a player has acquired the necessary resources to complete the mission card, they must navigate back to where they started the game. Once they have arrived, they win the game. Watch out for other players trying to steal your loot though!

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Dungeon Drop: Fire Gnome Promo Card
description:
This card was part of the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter.
Its a new race card:

"Fire Gnome
Speed: 2
Life: 3
Ability:
Tantrum: Your heaviest opponent chooses 2 treasures of different types in their stash. You choose and redrop one of them."
mechanics: Enclosure, Flicking, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: Khalkin-Gol War: Struggle for Mongolia, 1939
description:
Khalkin-Gol War: Struggle for Mongolia, 1939 is an operational-level, two-player wargame covering a “what if” Japanese-Soviet war in Mongolia in 1939. The historical campaign saw a series of limited actions in the late spring and early summer of 1939 along the Khalka River (Khalkin Gol) on the Manchukuoan/Outer Mongolian border. The campaign ended in a corps-level battle in August 1939 in which the Soviets decisively defeated the Japanese and produced a cease-fire between the two antagonists. The assumption of the game is that both Tokyo and Moscow decided instead to turn this into a full-scale war.

Each turn of play represents a month of operations. Each hex on the map is approximately 30 kilometers across. Ground units are mostly built around divisions, with breakdowns into brigades and regiments. Air units represent anything from an elite squadron to a mediocre group.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Casterly Rock Honor Guards
description:
Equipped with the finest plate armor, the Casterly Rock Honor Guard’s high defensive capabilities allow them to hold the line while exploiting opponents’ vulnerabilities and instilling them with panic. When facing the Honor Guard, opponents with Condition tokens should think twice, lest they wish to suffer the full might of the Honor Guard’s ‘Lannister Oppression’ ability! This unit includes a Sentinel Enforcer attachment. When attached to the unit, it provides players the Order Ability, ‘Taunt’ to coerce opponents into attacking the Honor Guard.

Approximate Height
Bannerman: 59mm
Sentinel Enforcer: 60mm
Honor Guard A: 49mm
Honor Guard B: 40mm
Honor Guard C: 41mm
Honor Guard D: 37mm

Contents:
13 Miniatures
‣ 1 Bannerman
‣ 1 Sentinel Enforcer
‣ 11 Honor Guards
1 Unit Cards
1 Attachment Card
1 Movement Tray
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Pocket Paragons: Space Lion
description:
Each player chooses a paragon and takes their deck of 7 unique cards. Every turn, players choose a card from their hand and play them simultaneously. Both cards are revealed and then characters either take damage, have their card canceled and sent back to their hand, or are defeated. Play the right card at the right time and have a strong read of your opponent's intentions to win!

This box features 8 original characters in the world of Space Lion.

-description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Uncanny X-Men Affiliation Pack
description: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Uncanny X-Men Affiliation Pack contains highly detailed miniatures of the X-Men Storm, Cyclops, Beast, and Wolverine in one convenient package. These miniatures are joined by the stat cards for these characters updated with the most recent graphic design. Finally, this pack also contains all the Team Tactic cards originally found in CP40 - Wolverine & Sabretooth and CP41 - Cyclops & Storm along with the Advanced R&D Team Tactic card found in CP43 - Mystique & Beast, ensuring players have everything they need to defend mutantkind from any threat
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Karate Kid: All Valley Tournament Unofficial Game
description:
Ladies and Gentlemen, welcome once again to the 1984 All Valley Karate tournament! We go live to the mat now, where fighters from Miyagi-Do face off against fighters from Cobra Kai.

The Karate Kid: All Valley Tournament Unofficial Game is a 2-8 player card game where teams of players represent the very best of two dojos featured in the Karate Kid franchise, Miyagi-Do, and Cobra Kai.

Only the strongest will survive with a mix of skill, timing, and luck to determine who is the champion!

Note: This is an unofficial game, and all copyrighted materials are the property of the original holders including artwork, IP material or other design elements.

—description from the designer
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Programmed Movement

name: Discordia Parades (fan expansion for Discordia)
description:
Discordia Parades is a fan-expansion for Discordia.

It replaces the Germanic raids with new opportunities for bonuses, rather than penalties for not fulfilling the random strength requirements of the original game.

The new parade tiles that replaces the A/B/C/D-tiles of the original game are revealed at the same times as before, but instead give 1 or 2 opportunities to have enough strength to get a reward. In order of total player strength, each player chooses to perform in 0, 1 or 2 parades and claim their rewards. Ties are resolved in reverse player order (where the player that was the "first player" in round 5 being last).

This expansion makes the game easier to finish before the end of the last round as you are more likely to get an additional reward or two.

—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, City Building, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Income, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers

name: Cool Cats
description:
Board Game Design Lab Finalist 2020



It's Caturday! In Cool Cats, you are helping lazy, entitled felines have the best day ever!

On each player's turn, they must take all cards of one value and assign those numbers by marking off each value on their sheet. The unique aspect of this adorably addictive flip and fill game is the bingo style play in which you will be able to deduce what numbers might appear as there are only 3 of each value in the deck (including the joker). Plan your day carefully based on what you are able to get because your opponents might have the same idea!

Each area on the player sheet can earn you style points toward your day or even help you create entertaining combos. Play with your human to keep them sharp (and get sweet bonuses as a reward), sleep in the sun to earn style points and extra numbers, beg for specific belly rubs that only a cat could be satisfied by and eat as much as you can to multiply your style points. Cool cats need bathroom breaks too-- so fill as many litter boxes as you can for big points!

Cool cats get bored quickly so once you take five cards or more, you are out of the round. Balance getting large sets of numbers with your aspirations to be the coolest cat on the block and diversify your choices. Style points can come easy if you plan right, but you'll have to work for them.

Multiplayer is only part of the game, however! Take on Feline Fiends who specialize in all sorts of feline chaos in two separate modes: Campaign and Free-For-All. In Campaign Mode, go solo or bring some friends to take on each Feline Fiend in order from Lucky Cat to Captain Ameowica to the all-powerful Sam and outsmart them in all of their pawfect skills. Players must work together to reach a point threshold while facing cats who don't like rules and take whatever they want. Should Campaign Mode be too stressful, take them on solo or with friends in any order you like in Free-For-All.

Cool Cats combines the flip and fill mechanic with drafting, press your luck and deduction into a print and play game that feels bigger than the sheet of paper and marker you are using.

-An earlier version of this game was a finalist for the Board Game Design Lab Challenge in 2020.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Bingo, Deduction, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: Cards Christians Like: The Expansion Box Vol. 1
description: The Expansion Box Vol. 1 comes with 300 hilarious new cards to add to your Cards Christians Like deck. These combos will have your friends rollin', your parents cryin', and your grandma clutchin' her pearls.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Beyond Mission to Planet Hexx
description:
In Episode II: Beyond Mission to Planet Hexx, the race to uncover the mysteries of Planet Hexx expands to encompass the inhabitants of dozens more fascinating worlds. Background characters from the original game shift to become the focus of the story, as totally new characters are introduced.

"Ever since members of the first successful expedition to Planet Hexx returned to tell the tale, the Star Academy, the Snooger Conglomerate, and even the Empress herself have all taken an interest. Will YOU be the first to uncover the awesome secrets of this remarkable world?"

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ill Met in Flanders: The Battle of Fleurus, August 29, 1622
description:
The battle of Fleurus was fought during the so-called Bohemian phase of the Thirty Years War, but the battle occurred in the Flanders, fought between a Catholic Spanish army under the command of Gonzalo de Cordoba and a Protestant Protestant army led by mercenary leaders Mansfeld and Christian of Brunswick. The battle of Fleurus was initiated by a call from the Protestant Dutch to relieve the city of Breda, then under siege by another Spanish army under the command of Ambrogio Spinola. The aim of the Protestant troops was to cut off the retreat and trap the Spaniards, not just to end the siege.

The Protestant army encountered their opponents near Fleurus, and a furious battle ensued, where the better led (even if weaker) Spanish army was able to crush their Protestant enemy and provide a means of retreat for Spinola’s force.

Each combat unit represents from 300 to 1000 soldiers, and it is rated, from left to right, for combat factor, morale factor and movement factor. Each infantry strength point is around 150 men, each cavalry strength point around 60 men. Each leader is rated for Command (indicating how many activation chits that leader has) and Movement. Each hex is about 100 meters. Each turn represents a half hour of time.

Players draw leader markers from an opaque container (mug, envelope) to activate their leaders' formations. Units move about a hex map of the battlefield and use a six-sided die to resolve combat.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Transformers Deck-Building Game: Bonus Pack 5
description: A promo pack for Transformers Deck-Building Game containing 2 new characters (Windblade & Ramjet), and two new main deck cards (Miner Megatron & Orion Pax).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: まじかる☆キングダム - パネテリア王都争乱 (Magical Kingdom: Riot in the Royal Capital)
description:
Second expansion to Magical Kingdom. A magical girl studying a forbidden spellbook has her mind taken over by the evil Witch of Calamity, who incites a civil war that engulfs the capital of Panteria, the Country of Bread. The queen must call on the power of heaven to help bring the civil war to an end.

This expansion adds a new mechanic allowing buildings to be scrapped after they are built for bonuses, in addition to new cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Mango Cabana
description:
In the fast card game Mango Cabana, players compete to schedule the best acts at their night clubs. Score points for placing the act on the best nights. Specialize in comedy, drama, or magic acts. Host divas but watch out as having too many might cost you points!

Players draft cards in order to place the best acts in their clubs. Select cards with a minimum of rules and assess the game state. Schedule 6 performers each. Whoever has the best combination of talent scheduled while avoiding penalties wins.

To be the coolest nightclub in town, you have to get the hottest acts. Welcome to Mango Cabana- The Fruity Nightclub Game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Al Final del Arcoíris
description:
At the end of the rainbow there is a pot with gold coins, you have to try to reach it before the leprechaun does.

This game allows children ages 3 and up to have fun since they don't need to read or add to play. They can participate from 2 to 6 players.

The journey is made by the characters on the beautiful rainbow according to the colored clovers they obtain. But beware! the goblin can also advance and try to get there first.

Al Final del Arcoíris can be reached in two ways: in cooperative mode, collaborating among all the participants to reach the goal, or it can also be reached in competitive mode, trying to reach the goal before the leprechaun and before everything else. the rest of the participants.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Beta Ray Bill & Ulik
description:
Players can shatter mountains and break storms with the new characters in Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Beta Ray Bill & Ulik.

After proving himself to none other than Odin in a duel with Thor, Beta Ray Bill was awarded his own magic hammer for his bravery. Now he travels the galaxy as the defender of all who seek his help, no matter which realm they hail from. Joining him is Ulik, the strongest and fiercest of all Rock Trolls. Armed with knuckle dusters made from the same metal as Thor's mighty hammer, Ulik won't stop swinging until his foes are smashed to dust.

Alongside the beautifully sculpted miniatures of these characters, this pack also includes three Team Tactic cards that unlock even more ways for players to use them in battle.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Tails of the Sea
description:
Be the first to build a wealth of bones, through exploration, trade or piracy. Expand your pack of Muttley Crue and do what dog pirates do best - bury your treasure of bones, mark your 'terriertory' or perhaps challenge your opponents to a dastardly doggy dice duel!

Borrow against your pack's goodwill to achieve success, but don't push your luck too far, or you might end up with a 'muttiny' on your paws!

Play competitively or in co-op and solo games modes against the menacing Measley Moggy Fleet!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Exploration, Humor, Pirates, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Market, Movement Points, Push Your Luck, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement

name: Buried Beneath: A Shallow Grave
description:
Buried Beneath: A Shallow Grave is an expansion for Buried Beneath.

The gameplay is the same as the base game but the expansion adds tons of new content and also brings new modes and features to make play more difficult, varied and give you more ways to mount your defense.

New Content:
7 Heroes,
8 Monsters,
4 Bosses,
40 Items,
28 Locations.

New Actions/Stats:
You’ll find new symbols strewn across the village. The Looking Glass and Hammer offer new actions while the Gold Coins
offer both a new action and act as a new stat.

New Mechanics:
The shady Shop Keeper may offer helpful weapons and accessories that boost stats and give you access to one time bonuses or abilities. Make sure you buy what you want though as it might get more expensive or go out of stock!

New Party Mode: (Adds Cooperative support)
“As chance would have it, an old party member of yours was visiting the day of the attack and the two of you have taken up arms once again, just like the good old days...”
Manage the party solo or invite a friend to help you save the village!

"Rumors tell of a Travelin’ Merchant more keen on linin’ ‘is pockets wit’ gold than worry about the danger of stayin’ here.

Oy, it’s said he’s already setup in the village, and that ‘is wears is worth a lookin’… What say ye, shall we pay ‘im a visit and see for ourselves?"

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Movement Points, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Illimat: Syzygy Coin
description:
The Illimat Syzygy Coin: A bronze challenge coin that when used as an okus has official gameplay properties. The coin uses the Luminary Sun & Initiate Moon illustrations by Carson Ellis from the game Illimat.

The Luminary Matriarch added a special rule when using the Syzygy Coin as an okus. When a player clears a field and collects the Syzygy Coin, they must immediately flip the coin; this occurs before drawing cards, refilling the field, or revealing the Luminary.

If this flip reveals the Sun, it’s Opposition. The player who claimed the coin must give one card from their hand to each of the other players in the game, beginning with the players to their left and continuing clockwise.

If this flip reveals the Moon, it’s a Conjunction. The player who claimed the coin must take one card chosen at random from the hand of each player, beginning with the player to their left and continuing clockwise.

The effects of the Syzygy will leave one or more players with more than four cards in their hand. This is temporary. Players only draw cards at the end of the turn if they have fewer than four cards in their hand.

The coin was originally commissioned by Benjamin Franklin to circulate the meeting dates of his local Philadelphia society chapter. Today, its minted in partnership with the artisans who bring the worlds of The Lord of The Rings, Game of Thrones, Labyrinth, and The Kingkiller Chronicles into the palm of your hands, Shire Post Mint.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Gemble
description:
Gemble is a push-your-luck card and dice game for 2 to 4 players. Players take turns rolling the dice and gambling to collect suits of gem cards matching private goals indicated on gem tokens. However, they will need cards from as many suits as possible in order to make bets.

The rules are simple: roll the gem die and carry out the following actions:

1.Collect one card if there are cards in the pot (market) matching the color of the die roll.

2.Make a bet by rolling the dot die if there are no cards in the pot matching the color of the die roll, or, if you want to collect more than one card from the pot.

If you make a succesful bet you may collect one card for a single match or all cards of one color for a double match. If you fail, you must move your bet cards to the pot.

At the end of the game, the cards matching your private goals will add points to your score while the other cards will subtract points.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Matching, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: S.55: Wings over the Atlantic
description:
Seaplanes have been used for impressive flights across the Oceans in early 20th Century. Savoia Marchetti S.55 has been one of the most famed machines, used by Italian and foreign pilots for their solitary and mass flights.
This game allows to challenge the huge expanses of Soputhern and Northern Atlantic, the weather, the mechanic failures to reach cheering crowds in far off-cities, on the path of Francesco De Pinedo, Italo Balbo, João Ribeiro de Barros and others.
Each of the 2 to 5 players must organize his own raid fighting time and perils; a solo variant is also included. Each turn, the player decides if to take off toward the next stopping place, to be chosen carefully since a linger stage means higher risks, or if to wait to prepare better. Game events are taken by historical pilots' diaries. Basic rules for a generic public are integrated by advanced ones considering plane enhancements, night flights, wind and other elements for a more realistic game.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Industry / Manufacturing, Miniatures, Racing, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Movement Template, Multiple Maps, Point to Point Movement, Race, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Hegemony in the Late Han Dynasty
description:
Hegemony in the Late Han Dynasty – The Rise of Heroes is a board game that supports 2-5 players. It includes hand management, campaigns, resource production, region control, and other mechanics.
In the game, the player controls a hero and his camp during the Three Kingdoms period in ancient China. Each player has an initial general and army. Get the most territory, win the most victories, recruit the most generals and the most Fame Points by managing different actions, different administrative measures, using different generals to fight, produce and upgrade through strategy cards
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Dice, Economic, Medieval, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Moving Multiple Units, Zone of Control

name: Northern Skies
description: Northern Skies is a fast paced bidding card game for 2-5 players, played in 3 rounds and lasts around 30 minutes. Northern Skies’ simple mechanics allow players to learn the game fast and the depth will leave you wanting to play again and again.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding

name: Imperial Settlers: Alternative Production Cards
description:
During the setup, overlay the appropriate Alternative Production card onto your Faction board's Production section.

—description from the publisher

The expansion consists of four cards representing alternate production. Images suggest a connection to the four basic factions, however, nothing in the rules mentions that.

—user summary
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Masters of the Universe: Battleground – Hordak on Mantisaur
description:
While on Beast Island, Hordak spotted a gargantuan praying mantis and ordered his subordinates to ensnare her. The mantis tore an entire squad of Horde Troopers to pieces but she succumbed to Mosquitor's cunning plans. From that point onwards, the leader of the Evil Horde prides himself on his unique mount, the Mantisaur.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Stroganov: Turukhan
description:
Return to the vast Siberian wilderness in this expansion for the beloved game by famous designer Andreas Steding: Stroganov.

As you cross the Turukhan river and establish new relationships with the local population, you will embark on new adventures that will spice up your game of Stroganov.

This expansion consists of 4 different modules. You can combine these at will to create a new gaming experience each time you play the game.

Module 1: the Siberian chipmunk introduced a new type of fur tile to collect. this might appear to have no apparent value at first, but a travelling merchant and collector will appear on the map, allowing you to exchange these rare furs for valuable advantages.

Module 2: the Hunting plans introduces a new way to help you fulfil the Tzar’s wishes. As you hunt for specific furs, you can spend hunting marker steps to lower the amount of requested fur tiles on any Tzar’s Wish.

Module 3: New Landscapes adds two new types of landscape tiles to the game. The Characters count as a wild type of landscape tile and give your permanent abilities for the rest of the game once you acquire them. The sacred places introduce a fifth type of landscape and will earn you VP at the end of the game if you meet certain conditions.

Module 4: the Diplomacy track will allow you to trade with the locals by showing signs of good faith. The more generous you are, the more of an advantage you can win over your competitors. Time your actions well and earn many riches and fame.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Map Addition, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement

name: Battletech: Essentials
description:
Strap into your BattleMech's cockpit and charge into the most important fight of your life! Soldiers from across the Inner Sphere are drawn to the Game World of Safaris VII, where they seek glory, fame, and fortune in live-fire arena combat, before rotating back to their empires' fields of battle. Yet only the best and most aggressive gladiators will succeed. Will you claw your way to the top of the leaderboards and be immortalized for all time, or will you go down in flames to the sound of thunderous applause.
BattleTech is the world's greatest armored combat game, filled with epic stories and gaming experiences to satiate any player, from miniatures to RPG play, hobby painting to fiction, and beyond. BattleTech Essentials is a first step on that fantastic journey and includes everything you need to get started: two high-quality miniatures, quick-start rules, a mapsheet, cards to represent your Mech Warrior's unique skills, dice, and more.
Do you have what it takes to conquer the arenas of the Game World and become a legend? Leap into the action and find out!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Vs System 2PCG: The New Brotherhood
description:
The New Brotherhood is the second issue of the Heroes of Krakoa Story Arc. This 55-card set includes Super Villains across the Marvel Universe and chronicles the chaos they have unleashed upon humanity. Though mutants now find themselves thriving perhaps more than ever on Krakoa, there are still those that contest that harmony. Those foes and shifters of the status quo are on their way to your decks with Vs System 2PCG: The New Brotherhood.

When you build to great heights, you have more to lose when the flame rises. One thing is certain though, that nothing will deter mutantkind from their goals. With the X-Men and Brotherhood working together for the good of all, seemingly nothing can stop the united Homo Superior.

Play as 26 Main Characters including new versions of returning favorites and others appearing for the first time!

description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Revelando Emoções
description:
It all begins when...
While organizing our move, we found a lost box, forgotten a long time ago. Upon opening it, we discovered many photographs. We quickly called everyone to come and see the photos and remember each moment that was captured.
Do we have the same memories of those moments? What feelings do we perceive when we look at them?
We sat in a circle and pulled out the first photo...

Players: 2+

How to play:

The game is played in a series of levels, and players win by reaching level 5. The game begins with two revealed pictures, and one player must choose a feeling card and secret selects a picture that he/she thinks best relates to the feeling, then the other players have to vote on which of the open pictures corresponds to the chosen feeling.

Then they must choose a single voting token that indicates how many spaces the pawn will move on the track, depending on whether the guess is correct or incorrect. Then a new picture is opened, and the next player to the left must remove the chosen picture and reveal a new one, and they must open a new feeling card so that there are always 4 cards available.

If the voted picture is the one chosen by the player, the level marker moves to the right the number of spaces indicated on the voting token. If the guess is incorrect, the marker moves to the left.

If the level marker reaches 0, everyone loses immediately, regardless of the level (it doesn't go back to the previous level). When the picture is chosen correctly, the marker moves to the right the number of spaces indicated on the voting token. If the marker reaches the star, the next level is reached. The marker goes back to space 5, and an additional picture is revealed. There are 3 pictures at level 3, 4 pictures at level 4, and 5 pictures at level 5. To win, you need to reach the star at level 5.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Voting

name: Battle for Byzantium
description:
Battle for Byzantium is a historical action/ conquest board game set in the Byzantine Empire in the year 1025 which features several elements and references from the Byzantine Empire. Here, with the death of the emperor Basil II, 4 warriors from within and beyond the empire all compete for control of the Byzantine Empire taking advantage of the weak position the empire is at considering that its strong ruler had just died. In this 4-player dice game, players can choose from among the said 4 characters being Demetrios the Byzantine Cataphract commander, Al-Sadin the Arab general, Jean-Pierre the Norman adventurer-knight, and Freydis the female Varangian warrior. The objective is to capture all 18 on the map and the winner is the player with the most number of cities. To play the game, players must roll the dice and thus move across the golden mosaic tiles in the map of the Byzantine Empire in 1025. If players land on any red porphyry tiles by the roll of the dice, they are to select action cards. There are 7 different kinds of action cards and each has a different function. Once used, cards must be surrendered to the discard pile.

One of the 7 action cards that players randomly select when landing on the red porphyry tile is the "Gain Gold" card which allows a player to move 4 steps forward, though this card can be kept for future use especially when 4 steps are needed to capture a city or land on a red porphyry tile, and once used this card must be surrendered. The second kind of action card is the "Gain an Army" card which allows players to capture any open city- except the capital Constantinople- on the map only when landing on it with the roll of the dice, and once used this card must be surrendered. The third kind of action card is the "Besiege a City" card which allows players to automatically capture the city closest to them without landing on it with the roll of the dice, thus when selecting this card the player must move his or her character to the city he or she captures, but once used the card must be surrendered. The fourth kind of action card is the "Plague" card, and when a player selects it he or she must move his or her character to the location known as Ragusa on the upper-left corner of the map where a player loses a turn due to plague, and again after the card is used it must be surrendered. The fifth kind of action card is the "Greek Fire" card which when selected forces a player to return his or her character to its starting point on the map, and again after the card is used it must be surrendered. The sixth kind of action card is the "Rebellion" card which when being selected forces a player to lose one city, however if a player selects this card without owning a city yet then the card has no use, and again after being used the card must be surrendered. Last but not least is the "Sack a City" card which has the most powerful function as when being selected, players can steal any owned city by another player, however this card can only work if an opponent already owns a city, and once being used the card has to be immediately surrendered.

Each of the 4 in-game characters have their own special abilities which can however only be used ONCE. For those who play as the Byzantine Demetrios, the "Greek Fire" card when being selected can be used once in the game to capture an open city. If a player chooses to play the Arab Al-Sadin, he or she is immune to the "Rebellion" card only once in the game which means when selecting it one does not lose a city. When playing as the Norman Jean-Pierre, the player for at least once in the game is immune to the plague when selecting the "Plague" card. Lastly for those playing as the Varangian Freydis, one "Gain an Army" card can be used twice for only one time in the game to capture not just one but two open cities. Additionally, players can use the game's 2 "Gain a Navy" functions- wherein both are located on opposite sides of the map to capture any city of their choosing, though each "Gain a Navy" function can only be used once in the game. When playing the game, each player is given a pouch with their respective color- red for Demetrios, green for Al-Sadin, blue for Jean-Pierre, and gold for Freydis- and inside the pouches are 18 conquests tokens each wherein these round tokens have the first letter of the respective character's name on them. When capturing a city, players must place the token with the first letter of their character's name on the city they take. Once a city is taken by a player, he or she must claim the city's respective illustrated city card in which there are 18 of them (one per city) depicting a Byzantine landmark of the city and on the back side of the card some information on the city. Capturing the imperial capital Constantinople meanwhile is different from capturing other cities in the map as first of all, Constantinople cannot be captured with the "Besiege a City" card while it also requires 2 "Gain an Army" cards to acquire it. Other ways to take Constantinople includes using the "Gain a Navy" function or using the "Sack a City" card if another player already owns it. Owning Constantinople however has a lot of benefits which for one includes being immune to the "Rebellion" card, thus those who own Constantinople cannot lose any city except Constantinople if another player steals it with the "Gain a Navy" or "Sack a City" card.

When playing the game, the action cards may run out in the middle of the game. If this happens at the middle of the game, players can choose to end it when the action cards have run out and thus the player with the most number of cities at this point wins the game. However, in the full version of the game, once the action cards run out they must be reshuffled and once that's done the game resumes. The full version of the game ends when all 18 cities on the map have been taken, and once this happens players must count the number of cities they own. The one with the highest number of cities thus wins the game, though at the end Constantinople is equivalent to 2 points, and thus the player who owns Constantinople has 2 additional points.

–description from designer
mechanics: Action Points

name: Apocalypso
description:
Only one of you will escape the Island alive. Who will that be? Apocalypso is a fast-paced dice game where players aim to be the last one standing. The game starts with the youngest player and moves clockwise from there. Each player gets to roll the dice up to three times to achieve their desired roll.

This is a fun and exciting party game that requires strategy and luck. With its easy-to-follow rules and quick gameplay, it's a great choice for game night with friends and family.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Player Elimination

name: Unmask the Werewolves
description:
Recently, the village of Kalisburgh has been plagues by werewolves! If they want to live to tell the tale, the villagers will have to unite and eradicate the grisly infestation! Will you discover the werewolves?

Each player is secretly assigned a role - Werewolf, Villager, Seer or one of the other unique roles. There is also a Moderator who controls the flow of the game. This is a very social deduction game that requires no equipment to play, and can accommodate almost any large group of players.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Sudds & Malone
description:
You are each a mouse private detective working to solve a conspiracy in 1938 New York City. Each turn you’ll investigate case files which when closed, lead to hunches about the larger conspiracy. You’ll travel around the city to collect evidence, talk to snitches, improve your skills and use your moxy (and occasionally your pistol) while the cat threatens the leader. When the game is over, the conspiracy is revealed and you’ll discover if your hunches were right!

Starting with the first player and proceeding clockwise, on your turn, you must select 1 die and take a Dice Action and then optionally Close Files from your hand of cards. Play proceeds until all players have taken 4 Dice Actions. This ends a round - events are resolved and the cat threatens the leader. The detective badge is passed to the left and that player now rolls all of the dice to begin the next round. The game continues this way until 5 rounds have completed. Players then add up end game bonus points plus their points scored during the game. Highest score wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Tenth Edition): Ultimate Starter Set
description:
Across the far-flung worlds of the Imperium of Mankind, in a galaxy riven by warp storms and unceasing conflict, the armies of Humanity battle for survival. With the Imperium already standing upon the brink of annihilation, the Tyranid hive fleets emerge from the cold void between the stars. The Space Marines stand as the last line of defence between this ravenous alien menace and the beleaguered worlds of the Imperium.

Take the plunge into the 41st Millennium with the Ultimate Starter Set for Warhammer 40,000. This box gives you a complete introductory experience, with loads of incredible models, a battlefield to fight over, helpful guides, and all the dice, tools, and rules you need to play your first games. Pick the noble Space Marines or swarming Tyranids, give control of the other army to a friend or family member, and battle it out for hours of entertainment. There’s no better way to get into the Warhammer 40,000 hobby – this box is also an excellent way to expand your existing collections.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: A Feeble and Negligent Action: The Battle of Stoney Creek, June 6, 1813
description:
British prospects in Canada were rather gloomy in the Spring of 1813 as American forces began invading that British colony once again, with their main efforts concentrating on wresting control of the Niagara Peninsula away from the Crown. On May 27th British forces near the north end of the Niagara River were forced to retreat into the sanctuary of Fort George by an American force led by Generals Henry Dearborn and William Winder. After successfully withdrawing nearly all of the other outposts along the river following the American invasion of the Niagara Peninsula, Brigadier General John Vincent began planning for ways to strike back at the Americans, whose force was joined by another led by General John Chandler. Local informants, along with a daring night-time reconnoitering by Colonel John Harvey of the American encampment at Stoney Creek near what is today Hamilton, Ontario, disclosed the lackadaisical nature of the American deployment. Although outnumbered by nearly a five-to-one margin, General Vincent ordered a risky night assault, counting upon superior knowledge of the local terrain, surprise, as well as training with his regulars. The battle that resulted was one of the most intense and lop-sided battles fought in Upper Canada.

Can you do as well, or better, than your historical counterparts?

Each copy of A Feeble and Negligent Action is composed of the following:

• One 11 by 17 inch map with Turn Record Track.
• 100 double-sided counters.
• 8 pages of rules.

Players will also need a six-sided die and a standard deck of playing cards to play the game.

Each hex is approximately 35 yards across, a regular or militia infantry unit is 150-150 men, and artillery units represent 1 cannon or mortar. A turn represents 15 minutes of time. The types of units in the game are Infantry (Regular, Militia), Dragoon Cavalry, Artillery and Leaders.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: H.D.P.: Hasta Donde Puedas – Dibujame
description: H.D.P.: Dibujame is a great game for previews, with good H.D.P. humor but, this time, a lot of sketchy, bizarre drawings, with double meanings and a bit of a bad mood so that another player will try to guess what you meant. And as always, the most H.D.P. is the one who will win.
mechanics: Drawing

name: Únikovka: Operace Anthropoid
description:
Original Czech escape game follows events from the time of Assassination of Reinhard Heydrich. In this story you will act as an unknown member of Czech resistance, trying to make his best to stop the Czech Occupation.

This escape game is a variation on popular escape games where players are locked in a room and are trying to get out of it.
categories: Card Game, Puzzle, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Oltréé: Montures & Destriers
description:
Oltréé is a cooperative and narrative game in which each scenario, called Chronicle, offers a rich and unique setting, with its atmosphere, unique plot, challenges, friends and foes! Each turn will confront you with hard choices, forcing you to manage your actions carefully to fulfill your quest!
